original: 'di ga las rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las rtogs she na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is this understood?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa ni /
translated: The answer is:

original: yang dag min pa bzlog don du //
analyzed: yang dag min pa bzlog don du //
translated: In order to reverse incorrectness,

original: 'khrul pa bzlog pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das des yang dag nyid gsungs /
analyzed: 'khrul pa bzlog pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das des yang dag nyid gsungs /
translated: the BhagavƒÅn taught reality.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir de nyid thams cad mkhyen pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma @28a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir de nyid thams cad mkhyen pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma @28a * //
translated: For that reason, he alone is omniscient, not others.

original: yin no // de lta na yang tshad ma yin no //üîΩde'i phyir / sgrub byed la ltos tshad yin rigs //
analyzed: yin no // de lta na yang tshad ma yin no // de'i phyir / sgrub byed la ltos tshad yin rigs //
translated: Even so, he is valid cognition.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: It is reasonable that valid cognition depends on the probandum.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyid yin gyi //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyid yin gyi //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn himself is valid cognition,

original: rig byed ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rig byed ni ma yin no //
translated: but the Vedas are not.

original: rig byed ni 'ga' yang don dang 'brel pa med pas tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: rig byed ni 'ga' yang don dang 'brel pa med pas tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: The Vedas are not valid cognition because they are not related to any object.

original: 'di ni tshad ma'i yul la bden par gsung ba nyid kyis tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni tshad ma'i yul la bden par gsung ba nyid kyis tshad ma yin no //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn is valid cognition because he himself taught that the object of valid cognition is true.

original: gzhan la ni bshad par bya'o //üîΩyang na don dam pa de ldan te /
analyzed: gzhan la ni bshad par bya'o // yang na don dam pa de ldan te /
translated: Others should be explained.üîΩAlternatively, the BhagavƒÅn is valid cognition because he possesses the ultimate,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang gnyis su med par rtogs pa nyid kyis tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang gnyis su med par rtogs pa nyid kyis tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: and he realizes nonduality.

original: don thams cad yongs su shes pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don thams cad yongs su shes pas ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not by knowing all things,

original: don thams cad yongs su shes pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yin pas kun rdzob pa nyid do //
analyzed: don thams cad yongs su shes pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad yin pas kun rdzob pa nyid do //
translated: for knowing all things is a worldly convention, and so it is conventional.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: And it is said:

original: gnyis med theg pa dam pa yin //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis med theg pa dam pa yin // zhes bshad do //
translated: The supreme vehicle is nondual.

original: tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi rgyan las /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi rgyan las /
translated: The Ornament of the Middle Way

original: tshad ma grub pa'i rnam 'grel gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: tshad ma grub pa'i rnam 'grel gnyis pa'o /
translated: The second chapter of the Pramanavarttika

original: // / gal te mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshad ma ma yin na /üîΩde'i tshe dbang phyug la sogs pa shes pa po rtag pa nyid dam /
analyzed: // / gal te mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshad ma ma yin na / de'i tshe dbang phyug la sogs pa shes pa po rtag pa nyid dam /
translated: If direct perception and inference are not valid cognitions, then omniscience is not a valid cognition.

original: rig byed rtag pa tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: rig byed rtag pa tshad ma yin te /
translated: In that case, is a permanent knower such as God or the eternal Vedas a valid cognition?

original: des na gzhan btsal bas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: des na gzhan btsal bas ci bya zhe na /
translated: If so, then what is the use of seeking another?

original: tshad ma rtag pa nyid yod min //
analyzed: tshad ma rtag pa nyid yod min //
translated: Valid cognition is not permanent.

original: dngos yod rtog pa tshad phyir dang // shes bya mi rtag pa nyid kyis //
analyzed: dngos yod rtog pa tshad phyir dang // shes bya mi rtag pa nyid kyis //
translated: Because things exist, conceptual thought is valid, and because objects of knowledge are impermanent,

original: des ni mi brten nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni mi brten nyid phyir ro //
translated: it is not tenable that they are permanent.

original: rim bzhin skye ba can dag ni //
analyzed: rim bzhin skye ba can dag ni //
translated: Those that arise sequentially

original: rtags las skye ba mi 'thad phyir //
analyzed: rtags las skye ba mi 'thad phyir //
translated: Because arising from a sign is untenable.

original: ltos pa mi rung pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ltos pa mi rung pa'i phyir /
translated: Because dependence is not tenable.

original: rtag pa gtan du gnas pa'i tshad ma ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa gtan du gnas pa'i tshad ma ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: A valid cognition that is permanent and endures forever does not exist,

original: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no valid cognition.

original: gzhan yang dngos po yod pa'i rtogs pa tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po yod pa'i rtogs pa tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the realization of the existence of things is valid cognition,

original: gang yang rung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but anything else is not.

original: gang gis rtogs pa gtan du yod par 'gyur ba dngos po ni gtan du gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis rtogs pa gtan du yod par 'gyur ba dngos po ni gtan du gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: The thing whose realization is permanent does not endure forever.

original: des na shes bya mi rtag pa nyid kyis de yang mi brtan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na shes bya mi rtag pa nyid kyis de yang mi brtan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because objects of knowledge are impermanent, it is unstable.

original: gal te shes bya mi rtag pas na shes pa mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di dag ga las she na /
analyzed: gal te shes bya mi rtag pas na shes pa mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di dag ga las she na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is it that if objects of knowledge are impermanent, consciousness is impermanent?‚Äù

original: shes bya'i rang bzhin la bya ba byed pa'am /üîΩshes bya'i rang bzhin las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: shes bya'i rang bzhin la bya ba byed pa'am / shes bya'i rang bzhin las skyes pa'am /
translated: It is because consciousness functions with respect to the nature of objects of knowledge,üîΩit arises from the nature of objects of knowledge,

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid tshad ma yin grang ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid tshad ma yin grang ste /
translated: or it is the nature of that.

original: phyogs gzhan ni mi srid do //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan ni mi srid do //
translated: It is not possible that it is any other way.

original: de la gal te byed ba dang mi byed pa khyad par med na ci ltar byed pa dang cig shos rnam par 'byed /
analyzed: de la gal te byed ba dang mi byed pa khyad par med na ci ltar byed pa dang cig shos rnam par 'byed /
translated: If there is no difference between that which is active and that which is not active, then how could one distinguish that which is active from that which is not?

original: @28b 'on te de ni me long gi gnas lta bu yin te /
analyzed: @28b 'on te de ni me long gi gnas lta bu yin te /
translated: But if you say that it is like a mirror,

original: don gang dang gang nye ba de dang de nyid snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don gang dang gang nye ba de dang de nyid snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: then whatever object is near it appears in it.

original: 'o na ni rang gi tshogs pa las don nyid de ltar 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na ni rang gi tshogs pa las don nyid de ltar 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: But in that case, the object itself would appear in that way due to its own collection of parts,

original: shes pa po'i byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa po'i byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but the activity of the cognizer would not be.

original: 'on te mig mi g-yo bar phye bas nye bar bstan pa'i don rim gyis mthong yang byed pa gzhan dang gzhan mi 'dra ba gzhan ni 'ga' yang rtogs pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mig mi g-yo bar phye bas nye bar bstan pa'i don rim gyis mthong yang byed pa gzhan dang gzhan mi 'dra ba gzhan ni 'ga' yang rtogs pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that when the eye is open and unmoving, the object that is revealed is seen gradually, but the activity of the eye is not understood to be different from that which is different, then it is like this.

original: 'di la bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa /
translated: In response to this, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: rjes su 'gro dang ldog pa las //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro dang ldog pa las //
translated: Because of following and reversing,

original: der yang mig ni byed pa nyid //
analyzed: der yang mig ni byed pa nyid //
translated: the eye is active in that.

original: dbang phyug rtag par gnas pa la //
analyzed: dbang phyug rtag par gnas pa la //
translated: But for ƒ™≈õvara, who is said to be permanent,

original: rjes 'gro ldog pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: rjes 'gro ldog pa yod ma yin //
translated: following and reversing do not exist.

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'gyur ba de ni don de nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'gyur ba de ni don de nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, in that case, that object itself would be like that.

original: 'di la 'dzin pa'i byed pa ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ci ltar tshad ma yin /
analyzed: 'di la 'dzin pa'i byed pa ni 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ci ltar tshad ma yin /
translated: Because there is no activity of apprehending at all, how could it be a valid cognition?

original: 'on te de tshad ma'i don yin mod /
analyzed: 'on te de tshad ma'i don yin mod /
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúIt is the object of valid cognition,

original: de ni de dang 'brel pa'i phyir des shes par brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: de ni de dang 'brel pa'i phyir des shes par brjod do zhe na /
translated: but it is said to be known by that because it is related to it,‚ÄùüîΩthat is not tenable.

original: de ni mi 'thad de 'di ltar /üîΩ'brel pa rjes 'gro sngon 'gro ba //
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad de 'di ltar / 'brel pa rjes 'gro sngon 'gro ba //
translated: Because:üîΩThe relation is not established

original: ldog pa yis ni 'grub pa yin //üîΩrtag pa ldog pa med pa la //
analyzed: ldog pa yis ni 'grub pa yin // rtag pa ldog pa med pa la //
translated: by following or preceding.

original: 'brel pa srid pa ga la yin //
analyzed: 'brel pa srid pa ga la yin //
translated: How could there be a relationüîΩwith a permanent thing that does not cease?

original: rtag pa ldog pa med pa ni 'gar yang nye bar sbyor bar shes nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa ldog pa med pa ni 'gar yang nye bar sbyor bar shes nus pa ma yin no //
translated: A permanent thing that does not cease cannot be known to be related to anything.

original: 'on te des mthong ba'i phyir nye bar sbyor pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te des mthong ba'i phyir nye bar sbyor pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúIt is related because it sees,‚Äù

original: ci ltar na des mthong zhes de nyid de ltar brgal zhing brtag pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ci ltar na des mthong zhes de nyid de ltar brgal zhing brtag pa ma yin nam /
translated: why is it not the case that ‚Äúit sees‚Äù is just like that, a matter of debate and investigation?

original: de ltar de yod na 'byung phyir //
analyzed: de ltar de yod na 'byung phyir //
translated: Because it arises when that exists,

original: des zhes bya bar brjod na ni //
analyzed: des zhes bya bar brjod na ni //
translated: if you say, ‚ÄúIt is said to be by that,‚Äù

original: nam mkha' sogs la de yod phyir //
analyzed: nam mkha' sogs la de yod phyir //
translated: because that exists in space and so on,

original: ci ltar de nyid lta po yin //
analyzed: ci ltar de nyid lta po yin //
translated: how could it be a seer?

original: mkha' la don byed bstan med phyir //
analyzed: mkha' la don byed bstan med phyir //
translated: Because it is taught that space and so on do not perform a function,

original: de nyid lta po nam mkha' min //
analyzed: de nyid lta po nam mkha' min //
translated: That itself is not the seer, nor is it space.

original: bstan pa tshig yin de yi phyir //
analyzed: bstan pa tshig yin de yi phyir //
translated: The teaching is the word, and therefore

original: de nyid gang las 'dod pa yin ;
analyzed: de nyid gang las 'dod pa yin ;
translated: it is the object of desire.

original: / rnam pa kun du ldog med la //
analyzed: / rnam pa kun du ldog med la //
translated: In every way, it is not stopped,

original: rgyu nyid du ni rtogs ma yin //üîΩdon gang 'das dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: rgyu nyid du ni rtogs ma yin // don gang 'das dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: and it is not understood as a cause.üîΩHow is it that the object, whether past or future,

original: de ni ci ltar snang ba yin //
analyzed: de ni ci ltar snang ba yin //
translated: is seen?

original: 'das pa shes pa yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'das pa shes pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the past is known,

original: ci ltar 'das pa yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: ci ltar 'das pa yin par 'gyur //
translated: how can it be past?

original: 'das pa la sogs ci ltar yang //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs ci ltar yang //
translated: How is it that the past, etc.

original: me long du ni 'pho ba yin //
analyzed: me long du ni 'pho ba yin //
translated: are reflected in a mirror?

original: de lta bu yi snang ba ni //
analyzed: de lta bu yi snang ba ni //
translated: Such a reflection

original: me long yod na 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: me long yod na 'byung ba yin //
translated: occurs when there is a mirror.

original: snang ba brtags pa'i 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: snang ba brtags pa'i 'bras bu ni //
translated: The result of the examination of the reflection

original: ma yin zhes ni sngar brjod do //üîΩnam mkha' la sogs pa dag kyang //
analyzed: ma yin zhes ni sngar brjod do // nam mkha' la sogs pa dag kyang //
translated: is not, as was said before.üîΩWhy is it not the case that space, etc.

original: don de 'dzin par cis mi 'gyur //
analyzed: don de 'dzin par cis mi 'gyur //
translated: grasp that object?üîΩIf there is no certainty that the object

original: gal te don de'i de ma thag /'byung ba'i nges pa yod min na //üîΩdon rnams @29a * //
analyzed: gal te don de'i de ma thag /'byung ba'i nges pa yod min na // don rnams @29a * //
translated: immediately arises,üîΩthen all objects

original: thams cad mthong ba de //
analyzed: thams cad mthong ba de //
translated: are seen.

original: tshig don gang zhig yin par brjod //
analyzed: tshig don gang zhig yin par brjod //
translated: What is the meaning of the word?

original: don kun mthong ba las byung ba'i //
analyzed: don kun mthong ba las byung ba'i //
translated: And the arising of the seeing of all objects.

original: sgra ni thams cad rjod byed yin //
analyzed: sgra ni thams cad rjod byed yin //
translated: Sound is the expression of all.

original: brjod 'dod nges pa zhes bya ni //
analyzed: brjod 'dod nges pa zhes bya ni //
translated: The so-called ‚Äúdesire to express‚Äù

original: rtag pa 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Is not tenable as permanent.

original: brjod 'dod de dag tha dad cing //
analyzed: brjod 'dod de dag tha dad cing //
translated: The desires to express are different,

original: de bzhin mthong ba tha dad na //
analyzed: de bzhin mthong ba tha dad na //
translated: And likewise the seeing is different.

original: gang gis lta po gcig yin te //
analyzed: gang gis lta po gcig yin te //
translated: By what is the seer one?

original: khyod kyis tshad de ci ltar yin //
analyzed: khyod kyis tshad de ci ltar yin //
translated: What is the measure of this for you?

original: gal te brjod 'dod blta bya yi //
analyzed: gal te brjod 'dod blta bya yi //
translated: If the desire to express is the object seen

original: 'dzin byed de nyid yin zha na //
analyzed: 'dzin byed de nyid yin zha na //
translated: And the apprehender is that itself,

original: brjod par 'dod dang gzhan pa'i de //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod dang gzhan pa'i de //
translated: How is the desire to express and the other

original: ci ltar gcig gis 'dzin pa yin //
analyzed: ci ltar gcig gis 'dzin pa yin //
translated: Apprehended by one?üîΩIf it were like that, why not say

original: de lta yin na mngon sum dang // rjes dpag gcig tu cis mi brjod //
analyzed: de lta yin na mngon sum dang // rjes dpag gcig tu cis mi brjod //
translated: That perception and inference are one?

original: gal te de yang yang dag tu //
analyzed: gal te de yang yang dag tu //
translated: If that is also asserted

original: gcig pa nyid du 'dod na ni //üîΩde dag la yang rim gyis sam //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du 'dod na ni // de dag la yang rim gyis sam //
translated: To be one in reality,üîΩThen do they exist sequentially

original: cig car tha dad yod min nam //üîΩrang bzhin gcig nyid rim gyis ni //
analyzed: cig car tha dad yod min nam // rang bzhin gcig nyid rim gyis ni //
translated: Or simultaneously and not different?üîΩA single nature is not realized

original: tshad ma yis ni rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: tshad ma yis ni rtogs ma yin //
translated: Sequentially by valid cognition.

original: rtogs po de'am gzhan du ni //
analyzed: rtogs po de'am gzhan du ni //
translated: The cognizer is not that or other.

original: shes byed gcig gi gzhal bya ba //
analyzed: shes byed gcig gi gzhal bya ba //
translated: The object of one cognition

original: de gcig ces bya bden nam ci //
analyzed: de gcig ces bya bden nam ci //
translated: Is one, so is it truly so?

original: bden pa min na tshig don med //
analyzed: bden pa min na tshig don med //
translated: If not, then words are meaningless.

original: ci ste bdag nyid rang nyid ni //
analyzed: ci ste bdag nyid rang nyid ni //
translated: If you say that the self itself

original: rnam kun byed pos shes byed na //üîΩde ni da ltar yin no zhes //
analyzed: rnam kun byed pos shes byed na // de ni da ltar yin no zhes //
translated: Is the agent of all actions,üîΩHow do you know it exists now?

original: cis rtogs de ni tshig tsam yin //üîΩrang rig nyid las gzhan pa ni //
analyzed: cis rtogs de ni tshig tsam yin // rang rig nyid las gzhan pa ni //
translated: This is mere words.üîΩWe have already said

original: med ces sngar ni brjod pa yin //
analyzed: med ces sngar ni brjod pa yin //
translated: That there is nothing other than self-awareness.

original: des na de ni don dam par dbang phyug ma yin la kun rdzob tu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de ni don dam par dbang phyug ma yin la kun rdzob tu yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, ultimately, ƒ™≈õvara does not exist, and even conventionally he does not exist.

original: ci ste yang gal te shes bya mi rtag pa nyid kyis shes pa mi rtag pa yin yang shes par byed pa po gang yin pa de ni rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste yang gal te shes bya mi rtag pa nyid kyis shes pa mi rtag pa yin yang shes par byed pa po gang yin pa de ni rtag pa yin no //
translated: But if you say that although consciousness is impermanent because its object is impermanent, the agent of knowing is permanent,

original: gzhan mi rtag pas gzhan yang mi rtag go zhes ni mi 'thad do zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan mi rtag pas gzhan yang mi rtag go zhes ni mi 'thad do zhe na /
translated: and it is not tenable to say that one thing is impermanent because another thing is impermanent,

original: bshad pa shes bya mi rtag pas na shes pa /
analyzed: bshad pa shes bya mi rtag pas na shes pa /
translated: we reply: Because the object is impermanent, consciousness

original: rim bzhin skye ba can dag ni //
analyzed: rim bzhin skye ba can dag ni //
translated: Arises in sequence.

original: rtag las skye ba mi 'thad phyir //
analyzed: rtag las skye ba mi 'thad phyir //
translated: Because it is untenable that it arises from a permanent thing.

original: de rtag pa las skye ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnam mkha' ltar rtag pa khyab ba ni /
analyzed: de rtag pa las skye ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro // nam mkha' ltar rtag pa khyab ba ni /
translated: because it is illogical that it would arise from a permanent cause.

original: 'ga' yang rgyu ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'ga' yang rgyu ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that nothing is a permanent cause, like space.

original: gal te rang bzhin de nyid kyis skyed par byed na ni khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe skyed par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin de nyid kyis skyed par byed na ni khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe skyed par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If it is generated by that very intrinsic reality, then because there is no distinction, it would be generated at all times.

original: khyad par yod na yang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par yod na yang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, if there is a distinction, then it would be impermanent.

original: 'on te khyad par med kyang lhan cig byed pa yod pa dang med pa dag las 'bras bu'i rim pa can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par med kyang lhan cig byed pa yod pa dang med pa dag las 'bras bu'i rim pa can yin no zhe na /
translated: But if, even without a distinction, it is due to the presence or absence of the assemblage of causes, then the order of the effect would be illogical.

original: ma yin te ltos pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te ltos pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because reliance is illogical.

original: gal te lhan cig byed pa @29b dag nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa yin na //üîΩde dag nyid rgyu yin gyi de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te lhan cig byed pa @29b dag nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa yin na // de dag nyid rgyu yin gyi de ni ma yin no //
translated: If the assemblage of causes itself is the reason for the presence and absence,üîΩthen that alone is the cause, not that.

original: de la ltos nas de yang rgyu yin no zhes mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la ltos nas de yang rgyu yin no zhes mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical to say that it is a cause in reliance on that.

original: ltos pa de dang cig shos kyi gnas skabs dag tu khyad par med par rang ngam gzhan gyi ltos pa nyid du mi rtogs pa'i phyir 'di ni tshig tsam gtso bor gyur pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ltos pa de dang cig shos kyi gnas skabs dag tu khyad par med par rang ngam gzhan gyi ltos pa nyid du mi rtogs pa'i phyir 'di ni tshig tsam gtso bor gyur pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Because it is not understood that the other, without any difference in its condition in relation to that dependence, is dependent either on itself or on another, it should be understood that this is merely a verbal quibble.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ltos pa mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ltos pa mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that ‚Äúbecause dependence is impossible.‚Äù

original: rtag pa thams cad kyi tshe rang bzhin gcig pa ni ltos par bya ba phan gdags par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa thams cad kyi tshe rang bzhin gcig pa ni ltos par bya ba phan gdags par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: At all times, a permanent entity cannot be the dependent, because it is not able to assist.

original: de la phan 'dogs pa med par ni des ltos par bya ba ma yin no ;
analyzed: de la phan 'dogs pa med par ni des ltos par bya ba ma yin no ;
translated: Without assistance, it is not the dependent.

original: / de lta na ni 'o na mi rtag pa tshad ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de lta na ni 'o na mi rtag pa tshad ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the impermanent would be the valid cognition.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the dependent is established in relation to the practice of generosity and so on.

original: chags pa dang bral ba dang / dbang phyug dang ldan pa ni rigs mthun pa'i rgyu snga ma las skyes pa'i phyir de nam yang gzhan du 'gyur ba las gzhan du skye bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: chags pa dang bral ba dang / dbang phyug dang ldan pa ni rigs mthun pa'i rgyu snga ma las skyes pa'i phyir de nam yang gzhan du 'gyur ba las gzhan du skye bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not detached, and it is not omnipotent, because it is produced from a prior cause of a homogeneous type. It is never otherwise, and it is not produced as something else.

original: 'di la bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa ni /
translated: The response to this is:

original: rnam 'gas phan gdags bya min phyir //üîΩmi rtag na yang tshad med nyid //
analyzed: rnam 'gas phan gdags bya min phyir // mi rtag na yang tshad med nyid //
translated: Because it is not a benefactor in any way,üîΩit is not omnipotent, even if it is permanent.

original: dbang phyug mi rtag pa la yang tshad ma yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang phyug mi rtag pa la yang tshad ma yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not omnipotent, even if God is impermanent.

original: de tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: He is not a valid cognition.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam 'gas phan gdags bya min phyir //
analyzed: rnam 'gas phan gdags bya min phyir //
translated: Because it is not a benefactor in any way.

original: gang zhig rnam pa ci zhig ltar 'ga' zhig phan gdags pa 'am gnod par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: gang zhig rnam pa ci zhig ltar 'ga' zhig phan gdags pa 'am gnod par byed pa de ni /
translated: Whatever is a benefactor or a harm-doer in some way,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa myong ba dang // 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyan po rtogs pa la sogs pa srid pas de ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa myong ba dang // 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyan po rtogs pa la sogs pa srid pas de ston pa yin no //
translated: it is possible that it experiences attachment and so on, and it is possible that it realizes the antidotes to attachment and so on. Therefore, it is taught.

original: sems can la byams pa dang snying brtse bas ston pa srid pa'i phyir de ni 'jig rten gyis tshad mar 'gyur gyi rang gi ngo bo yod pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can la byams pa dang snying brtse bas ston pa srid pa'i phyir de ni 'jig rten gyis tshad mar 'gyur gyi rang gi ngo bo yod pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the Teacher is possible through love and compassion for sentient beings, he is a valid person for the world, not just by the mere existence of his nature.

original: de las ni 'di 'dra ba'i bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de las ni 'di 'dra ba'i bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the case for him,

original: sdug goms med par mkhas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug goms med par mkhas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because without cultivating it, one does not become wise.

original: 'on te de ni thams cad yongs su shes pa nyid ni rang bzhin nyid kyis grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de ni thams cad yongs su shes pa nyid ni rang bzhin nyid kyis grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that omniscience is established by nature,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is not reasonable.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyams su ma myang na 'khor ba'i rtsa ba'i spros pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyams su ma myang na 'khor ba'i rtsa ba'i spros pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: If one does not experience attachment and so on, how can one realize the characteristics of the root of sa·πÉsƒÅra?

original: nyams su myong na ni /
analyzed: nyams su myong na ni /
translated: If one experiences it,

original: 'di 'khor ba pa nyid yin pas de ci ltar tshad ma yin /üîΩ'on te 'dod chags la sogs pa @30a * //
analyzed: 'di 'khor ba pa nyid yin pas de ci ltar tshad ma yin / 'on te 'dod chags la sogs pa @30a * //
translated: then one is in sa·πÉsƒÅra oneself, so how can that be valid knowledge?

original: rtogs pa nyid kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i spros pa'i gnyen po ston pa yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa nyid kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i spros pa'i gnyen po ston pa yin te /
translated: But if you say that by realizing attachment and so on, one teaches the antidote to the proliferation of attachment and so on,üîΩthat is not reasonable.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid thams cad shes pa dang ma nyams pa dang / gzhal du med pa'i nus pa dang ldan pas de nyid tshad ma yin no zhe na /üîΩde yang mi rigs te ;
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid thams cad shes pa dang ma nyams pa dang / gzhal du med pa'i nus pa dang ldan pas de nyid tshad ma yin no zhe na / de yang mi rigs te ;
translated: But if you think that the valid cognition of the omniscient one is the possession of desire and so on, then that is not tenable.

original: gal te 'dod chags la sogs dang // ldan yang dbang phyug nyams med na //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs dang // ldan yang dbang phyug nyams med na //
translated: If you think that although he possesses desire and so on, his sovereignty is not impaired,

original: 'dod chags la sogs gnyen po ni //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs gnyen po ni //
translated: then the teaching of the antidotes to desire and so on

original: bstan pa don med kho nar 'gyur //
analyzed: bstan pa don med kho nar 'gyur //
translated: would be pointless.

original: 'on te 'di ni dngos po'i gnas lugs yin te /
analyzed: 'on te 'di ni dngos po'i gnas lugs yin te /
translated: But if you think that this is the nature of things,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa la /
translated: that although he possesses desire and so on,

original: dbang phyug srid pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang phyug srid pa ni ma yin no //
translated: he is not a sovereign of existence,

original: des na de'i gnyen po ston to zhe na /
analyzed: des na de'i gnyen po ston to zhe na /
translated: and therefore the teaching of the antidotes to that is taught,

original: gal te de ltar chags bral sogs //
analyzed: gal te de ltar chags bral sogs //
translated: then if it is impossible to be free from attachment and so on

original: bsgoms pa med phyir mi srid na //üîΩde yi dbang phyug la sogs pa //
analyzed: bsgoms pa med phyir mi srid na // de yi dbang phyug la sogs pa //
translated: because of the absence of meditation,üîΩfrom where do the sovereignty of that and so on

original: grub de glo bur gang las 'ong //
analyzed: grub de glo bur gang las 'ong //
translated: come, existing adventitiously?

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa gnyen po la sogs pa goms pa las 'byung ngo zhes shes pa gang yin pa de nyid las gzhan du yang 'byung ngo zhes pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa gnyen po la sogs pa goms pa las 'byung ngo zhes shes pa gang yin pa de nyid las gzhan du yang 'byung ngo zhes pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that something arises from something else, when it is known that it arises from the cultivation of antidotes such as freedom from attachment and so on.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gang gis dbang phyug sgrub pa dang // bral ba'i don du gnyer ba la //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang gis dbang phyug sgrub pa dang // bral ba'i don du gnyer ba la //
translated: The one who seeks to prove ƒ™≈õvara

original: mchog sbyin pa yi nus pa ni //
analyzed: mchog sbyin pa yi nus pa ni //
translated: has no capacity to give the highest gift.

original: de 'dra de la yod pa min //üîΩ'on te de la nus pa de //
analyzed: de 'dra de la yod pa min // 'on te de la nus pa de //
translated: That capacity does not exist for him.

original: med na gzhan yang ci ltar yod //
analyzed: med na gzhan yang ci ltar yod //
translated: If that capacity does not exist for him, how could it exist for another?

original: rjes su 'dzin pa'i nus pa ni //
analyzed: rjes su 'dzin pa'i nus pa ni //
translated: The capacity to care for others

original: de la tshad ma med par 'gyur //
analyzed: de la tshad ma med par 'gyur //
translated: would be without a valid cognition.

original: don 'di yang yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yang yin te /
translated: This is also the meaning:

original: mi rtag na yang tshad min nyid //
analyzed: mi rtag na yang tshad min nyid //
translated: Even if it is impermanent, it is not a valid cognition.

original: 'di la tshad ma yod pa ma yin pas tshad med do //
analyzed: 'di la tshad ma yod pa ma yin pas tshad med do //
translated: It is not a valid cognition because it does not have a valid cognition.

original: de'i ngo bo ni tshad med nyid de /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni tshad med nyid de /
translated: Its nature is not a valid cognition.

original: de la tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la tshad ma yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that a valid cognition does not exist for it.

original: 'on te mnyes par byas pa la sogs pa rim gyis chags pa la sogs pa nye bar zhi ba'i rnam pas chos ston pas 'di rjes su 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te mnyes par byas pa la sogs pa rim gyis chags pa la sogs pa nye bar zhi ba'i rnam pas chos ston pas 'di rjes su 'dzin par byed pa yin te /
translated: Or, by gradually pacifying attachment and so on, he teaches the Dharma in a way that pleases them, and thus he cares for them.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If that were not so,

original: rjes su 'dzin par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su 'dzin par mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: he would not be able to care for them.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar / des bshad rjes su sgrub pa yis //
analyzed: 'di ltar / des bshad rjes su sgrub pa yis //
translated: In this way:

original: 'jig rten rjes 'dzin gang gis rtogs //
analyzed: 'jig rten rjes 'dzin gang gis rtogs //
translated: How can you know that he cares for the world

original: des bshad lung tsam las she na //
analyzed: des bshad lung tsam las she na //
translated: by his teaching and by his practice?üîΩIf you say, ‚ÄúHe taught it in the scriptures,‚Äù

original: de lta phan tshun rten par 'gyur //üîΩdes bshad phyir de lung yin la //
analyzed: de lta phan tshun rten par 'gyur // des bshad phyir de lung yin la //
translated: then that is mutual dependence.üîΩBecause he taught it, it is scripture.

original: lung yin phyir yang de bshad nyid //
analyzed: lung yin phyir yang de bshad nyid //
translated: And because it is scripture, it is his teaching.

original: phan tshun brten pa yin phyir der //
analyzed: phan tshun brten pa yin phyir der //
translated: Since they are mutually dependent,

original: gcig kyang gnas par ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig kyang gnas par ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: how can either one exist?üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / de yi @30b nus pa 'di 'dra ste //
analyzed: gzhan yang / de yi @30b nus pa 'di 'dra ste //
translated: What is the power of this teaching?

original: rgyu gang las ni 'ongs pa yin //
analyzed: rgyu gang las ni 'ongs pa yin //
translated: From what cause does it arise?

original: 'di ni de yi rang bzhin zhes //
analyzed: 'di ni de yi rang bzhin zhes //
translated: What is its nature?

original: de ni gang las rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni gang las rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: How can you know that?

original: de thams cad mthong ba dang rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi nus pa de 'dra ba de rgyu gang las byung /
analyzed: de thams cad mthong ba dang rjes su 'dzin par byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi nus pa de 'dra ba de rgyu gang las byung /
translated: What is the cause of such a nature that sees and embraces all of these?

original: gal te 'dir de lta bur byung ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid lan 'debs so //
analyzed: gal te 'dir de lta bur byung ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid lan 'debs so //
translated: If you reply, ‚ÄúThe nature of things is such that it is so,‚ÄùüîΩthen how could it be said that

original: 'di ltar / 'di ni 'di lta'am ma yin zhes //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'di ni 'di lta'am ma yin zhes //
translated: ‚Äúthis is so‚Äù or ‚Äúthis is not so‚Äù?

original: de ni su la 'dri bar bya //
analyzed: de ni su la 'dri bar bya //
translated: Who could be asked about this?

original: sreg byed me yis nam mkha' min //
analyzed: sreg byed me yis nam mkha' min //
translated: Fire does not burn space.üîΩWhat could be disputed or analyzed here?

original: 'di la ci zhig brgal zhing brtag /'di ni shin tu mi rigs te //üîΩgal te rang bzhin mngon sum du //
analyzed: 'di la ci zhig brgal zhing brtag /'di ni shin tu mi rigs te // gal te rang bzhin mngon sum du //
translated: This is completely unreasonable.üîΩIf you argue and analyze

original: grub la rgol zhing rtog byed na ;
analyzed: grub la rgol zhing rtog byed na ;
translated: the nature of things that is directly perceived,

original: / de la lan 'di rigs 'gyur te //üîΩmthong ba nyid ni mi 'thad min //
analyzed: / de la lan 'di rigs 'gyur te // mthong ba nyid ni mi 'thad min //
translated: then this reply would be reasonable:üîΩ‚ÄúWhat is seen is not invalidated.‚Äù

original: 'di ni mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: This is not seen.

original: 'di ltar / 'dir dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid lan 'debs so zhes bya ba'i don 'di ci yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'dir dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid lan 'debs so zhes bya ba'i don 'di ci yin //
translated: What is the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe nature of things is the reply‚Äù?

original: 'di ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas grub pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas grub pa yin pas /
translated: This is established by valid forms of knowledge such as direct perception.

original: 'di ci ltar zhes brgal zhing brtag pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ci ltar zhes brgal zhing brtag pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: It is not the object of a question such as ‚ÄúHow is this?‚Äù

original: ci ltar mngon sum du me bsreg bya sreg par dmigs pa la ci lta bar byed pa yin zhes brgal zhing brtag par byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar mngon sum du me bsreg bya sreg par dmigs pa la ci lta bar byed pa yin zhes brgal zhing brtag par byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Just as one can question and investigate the perception of fire as that which burns the fuel, so too one can question and investigate the perception of God as the creator of the world.

original: gal te 'byung ba nyid kyis yin na nam mkha' yang sreg par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba nyid kyis yin na nam mkha' yang sreg par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is by nature, then space would also burn.

original: 'on te rang bzhin gyis so sor nges pas de lta yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rang bzhin gyis so sor nges pas de lta yin na /
translated: But if it is by the individual determination of nature,

original: de'i tshe dbang phyug kyang yon tan gyi rgyu thams cad dang bral ba yang yon tan dang ldan pas mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe dbang phyug kyang yon tan gyi rgyu thams cad dang bral ba yang yon tan dang ldan pas mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: then at that time, God, being devoid of all causes of qualities, is similar to one who possesses qualities.

original: mi mtshungs te me ni mthong ba'i phyir dang / gzhan ni bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mtshungs te me ni mthong ba'i phyir dang / gzhan ni bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not similar, because fire is seen, and the other is refuted.

original: des na 'di lan ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di lan ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is not an answer.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: bdag nyid mngon 'dod 'ga' zhig bsgrub byas pa //
analyzed: bdag nyid mngon 'dod 'ga' zhig bsgrub byas pa //
translated: then some who desire to establish themselves

original: de la gzhan gyis lan med byas pa na //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyis lan med byas pa na //
translated: would not be able to respond to that.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin zhes de'i lan brjod pas //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin zhes de'i lan brjod pas //
translated: The reply is: The nature of entities.

original: de ltas thams cad rgyal bar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: de ltas thams cad rgyal bar 'gyur ba yin //
translated: Therefore, everything is established.

original: de'i phyir mi rtag na yang ste //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtag na yang ste //
translated: Therefore, even if impermanent,

original: yang gi sgras rtag pa yang tshad mar med pa nyid do zhes legs pa brjod do //
analyzed: yang gi sgras rtag pa yang tshad mar med pa nyid do zhes legs pa brjod do //
translated: the word even indicates that permanent [means of knowledge] are also not established. This is well stated.

original: gal te tshad ma yod yin //üîΩsdod 'jug dbyibs kyi khyad par dang // don byed pa la sogs pa dang /'bras bu'i bdag nyid 'bras bu las //
analyzed: gal te tshad ma yod yin // sdod 'jug dbyibs kyi khyad par dang // don byed pa la sogs pa dang /'bras bu'i bdag nyid 'bras bu las //
translated: If there were a means of knowledge,üîΩhow could the cause be established,üîΩsince it is not seen in the effect,

original: ji ltar rgyu ni grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu ni grub mi 'gyur //
translated: in the difference of shape, in the performance of a function, and so on?üîΩIf it were not so,

original: de lta min na rgyu gzhan la'ang //
analyzed: de lta min na rgyu gzhan la'ang //
translated: even in other causes,

original: rjes su dpag pa'ang med par 'gyur //üîΩ'di ltar dngos @31a * //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'ang med par 'gyur // 'di ltar dngos @31a * //
translated: there would be no inference.üîΩThus, in order to establish some entity that is desired,

original: po 'ga' zhig mngon par 'dod pa sgrub pa'i phyir bsdad cing bsdad cing 'jug pa de ni blo dang ldan pa'i rgyus byin gyis brlabs pa las yin te /
analyzed: po 'ga' zhig mngon par 'dod pa sgrub pa'i phyir bsdad cing bsdad cing 'jug pa de ni blo dang ldan pa'i rgyus byin gyis brlabs pa las yin te /
translated: it is due to the blessing of the intelligent cause that one remains and engages.

original: dper na / dbyibs su bya ba la sogs pa ste ste'u la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / dbyibs su bya ba la sogs pa ste ste'u la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a winnowing basket and so on in the performance of winnowing and so on.

original: ste'u la sogs pa ni rang nyid 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ste'u la sogs pa ni rang nyid 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: But a wedge, etc., does not enter by itself.

original: 'jug pa yin na yang gtan du 'jug par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'jug pa yin na yang gtan du 'jug par 'gyur na /
translated: And if it did enter, it would enter forever.

original: bsdad nas 'jug pa yang yin no //
analyzed: bsdad nas 'jug pa yang yin no //
translated: But it does not enter while remaining.

original: des na rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa po 'ga' zhig yod dgos so //
analyzed: des na rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa po 'ga' zhig yod dgos so //
translated: Therefore, there must be some agent who is conscious and enters.

original: de bzhin du gang zhig zlum po la sogs pa la dbyibs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa de ni sems pa dang ldan pa skyed pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zhig zlum po la sogs pa la dbyibs kyi khyad par dang ldan pa de ni sems pa dang ldan pa skyed pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, that which has the special shape of a circle, etc., is produced by a conscious being,

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a pot, etc.

original: de bzhin du gang zhig don bya ba byed pa de ni sems pa dang ldan pa'i dngos pos bskul ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zhig don bya ba byed pa de ni sems pa dang ldan pa'i dngos pos bskul ba yin te /
translated: Similarly, that which performs a function is impelled by a conscious being,

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like a pot, etc.

original: 'di la bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la bshad pa ni /
translated: The reply to that is:üîΩRemaining, entering, special shape,üîΩperforming a function, etc., are not established

original: sdod 'jug dbyibs kyi khyad par dang // don byed pa la sogs pa dag /'dod sgrub pa'am dpe ma grub //
analyzed: sdod 'jug dbyibs kyi khyad par dang // don byed pa la sogs pa dag /'dod sgrub pa'am dpe ma grub //
translated: as desired or as examples.

original: yang na the tshom za ba yin //
analyzed: yang na the tshom za ba yin //
translated: Or else, they are doubtful.

original: 'bras bu nyid du mngon par 'dod pa bsdad nas 'jug pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni yang dag pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid du mngon par 'dod pa bsdad nas 'jug pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni yang dag pa'i gtan tshigs ma yin te /
translated: and that God is the cause of the world, are not offering a correct reason.

original: gang gi phyir de dag yod kyang 'dod pa nyid sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag yod kyang 'dod pa nyid sgrub pa yin te /
translated: For, even if they exist, they are proving what is already accepted.

original: grub pa sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: grub pa sgrub pa yin no //
translated: They are proving what is already established.

original: grub pa ni phyogs ma yin te /
analyzed: grub pa ni phyogs ma yin te /
translated: What is established is not a thesis,

original: ma grub pa phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma grub pa phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because what is not established is a thesis.

original: gang la rtsod pa yod pa de sgrub pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa nye bar dgod par rigs pa yin na /
analyzed: gang la rtsod pa yod pa de sgrub pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa nye bar dgod par rigs pa yin na /
translated: If it is reasonable to posit a proof in order to establish what is disputed,üîΩthen it is reasonable to posit a proof in order to establish that the world is created by God, etc.,

original: thams cad las kyi mtshan nyid kyi sems pas byin gyis rlob par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad las kyi mtshan nyid kyi sems pas byin gyis rlob par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: because it is asserted that the world is created by the volition that has the nature of karma.üîΩThus it is said:

original: 'di ltar / las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //
analyzed: 'di ltar / las las 'jig rten sna tshogs skyes //
translated: The world is born from karma.

original: de ni sems pa dang des byas //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni sems pa dang des byas // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is volition and what is produced by volition.

original: gal te las las skyes pa nyid do zhes ni sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te las las skyes pa nyid do zhes ni sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is not established that the world is born from karma,

original: las las gzhan pa'i sems pa dbang phyug gis byin gyis brlab par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las las gzhan pa'i sems pa dbang phyug gis byin gyis brlab par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is established that the world is created by God, etc., because it is created by volition, which is other than karma, and is blessed by God.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: de ni dbang phyug gis bskul bas mngon par gsal ba'i las las yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de ni dbang phyug gis bskul bas mngon par gsal ba'i las las yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: It is said that it is due to the karma of manifest action impelled by God.

original: dbang phyug gi sems pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i las sngon du 'gro ba can nyid bsgrub pa na grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang phyug gi sems pas byin gyis brlabs pa'i las sngon du 'gro ba can nyid bsgrub pa na grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is established that karma is preceded by the blessing of God‚Äôs intention, then it is not established that God exists.

original: de ni med de /
analyzed: de ni med de /
translated: This is not so.

original: gal te sems pa'i rang bzhin gyis rang las yod na /
analyzed: gal te sems pa'i rang bzhin gyis rang las yod na /
translated: If God exists by his own nature,

original: de'i tshe @31b sems pa gzhan sgrub pa ni don med do //üîΩsems pa med pa de ni 'jug par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe @31b sems pa gzhan sgrub pa ni don med do // sems pa med pa de ni 'jug par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: then it is meaningless to establish another intention.

original: 'di ni de'o zhes nges par brtags nas 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩdes na rang nyid nges par brtags nas 'jug par bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ni de'o zhes nges par brtags nas 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ro // des na rang nyid nges par brtags nas 'jug par bya ba'am /
translated: That which is devoid of intention is not able to engage in action because it is seen that engagement in action is preceded by the ascertainment that this is that.

original: nges par rtogs pas bskul nas yin te /
analyzed: nges par rtogs pas bskul nas yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is either that God himself engages in action after ascertaining it or that he is impelled by ascertainment.

original: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no other way.

original: de la sems pa med pa rnams la rang nyid nges par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la sems pa med pa rnams la rang nyid nges par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: In the case of those devoid of intention, there is no ascertainment by themselves.

original: gal te nges par rtogs pa gzhan yang med na ni mi 'jug pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te nges par rtogs pa gzhan yang med na ni mi 'jug pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If there were no other ascertainment, then it would follow that it would not engage.üîΩTherefore, it is the intention that there must be some instigator who possesses mind.

original: des na sems pa dang ldan pa'i skul ba po 'ga' zhig yod dgos so zhes bya ba bsam pa yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: des na sems pa dang ldan pa'i skul ba po 'ga' zhig yod dgos so zhes bya ba bsam pa yin no zhes zer te /
translated: In response to that, it says:

original: de la / las kyi rang bzhin sems pa nyid //
analyzed: de la / las kyi rang bzhin sems pa nyid //
translated: If the nature of karma, intention,

original: gal te 'jug pa'i rgyu yin na //
analyzed: gal te 'jug pa'i rgyu yin na //
translated: is the cause of engagement,

original: nges rtogs la yang de yi ni //
analyzed: nges rtogs la yang de yi ni //
translated: then even ascertainment

original: nges rtogs gzhan ni 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: nges rtogs gzhan ni 'dod ma yin //
translated: would not be asserted as another ascertainment.

original: de lta na yang dpe ma grub //
analyzed: de lta na yang dpe ma grub //
translated: Even so, the example is not established.

original: bum sogs sems pa dang ldan pas //
analyzed: bum sogs sems pa dang ldan pas //
translated: Even though pots and so on are made by those who possess intention,

original: byas kyang dbang phyug gis byas min ;
analyzed: byas kyang dbang phyug gis byas min ;
translated: they are not made by ƒ™≈õvara.

original: / dgos pa med phyir gzhan du na //üîΩde yang rang gi don byas la //
analyzed: / dgos pa med phyir gzhan du na // de yang rang gi don byas la //
translated: Because it is purposeless,üîΩit is also not made by ƒ™≈õvara.

original: 'jug pa dbang phyug dang ldan pa //
analyzed: 'jug pa dbang phyug dang ldan pa //
translated: Because it is engaged in its own purpose,

original: yin phyir thug pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: yin phyir thug pa med par 'gyur //
translated: there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'on te rdza mkhan sogs de yang //
analyzed: 'on te rdza mkhan sogs de yang //
translated: If even the potter and so onüîΩare engaged because of ignorance,

original: mi shes phyir na bcug nas 'jug / de shes pa yi dbang phyug de //
analyzed: mi shes phyir na bcug nas 'jug / de shes pa yi dbang phyug de //
translated: then that ƒ™≈õvara who knows

original: gzhan gyis 'jug par bya ba min ;
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'jug par bya ba min ;
translated: would not be engaged by another.

original: / di ltar /
analyzed: / di ltar /
translated: It is like this:

original: skye ba po ni shes pa yod min pas //
analyzed: skye ba po ni shes pa yod min pas //
translated: Since the creator does not exist,

original: bdag gi sdug bsngal bdag la rang dbang med //üîΩdbang phyug gis kyang yang na mtho ris sam //
analyzed: bdag gi sdug bsngal bdag la rang dbang med // dbang phyug gis kyang yang na mtho ris sam //
translated: my suffering is not under my own control.üîΩEven if it were under the control of God,

original: g-yang sa dag tu 'gro ba kho nar 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yang sa dag tu 'gro ba kho nar 'gyur //
translated: it would be going to heaven or falling into an abyss.

original: mi shes sems dang ldan pa yang //
analyzed: mi shes sems dang ldan pa yang //
translated: Even if one has a mind that is ignorant,

original: nges par rtogs ni mi nus so //
analyzed: nges par rtogs ni mi nus so //
translated: one is certainly not able to understand.

original: nges par rtogs mi nus pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nges par rtogs mi nus pa'i phyir //
translated: Because one is not able to understand,

original: bum pa la sogs pa ltar gzhan gyis bskul ba yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ltar gzhan gyis bskul ba yin no //
translated: one is urged on by another, like a pot, etc.

original: dbang phyug ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang phyug ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not God,

original: de ni nges par rtogs nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nges par rtogs nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is able to understand.

original: des na thug pa med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na thug pa med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, there is no infinite regress.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: That is also not so,üîΩbecause if the creator is established,

original: byed po grub na kun shes nyid //
analyzed: byed po grub na kun shes nyid //
translated: the omniscient one is established.

original: 'grub 'gyur thug pa med pas na //
analyzed: 'grub 'gyur thug pa med pas na //
translated: Since there is no infinite regress,

original: byed po'ang de las yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: byed po'ang de las yin pa'i phyir //
translated: the creator is also from that.

original: de ni phan tshun rten chen 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni phan tshun rten chen 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, there is a great mutual dependence.

original: gal te dbang phyug dam pa 'di thams cad kyi byed pa po yin no zhes grub na /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug dam pa 'di thams cad kyi byed pa po yin no zhes grub na /
translated: If it is established that this highest God is the creator of all,

original: de'i tshe 'di thams cad shes pa nyid du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di thams cad shes pa nyid du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: At that time, all of this would be consciousness itself, and not something else.

original: thams cad shes pa nyid yin yang skul bar byed pa yin par 'gyur te /üîΩde @32a * //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa nyid yin yang skul bar byed pa yin par 'gyur te / de @32a * //
translated: Even if it were consciousness itself, it would be the instigator.üîΩOtherwise,

original: ltar ma yin na de'i skul bar byed pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: ltar ma yin na de'i skul bar byed pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir thug pa med pa nyid do //
translated: because there would be another instigator, there would be an infinite regress.

original: gzhan yang gal te de thams cad shes pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te de thams cad shes pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if it is all consciousness,

original: ci ste skyes bu mi shes pa dam pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad la 'jug par byed /
analyzed: ci ste skyes bu mi shes pa dam pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad la 'jug par byed /
translated: why does a person engage in the conventions of non-knowledge, which are not good?

original: dpyod pa dang ldan pa ni dam pa'i nye bar bstan pa byed par mthong na /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang ldan pa ni dam pa'i nye bar bstan pa byed par mthong na /
translated: If one who is discerning is seen to engage in the good teachings,

original: de'i log par 'jug pa'i skye bo yang skyed par byed pas de ci ltar tshad ma yin /
analyzed: de'i log par 'jug pa'i skye bo yang skyed par byed pas de ci ltar tshad ma yin /
translated: then that person who engages in the opposite would also be produced. How then could it be valid knowledge?

original: 'on te de ni dam pa nyid kyi nye bar bstan pa nyid byed pa des na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te de ni dam pa nyid kyi nye bar bstan pa nyid byed pa des na tshad ma yin no //
translated: But if it is the good teachings themselves that are engaged in, then it is valid knowledge.

original: chos ma yin pa'i byed pa ni dam pa ma yin pa'i 'bras bu myong bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i byed pa ni dam pa ma yin pa'i 'bras bu myong bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The performance of what is not Dharma leads to the experience of the result of what is not good.

original: des na tshad ma'i 'bras bu sbyin par byed pa ni dpyod pa dang ldan pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: des na tshad ma'i 'bras bu sbyin par byed pa ni dpyod pa dang ldan pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the result of valid cognition is the endowment with analysis.

original: de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so,

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: because

original: 'di ni chos ma yin pa la'ang //
analyzed: 'di ni chos ma yin pa la'ang //
translated: even with regard to non-Dharma,

original: skye bo 'jug par byed nyid na //
analyzed: skye bo 'jug par byed nyid na //
translated: it causes people to engage.

original: mi rigs pa ni byas nas de //
analyzed: mi rigs pa ni byas nas de //
translated: Having done what is improper,

original: ci ltar rigs pa la 'jug byed //
analyzed: ci ltar rigs pa la 'jug byed //
translated: how can it cause engagement with what is proper?

original: re zhig dang po ni rigs pa nyid la 'jug par byed la /
analyzed: re zhig dang po ni rigs pa nyid la 'jug par byed la /
translated: First, it causes engagement with what is proper,üîΩand then, in order to reverse that, it causes engagement with Dharma.

original: de nas ni de zlog pa'i phyir chos la yin pa'i phyir dbang phyug 'di ci ltar rtog pa sngon du byed pa yin /
analyzed: de nas ni de zlog pa'i phyir chos la yin pa'i phyir dbang phyug 'di ci ltar rtog pa sngon du byed pa yin /
translated: Therefore, how can this God be conceived as prior?

original: de phyir bkus la dor ro zhes bya ba de byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de phyir bkus la dor ro zhes bya ba de byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúAbandon the revered one.‚Äù

original: 'on te 'di sdig la 'jug par byed pa ni de'i las kyis byin gyis brlabs pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di sdig la 'jug par byed pa ni de'i las kyis byin gyis brlabs pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that the cause of engaging in vice is the blessing of that karma,

original: de lta yin na rtogs par byed pa nyams so //
analyzed: de lta yin na rtogs par byed pa nyams so //
translated: then the revealer is impaired.üîΩAnd why does that karma cause engagement?

original: las de yang ci'i phyir byed du 'jug ces thal ba mtshungs pas so //
analyzed: las de yang ci'i phyir byed du 'jug ces thal ba mtshungs pas so //
translated: The reductio is the same.

original: 'on te 'di chos ma yin pa byed du 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te 'di chos ma yin pa byed du 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: But it is not that he makes them do what is not Dharma.

original: chos ma yin pa byed pa de'i 'bras bu myong du 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa byed pa de'i 'bras bu myong du 'jug pa yin te /
translated: He makes them experience the effects of their own actions that are not Dharma,

original: de las gzhan pa'i dbang phyug bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dbang phyug bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like a lord.

original: de yang snying po med de /
analyzed: de yang snying po med de /
translated: This is also pointless.

original: dbang phyug gzhan ni nus med pas //
analyzed: dbang phyug gzhan ni nus med pas //
translated: Since the lord is powerless,

original: sdig pa 'gog par byed pa min //üîΩde ni nus med pa dag las //
analyzed: sdig pa 'gog par byed pa min // de ni nus med pa dag las //
translated: he does not stop evil.üîΩHe is asserted to be powerless

original: shin tu ldog par 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: shin tu ldog par 'dod pa yin //
translated: to stop those who are powerless.

original: 'on te 'di nus pa med pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di nus pa med pa nyid yin na /
translated: But if he is powerless,

original: de lta yin na /üîΩsdig bzhin thams cad dbang phyug gis //
analyzed: de lta yin na / sdig bzhin thams cad dbang phyug gis //
translated: then in that case,üîΩsince everything is not made by the lord,

original: byas pa min zhes gzengs bstod la //
analyzed: byas pa min zhes gzengs bstod la //
translated: like evil, he is refuted.

original: brjod bya rang legs byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: brjod bya rang legs byed pa'i phyir //
translated: Since the object of expression is good in itself,

original: chos sogs kyang de las sam ci //
analyzed: chos sogs kyang de las sam ci //
translated: how could Dharma and so on be from him?üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / 'jig rten dbang phyug med par yang //
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'jig rten dbang phyug med par yang //
translated: even without the lord of the world,

original: chos min 'bras bu spyod dam ci //üîΩmed par yang ni ci ltar de //
analyzed: chos min 'bras bu spyod dam ci // med par yang ni ci ltar de //
translated: how could the effects of non-Dharma be experienced?üîΩHow could he be understood

original: byed po nyid du rtogs par byed //
analyzed: byed po nyid du rtogs par byed //
translated: as the agent even without them?

original: 'on te de med par ni 'ga' //
analyzed: 'on te de med par ni 'ga' //
translated: But if he is without them,

original: chos min 'bras bu mi spyod na //
analyzed: chos min 'bras bu mi spyod na //
translated: If the effects of non-Dharma are not experienced,

original: rtogs pa dang ldan ci lta na //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan ci lta na //
translated: then how is it that those who possess realization

original: don dang @32b mi ldan 'di la zhugs //
analyzed: don dang @32b mi ldan 'di la zhugs //
translated: engage in this without any benefit?

original: rtsed mo don du de zhugs na //
analyzed: rtsed mo don du de zhugs na //
translated: If they engage in this for the sake of play,

original: rtogs pa sngon byed ga la yin //
analyzed: rtogs pa sngon byed ga la yin //
translated: how could they have realization beforehand?

original: gcig cig skad cig tsam 'brangs pas //
analyzed: gcig cig skad cig tsam 'brangs pas //
translated: By following one for just an instant,

original: gzhan pa dag ni srog dang bral //
analyzed: gzhan pa dag ni srog dang bral //
translated: the others are deprived of life.

original: gzhan yang / gal te bstan bcos gzhan pa kun //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te bstan bcos gzhan pa kun //
translated: Moreover, if all other treatises

original: dbang phyug rtogs pa las yin na //
analyzed: dbang phyug rtogs pa las yin na //
translated: are from the realization of ƒ™≈õvara,

original: bden dang mi bden nyer ston pa //
analyzed: bden dang mi bden nyer ston pa //
translated: then because they teach both the true and the untrue,

original: byed phyir ci ltar tshad ma yin //
analyzed: byed phyir ci ltar tshad ma yin //
translated: how could they be valid?

original: bstan bcos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid phan tshun 'gal bas gnod pa bden pa dang / bden pa ma yin pa nye bar ston par byed pa'i phyir 'di tshad ma ma yin pas na shin tu ya mtshan che ba dang / tshad ma can ma yin pa yang yin no ;
analyzed: bstan bcos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid phan tshun 'gal bas gnod pa bden pa dang / bden pa ma yin pa nye bar ston par byed pa'i phyir 'di tshad ma ma yin pas na shin tu ya mtshan che ba dang / tshad ma can ma yin pa yang yin no ;
translated: Because all treatises are invalidated by the mutual contradiction of their defining characteristics, and because they teach both the true and the untrue, they are not valid cognitions. Therefore they are very strange and not valid.

original: /'on te bstan bcos mtha' dag byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: /'on te bstan bcos mtha' dag byed pa ma yin na /
translated: But if you say that all treatises are not made by ƒ™≈õvara,üîΩthen why do you not accept that all of them are false?

original: de'i tshe bstan bcos gzhan bzhin du thams cad dbang phyug gis byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe bstan bcos gzhan bzhin du thams cad dbang phyug gis byas pa ma yin no //
translated: At that time, like other treatises, it is not that everything is made by God.

original: 'on te 'di chos dang chos ma yin pas bskul ba nyid thams cad byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te 'di chos dang chos ma yin pas bskul ba nyid thams cad byed pa yin te /
translated: But if it is that God, impelled by virtue and vice, does everything,

original: de lta ma yin na don mi srid do zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don mi srid do zhe na /
translated: then if that were not so, the purpose would not be possible.

original: de lta na skye bo tha mal pa thams cad bdag nyid chos la sogs pas bskul nas byed pa'i phyir dbang phyug rtogs pa don med do //üîΩgal te bdag kun thams cad kyi //
analyzed: de lta na skye bo tha mal pa thams cad bdag nyid chos la sogs pas bskul nas byed pa'i phyir dbang phyug rtogs pa don med do // gal te bdag kun thams cad kyi //
translated: In that case, since all ordinary people act impelled by virtue and so on, it is pointless to realize God.üîΩIf it is said that the self is not

original: byed po min zhes bya ba ni //üîΩbrtags na de ni thams cad kyi //
analyzed: byed po min zhes bya ba ni // brtags na de ni thams cad kyi //
translated: the maker of everything,üîΩthen when analyzed, where is the need

original: byed po gang du dgos par 'gyur //
analyzed: byed po gang du dgos par 'gyur //
translated: for a maker of everything?

original: thams cad kyi ni bdag rnams kyi ;
analyzed: thams cad kyi ni bdag rnams kyi ;
translated: If the self of everything

original: / thams cad byed na ci zhig nyams //üîΩde bzhin mang pos gcig dang ni //
analyzed: / thams cad byed na ci zhig nyams // de bzhin mang pos gcig dang ni //
translated: makes everything, what is lost?üîΩIn the same way, many make one,

original: mang po rnams kyang gcig gis byed //
analyzed: mang po rnams kyang gcig gis byed //
translated: and many are made by one.

original: 'on te gzhan du kun shes nyid //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan du kun shes nyid //
translated: But if omniscience were not

original: mi 'gyur phyir na thams cad kyi //
analyzed: mi 'gyur phyir na thams cad kyi //
translated: to occur in all,

original: byed pa po ni gcig 'dod de //
analyzed: byed pa po ni gcig 'dod de //
translated: then the maker of all would be one.

original: gzhan ni byed po nyid ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan ni byed po nyid ma yin //
translated: The other is not the creator.

original: byed pa 'di ni gtso bo ste //
analyzed: byed pa 'di ni gtso bo ste //
translated: This creator is the principal one.

original: de las don gnyer mchog thob 'gyur //
analyzed: de las don gnyer mchog thob 'gyur //
translated: From him, the one who desires the goal, the supreme is attained.

original: kun shes tsam gyis nus med pa //
analyzed: kun shes tsam gyis nus med pa //
translated: One who is not able by mere knowledge of all

original: gzhan gyis bstan par bya ba min //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan par bya ba min //
translated: is not to be taught by another.

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
