analyzed: bum pa dang / kham phor la sogs pa tha dad pa la ni sa'i rang bzhin rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir 'jim gong rnams la yang rgyu gzhan yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: But since the nature of earth is present in the various things such as the pot, the dish, and so on, the lump of clay would have other causes.

original: 'o na rgyu gzhan gzhan sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu gzhan gzhan sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that another cause precedes another cause.

original: 'jim gong ni gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jim gong ni gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the lump of clay is one.

original: 'jim gong dang @34b dbyi gu la sogs pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: 'jim gong dang @34b dbyi gu la sogs pa rnams kyang /
translated: But the lump of clay, the sprout, and so on,

original: ci srid gcig nyid kyi mthar thug par gzhan gcig sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci srid gcig nyid kyi mthar thug par gzhan gcig sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhe na /
translated: are preceded by another one until the ultimate one, which is one.

original: de yang ma yin te /üîΩsnying stobs la sogs pa dang / skyes bu rnams la yang rgyu gzhan yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te / snying stobs la sogs pa dang / skyes bu rnams la yang rgyu gzhan yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is not so.üîΩBecause the nature of sattva, rajas, and tamas would be other causes in the case of sattva, rajas, and tamas, and in the case of a person.

original: 'o na rgyu gzhan gcig nyid 'ga' zhig yod mod ce na ;
analyzed: 'o na rgyu gzhan gcig nyid 'ga' zhig yod mod ce na ;
translated: But surely there is some one cause.

original: de yang ma yin te /üîΩyon tan gsum sogs rang bzhin du //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te / yon tan gsum sogs rang bzhin du //
translated: That is not so.

original: gtso bo de ni 'grub mi 'gyur //üîΩdngos po nyid kyis rjes su 'gro phyir //
analyzed: gtso bo de ni 'grub mi 'gyur // dngos po nyid kyis rjes su 'gro phyir //
translated: The pradhƒÅna is not established as the nature of the three gu·πáas, and so on,üîΩbecause it is not the case that the three gu·πáas and so on are established as the nature of the pradhƒÅna.üîΩBecause the nature of the three gu·πáas and so on is present in things,

original: dngos rgyu 'ga' zhig 'dod par gyis //
analyzed: dngos rgyu 'ga' zhig 'dod par gyis //
translated: you must assert that some other cause is the cause of things.

original: dngos po dngos po zhes rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid 'bras bu rnams kyi rgyu yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po dngos po zhes rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid 'bras bu rnams kyi rgyu yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the nature of an entity is the cause of effects, since it is the nature of an entity that is the cause of effects.

original: gal te 'jim pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: gal te 'jim pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid gzhan ni med do //
translated: If the nature of an entity is not different from the nature of clay, etc.,

original: des na 'jim pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rgyu yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'jim pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rgyu yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the nature of clay, etc., would be the cause.

original: de ltar yin na gtso bo thams cad kyi bdag nyid can yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yin na gtso bo thams cad kyi bdag nyid can yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that were so, it would follow that the nature of clay, etc., is the nature of everything.

original: de ni med de /üîΩngo bo nyid kyis rnam kun du //
analyzed: de ni med de / ngo bo nyid kyis rnam kun du //
translated: That is not so.

original: 'bras bu rgyu yi rjes 'gro min //üîΩme sogs gzhan du gyur pa las //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu yi rjes 'gro min // me sogs gzhan du gyur pa las //
translated: The nature of an entity does not follow the nature of a cause in any way.

original: du ba la sogs gzhan du mthong //
analyzed: du ba la sogs gzhan du mthong //
translated: Smoke is seen as different from fire, etc.,üîΩwhich have transformed into something else.

original: gang zhig gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa de'i rgyu de yin gyi de'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa de'i rgyu de yin gyi de'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: That which follows the presence and absence of something is its cause, but not its nature.

original: de lta yin dang / me las du ba dang / sprin la sogs pa las chu la sogs pa yin pas de la 'dra ba med pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang / me las du ba dang / sprin la sogs pa las chu la sogs pa yin pas de la 'dra ba med pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then smoke would not be the effect of fire, and water, etc. would not be the effect of clouds, etc., because they would not be similar.

original: 'on te der yang de lta bur gyur ba'i 'bras bu nyid las 'dra ba'i rgyu 'ga' zhig yod par rjes su dpog go zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te der yang de lta bur gyur ba'i 'bras bu nyid las 'dra ba'i rgyu 'ga' zhig yod par rjes su dpog go zhe na /
translated: But if you infer that a cause that is similar to a certain effect exists, even though it is not seen,

original: gal te 'dra ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'brel ba yod na rjes su dpogs shig / yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'dra ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'brel ba yod na rjes su dpogs shig / yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: then if there is a connection between similarity and the relation of cause and effect, infer it! But it does not exist,

original: khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no pervasion.

original: gang gi 'khrul pa de yang phyogs su byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi 'khrul pa de yang phyogs su byed do zhe na /
translated: But suppose you make that error your position.

original: de lta na ni 'o na 'ga' yang ma nges pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na 'ga' yang ma nges pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then nothing would be uncertain,

original: gang dang gang gis 'khrul pa de nyid phyogs su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dang gang gis 'khrul pa de nyid phyogs su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you would make whatever you err about your position.

original: des na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is not the case, because it would follow, absurdly, that there would be an infinite regress.

original: ci ste yang /
analyzed: ci ste yang /
translated: But suppose you say that

original: 'di ni las kyi yongs gyur ces //
analyzed: 'di ni las kyi yongs gyur ces //
translated: This is the transformation of karma.

original: bya ba de ni ga las grub //
analyzed: bya ba de ni ga las grub //
translated: But how is this action accomplished?

original: rjes su 'gro dang ldog pa ni //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro dang ldog pa ni //
translated: The presence or absence of the effect

original: las la'ang mthong ba med pa nyid //
analyzed: las la'ang mthong ba med pa nyid //
translated: is not seen in the action.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyang 'gro ba sna tshogs 'di'i rgyu yin no zhes shes pa med do @35a * //üîΩzhes brjod na /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyang 'gro ba sna tshogs 'di'i rgyu yin no zhes shes pa med do @35a * // zhes brjod na /
translated: It is not known that virtuous and nonvirtuous actions are the cause of this variety of reincarnating beings.

original: 'di ni re zhig gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig gzhag ste /
translated: This is set aside for the time being.

original: gzhan brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan brjod do //
translated: We will discuss something else.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan yang nus pa mtha' dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan yang nus pa mtha' dag dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though they are attached to desire and so on, they are endowed with all abilities.

original: des na rtsad mo'i don du 'gro ba sna tshogs byed pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de la bshad pa ni /
analyzed: des na rtsad mo'i don du 'gro ba sna tshogs byed pa yin no zhes gang brjod pa de la bshad pa ni /
translated: Therefore, they engage in various activities for the sake of play.

original: mi shes chags pa dang ldan rnams //
analyzed: mi shes chags pa dang ldan rnams //
translated: Those who are attached through ignorance

original: rtse brod dag pa'i bdag nyid min //
analyzed: rtse brod dag pa'i bdag nyid min //
translated: are not of the nature of pure play.

original: cung zad tsam zhig dag pas kyang //üîΩ'phags pa rtsed mo la mi 'jug / ya rabs gzhan ni dmyal la sogs kyis //
analyzed: cung zad tsam zhig dag pas kyang // 'phags pa rtsed mo la mi 'jug / ya rabs gzhan ni dmyal la sogs kyis //
translated: Even though they are slightly pure,üîΩthe noble ones do not engage in play.

original: 'jigs phyir rtsed mo la mi 'jug / de la 'jigs pa de med pas //
analyzed: 'jigs phyir rtsed mo la mi 'jug / de la 'jigs pa de med pas //
translated: Other noble ones do not engage in play because they fear birth in the hells and so on.

original: ci phyir de las ldog pa yin //
analyzed: ci phyir de las ldog pa yin //
translated: Why is it the opposite for you?

original: gal te 'dod chags la sogs kyis //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs kyis //
translated: If desire and so on

original: dmyal sogs sdug bsngal 'jug byed na //üîΩde la de med pa 'di ni //
analyzed: dmyal sogs sdug bsngal 'jug byed na // de la de med pa 'di ni //
translated: Cause you to enter the suffering of the hells and so on,üîΩThen how could you, who are devoid of that,

original: khyod la mdza' bshes su yis brjod //
analyzed: khyod la mdza' bshes su yis brjod //
translated: Be called a friend?

original: bsgom pa'i stobs las yang dag 'byung //üîΩtsandan ste'u mnyam pa la //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i stobs las yang dag 'byung // tsandan ste'u mnyam pa la //
translated: It arises from the power of meditation.

original: dmyal ba la sogs sdug bsngal gyis //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs sdug bsngal gyis //
translated: The suffering of the hells and so on

original: gnod pa ma yin zhes byar gnas //
analyzed: gnod pa ma yin zhes byar gnas //
translated: Is not harmful, like a sandalwood stake.

original: de ni de lta nyid 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de ni de lta nyid 'gyur ba //
translated: This is the position.

original: yin zhes khyed la de mi rigs //
analyzed: yin zhes khyed la de mi rigs //
translated: But it is not right for you to say,üîΩ‚ÄúIt is so.‚Äù

original: 'di de'i rang bzhin nyid yin na //
analyzed: 'di de'i rang bzhin nyid yin na //
translated: If this is its nature,

original: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur //
translated: It would be the nature of the world.

original: 'di ni de gcig nyid yin na //
analyzed: 'di ni de gcig nyid yin na //
translated: If this is the same as that,

original: 'di ni rgyal po spyod par gsal //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyal po spyod par gsal //
translated: This is clearly the conduct of a king.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / dbang phyug dbang phyug las 'gyur zhing //üîΩde yi'ang gzhan las de las ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / dbang phyug dbang phyug las 'gyur zhing // de yi'ang gzhan las de las ni //
translated: ƒ™≈õvara arises from ƒ™≈õvara,üîΩAnd from that, from that,

original: gzhan gyi de yang gzhan las de //üîΩdbang phyug ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: gzhan gyi de yang gzhan las de // dbang phyug ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
translated: That arises from another.üîΩFrom the nature of ƒ™≈õvara

original: brgya byin tshangs pa nyid srid pas //
analyzed: brgya byin tshangs pa nyid srid pas //
translated: The existence of ≈öakra and BrahmƒÅ arises.

original: yon tan khyad 'byung srid na ni //
analyzed: yon tan khyad 'byung srid na ni //
translated: If it is possible for a special quality to arise,

original: dbang phyug nyid kyang thob bya ste //
analyzed: dbang phyug nyid kyang thob bya ste //
translated: then even the state of ƒ™≈õvara is to be attained.

original: dbang phyug rtag tu gnas pa med //
analyzed: dbang phyug rtag tu gnas pa med //
translated: But ƒ™≈õvara does not always exist.

original: 'on te de yang med nyid ni //
analyzed: 'on te de yang med nyid ni //
translated: But if he is nonexistent,

original: des na 'khor 'gyur dbang phyug med //
analyzed: des na 'khor 'gyur dbang phyug med //
translated: then the world would not revolve around ƒ™≈õvara.

original: gang zhig 'di la skur 'debs pa //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di la skur 'debs pa //
translated: If one denies this,

original: des ni gzhan du'ang bzod dam ci //
analyzed: des ni gzhan du'ang bzod dam ci //
translated: then how could one accept anything else?

original: gang zhig skye bo dam pa ni //
analyzed: gang zhig skye bo dam pa ni //
translated: If a holy person

original: 'du ba grong du bcom pa de //üîΩskyob pa dag dang bral pa la //
analyzed: 'du ba grong du bcom pa de // skyob pa dag dang bral pa la //
translated: is destroyed in a village,üîΩhow could one endure

original: dgon pa ru ni ga la bzod //
analyzed: dgon pa ru ni ga la bzod //
translated: being in a wilderness devoid of a protector?

original: de ltar gong nas gong du 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin la de'i rjes su 'brangs nas rab tu 'gyur ba ston pa gang yin pa de rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid kyi dngos po mi spong ngo zhes bya ba de la yid ches pa ci yod /
analyzed: de ltar gong nas gong du 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin la de'i rjes su 'brangs nas rab tu 'gyur ba ston pa gang yin pa de rjes su 'gro ba med pa nyid kyi dngos po mi spong ngo zhes bya ba de la yid ches pa ci yod /
translated: In this way, the nature of things is to change from one state to another. If one follows this, then it is clear that things change. How could one have confidence in the claim that ‚Äúthings do not abandon their previous nature‚Äù?üîΩTherefore:

original: de'i phyir / dngos po dbyibs dang 'brel ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dngos po dbyibs dang 'brel ba'i phyir //
translated: Because things are related to shape,

original: byed pos byas par grub na yang //
analyzed: byed pos byas par grub na yang //
translated: even though it is established that the creator is the maker,

original: rgyu med yon tan ldan par go //
analyzed: rgyu med yon tan ldan par go //
translated: it is understood that the creator is endowed with the cause.

original: gang las 'grub par @35b 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: gang las 'grub par @35b 'gyur ba yin //
translated: How could it be established?

original: yon tan khyad par la khyad par du mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan khyad par la khyad par du mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the difference is seen in the special qualities.

original: sngar nus pa med pa rnams kyang mngon par brtson pa'i khyad par las phyis nus par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs kyi /
analyzed: sngar nus pa med pa rnams kyang mngon par brtson pa'i khyad par las phyis nus par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs kyi /
translated: It is reasonable to say that even those who previously were not able to do so will later become able due to the special effort.

original: shin tu mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nus pa'i bdag nyid ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa rjes su 'gro ba dang bral ba la ni sgrub par byed pa mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: shin tu mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nus pa'i bdag nyid ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa rjes su 'gro ba dang bral ba la ni sgrub par byed pa mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: But it is impossible to establish that which is utterly heterogeneous, which is essentially established as having the nature of potentiality, and which is devoid of continuity.üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / dbyibs zhes bya 'di dngos po yi //
analyzed: gzhan yang / dbyibs zhes bya 'di dngos po yi //
translated: This so-called shape

original: gnas par grub pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: gnas par grub pa yod ma yin //
translated: Does not exist as the shape of a thing.

original: 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it exists as mere error,

original: de ni rdul phran nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni rdul phran nyid yin no //
translated: It is the same as the atom itself.

original: rdul phra rab bdag las tha dad pa'i rdzas la brten pa'i dbyibs ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab bdag las tha dad pa'i rdzas la brten pa'i dbyibs ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Shape that is based on a substance that is different from the subtle atom does not exist.

original: rdul phra rab dga' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: rdul phra rab dga' zhig tu zad do //
translated: It is just the subtle atom itself.

original: des na rdul phra rab dag bzhin no zhes chos mi mthun par ji ltar brjod /
analyzed: des na rdul phra rab dag bzhin no zhes chos mi mthun par ji ltar brjod /
translated: Therefore, how could it be said that it is heterogeneous, like the subtle atom?

original: 'on te de ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa tsam du rnam par gnas pa nye bar bkod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de ni 'jig rten gyi grags pa tsam du rnam par gnas pa nye bar bkod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that this is merely a conventional expression of the world,

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: that also is not tenable.

original: rtogs pas bkod pa tsam ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pas bkod pa tsam ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For a mere expression of understanding is not a proof.

original: 'on te rdul phra rab dag nyid rang bzhin des brjod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rdul phra rab dag nyid rang bzhin des brjod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the atoms themselves are expressed by that nature,

original: de lta yin na rdul phra rab dag kyang 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: de lta yin na rdul phra rab dag kyang 'bras bu nyid do //
translated: then the atoms themselves are the effect.

original: des na 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di nyid gtan tshigs su dgod par 'os so //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di nyid gtan tshigs su dgod par 'os so //
translated: Therefore, it is proper to state just this as the reason: ‚ÄúBecause it is an effect.‚Äù

original: 'on te de lta bur 'khrul pa skyed par byed pa'i rdul phra rab de ltar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te de lta bur 'khrul pa skyed par byed pa'i rdul phra rab de ltar brjod pa yin no //
translated: But if you say that the atoms are expressed in that way, generating such a delusion,

original: de lta na ni 'o na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na /
translated: then in that case,

original: gal te rdul phran dngos su na //
analyzed: gal te rdul phran dngos su na //
translated: If the atoms are actually

original: ngo bo nyid kyis snang na ni //üîΩdbang phyug la ni nga yi dbyibs //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis snang na ni // dbang phyug la ni nga yi dbyibs //
translated: manifested by their own nature,üîΩhow could there be the idea

original: byed pa'i blo ni ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: byed pa'i blo ni ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: that the shape of the lord is the cause?

original: gal te nges par brtags nas ni //
analyzed: gal te nges par brtags nas ni //
translated: If, having been ascertained,

original: byed pa de la yod min na //
analyzed: byed pa de la yod min na //
translated: it does not exist in the cause,

original: brtags nas byed pa min na ni //
analyzed: brtags nas byed pa min na ni //
translated: If it is not so,

original: de ni ci ltar kun shes yin ;üîΩ/'on te dbyibs ni gzhan dag gis //
analyzed: de ni ci ltar kun shes yin ; /'on te dbyibs ni gzhan dag gis //
translated: how can it be omniscient?

original: khas blangs par ni rtog gce na //
analyzed: khas blangs par ni rtog gce na //
translated: If you think that the shape is accepted by others,

original: rang gi rtogs pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: rang gi rtogs pa ma yin pa //
translated: then it is not your own understanding.

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs ga la yin //
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs ga la yin //
translated: How can it be accepted by others?

original: 'on te yan lag can yod pas //
analyzed: 'on te yan lag can yod pas //
translated: If you say that it is because the whole exists,

original: de ni lan du rjod byed na //
analyzed: de ni lan du rjod byed na //
translated: that is a reply that is too late.

original: 'di ni phyis nas brtag bya ste //
analyzed: 'di ni phyis nas brtag bya ste //
translated: This should be investigated later,

original: shin tu 'thad par dka' ba yin //
analyzed: shin tu 'thad par dka' ba yin //
translated: for it is very difficult to accept.

original: yang na dpe la the tshom za ba yin te dbang phyug nyid kyi the tshom za ba ste ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na dpe la the tshom za ba yin te dbang phyug nyid kyi the tshom za ba ste ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: Or else, there is doubt about the example, because there is doubt about God himself, that is, he is not ascertained.

original: dbyibs ma grub pa'i phyir don bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid gtan tshigs su bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: dbyibs ma grub pa'i phyir don bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin nyid gtan tshigs su bkod pa yin no //
translated: The reason is stated to be the nature of performing a function, because shape is not established.

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin de ni dbang phyug kyang yin pa'i phyir de nyid kyis ma nges so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin de ni dbang phyug kyang yin pa'i phyir de nyid kyis ma nges so //
translated: Since God also has that nature, it is not established by that reason alone.

original: dbang phyug de ni bsdad cing @36a * //
analyzed: dbang phyug de ni bsdad cing @36a * //
translated: Even though God remains

original: bsdad cing 'jug pa dang don bya ba byed pa yin yang /
analyzed: bsdad cing 'jug pa dang don bya ba byed pa yin yang /
translated: and remains, engaging and performing a function,

original: gzhan gyis bskul ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bskul ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it is impelled by another.

original: 'on te 'di ni rang nyid nus pa yin pa des na gzhan gyis bskul ba ma yin no /
analyzed: 'on te 'di ni rang nyid nus pa yin pa des na gzhan gyis bskul ba ma yin no /
translated: If it is capable of acting by itself, then it is not impelled by another.

original: rdza mkhan la sogs pa yang gang du nus pa der gzhan gyis bskul lo zhes mi rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdza mkhan la sogs pa yang gang du nus pa der gzhan gyis bskul lo zhes mi rigs pa nyid do //

original: de dag gi nus pa med pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi nus pa med pa nyid do zhe na /

analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gzhan rjes su dpog na nus pa yod pa ma yin no //

analyzed: gzhan yang / rdul phran dag la dbyibs med ces //

original: bya ba 'di ni ga las 'dod //
analyzed: bya ba 'di ni ga las 'dod //

original: gang gis dbyibs med par 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang gis dbyibs med par 'gyur ba //

analyzed: rdul phran rnams kyi rdul phra rab nyid rnam pa de ltar rtogs pa ni med do //

original: 'on te 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'on te 'di skad du /

analyzed: rdul gnyis po can gyi mthar thug pa'i rags pa yin no//
