analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa yang sngar dmigs pa bar du chod pa'i gnas skabs na ma zhig go zhes /
translated: A pot, etc., is also recognized as not destroyed when it is in a state where it is obstructed from being perceived.

original: bar chad dang bral ba na ngo shes pa nyid las rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bar chad dang bral ba na ngo shes pa nyid las rtogs pa yin no //
translated: When it is free from obstruction, it is recognized.

original: sgra yang ngo shes pa'i phyir de bzhin du rigs so //
analyzed: sgra yang ngo shes pa'i phyir de bzhin du rigs so //
translated: Sound is also recognized. It is reasonable that it is the same.

original: 'on te gzhan gyis dmigs pa'i phyir de ltar rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis dmigs pa'i phyir de ltar rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: But if it is understood in that way because it is perceived by another,

original: ngo shes pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni ma yin na /
translated: not because it is recognized,

original: gzhan gyis dmigs pa las brgyud nas de ltar rtogs kyi rang nyid ngo shes pa las dngos su ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de kho na mthong ba chen po yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis dmigs pa las brgyud nas de ltar rtogs kyi rang nyid ngo shes pa las dngos su ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de kho na mthong ba chen po yin no //
translated: then it is a great insight into reality to say that it is understood in that way indirectly, through being perceived by another, but not directly, through being recognized by itself.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gzhan gyis kyang ni ngo shes las //üîΩgzhan ba las ni shes min na ;
analyzed: gzhan yang / gzhan gyis kyang ni ngo shes las // gzhan ba las ni shes min na ;
translated: if it is recognized by another,üîΩbut not known from another,

original: / gzhan las kyang ni ji ltar de //
analyzed: / gzhan las kyang ni ji ltar de //
translated: how is it that it is known from another?

original: rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin //
translated: How is it that it is permanent?

original: de'i phyir 'dir /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir /
translated: Therefore, here,

original: spyis kyang sgrub par byed pa la //
analyzed: spyis kyang sgrub par byed pa la //
translated: And the general also establishes the particular.üîΩ

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar brjod pa nyid lan yin no //üîΩyang na / 'bras nyid gzhan gyi cha yis ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar brjod pa nyid lan yin no // yang na / 'bras nyid gzhan gyi cha yis ni //
translated: The reply to this is the same as that given above.

original: bsgrub bya grub par ston pa gang //
analyzed: bsgrub bya grub par ston pa gang //
translated: Or, the result itself is shown to be established by the factor of another,üîΩin the proof of the probandum.

original: de ni 'bras mtshungs smra ba po'i //
analyzed: de ni 'bras mtshungs smra ba po'i //
translated: This is the same result as the proponent‚Äôs

original: bsam pa las de'i rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: bsam pa las de'i rnam gsum mo //
translated: intention, but it has three modes.

original: zhes slob dpon gyis bstan pa'i 'bras mtshungs kyi mtshan nyid las bstan nas de skad bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes slob dpon gyis bstan pa'i 'bras mtshungs kyi mtshan nyid las bstan nas de skad bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is stated in accordance with the definition of the same result as the proponent‚Äôs intention, which was taught by the master.

original: rkang mig gi mtshan nyid ni mi 'thad do zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: rkang mig gi mtshan nyid ni mi 'thad do zhes bstan zin to //
translated: The definition of the blind man has already been shown to be untenable.

original: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: gal te byas pa'i phyir sgra mi rtag ste bum pa bzhin no zhes byas pa na 'bras bu gzhan gyis bum pas mi rtag pa yin pas /
analyzed: gal te byas pa'i phyir sgra mi rtag ste bum pa bzhin no zhes byas pa na 'bras bu gzhan gyis bum pas mi rtag pa yin pas /
translated: If it is said that ‚Äúsound is impermanent because it is produced, like a pot,‚Äù then the result is the same as the proponent‚Äôs intention, since the impermanence of the pot is established by another result.

original: 'dir sgra la cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'bras mtshungs yin no //
analyzed: 'dir sgra la cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'bras mtshungs yin no //
translated: Here, what is the result for sound?

original: 'di ni smra ba po'i bsam pa las rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di ni smra ba po'i bsam pa las rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: This has three modes from the proponent‚Äôs intention.

original: gal te smra ba po bum pa'i 'bras bu nyid sgra la med do zhes rtsod par byed na ni ma grub pa lta bu /
analyzed: gal te smra ba po bum pa'i 'bras bu nyid sgra la med do zhes rtsod par byed na ni ma grub pa lta bu /
translated: If the opponent argues that the effect of the pot is not in the sound, then it is as if he has no proof.

original: 'on te sgra'i 'bras bu nyid bum pa la sogs pa mi rtag pa dag la med do zhes bya ba yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te sgra'i 'bras bu nyid bum pa la sogs pa mi rtag pa dag la med do zhes bya ba yin na ni /
translated: But if he argues that the effect of the sound is not in impermanent things such as pots,

original: de las 'gal ba ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: de las 'gal ba ltar snang ba'o //
translated: then it is as if he has a contradictory appearance.

original: 'on te de rtag pa dag la yang med do zhes bya ba yin na ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te de rtag pa dag la yang med do zhes bya ba yin na ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa ltar snang ba'o //
translated: But if he argues that it is not in permanent things, then it is as if he has an uncertain appearance, because it is not common to both.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang mtshungs pa ni chos @39b mthun na yang khyad par brjod pa rtog pa dang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang mtshungs pa ni chos @39b mthun na yang khyad par brjod pa rtog pa dang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Similarity to a conception is the expression of a difference when there is similarity.

original: dper na snga ma bzhin du bum pa dang chos mthun pas mi rtag par byas na /üîΩchos mthun pa de yod kyang chos par bya ba nyid dang / mig gis gzung ba nyid la sogs pas bum pa nyid mi rtag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na snga ma bzhin du bum pa dang chos mthun pas mi rtag par byas na / chos mthun pa de yod kyang chos par bya ba nyid dang / mig gis gzung ba nyid la sogs pas bum pa nyid mi rtag pa yin gyi /
translated: For example, if one makes a pot impermanent by similarity to the former,

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: then, although that similarity exists, one says that the pot is impermanent because of being an object of activity, because of being apprehended by the eye, and so on, but not because of anything else.

original: gal te 'dir yang dbyibs nyid la sogs pa'i 'bras bu spyis sgrub par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te 'dir yang dbyibs nyid la sogs pa'i 'bras bu spyis sgrub par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if you think that here also the universal of shape, etc. is not the probandum,

original: ri dang bum pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs yongs su brtags pas /
analyzed: ri dang bum pa la sogs pa'i dbyibs yongs su brtags pas /
translated: because the shape of a mountain, pot, etc. is imagined,

original: 'brel pa can gyi sgo nas khyad par yongs su rtog na ni 'bras mtshungs brjod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa can gyi sgo nas khyad par yongs su rtog na ni 'bras mtshungs brjod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: and if you imagine a distinction by way of connection, then it is just the same as the probandum.

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: dbyibs la sogs pa dag gi spyi //
analyzed: dbyibs la sogs pa dag gi spyi //
translated: The universal of shape, etc.

original: blo sngon byed pa las byung min //üîΩde ni shing sogs gzhan la yang //
analyzed: blo sngon byed pa las byung min // de ni shing sogs gzhan la yang //
translated: Does not arise from a prior cognition.üîΩBecause it is seen in other things, such as wood,

original: mthong ba'i phyir zhes brjod zin te //
analyzed: mthong ba'i phyir zhes brjod zin te //
translated: and so on, has already been explained.üîΩWhat is the probandum anywhere,

original: 'brel pa yi ni khyad par dag / spangs nas 'gar ni sgrub byed gang //
analyzed: 'brel pa yi ni khyad par dag / spangs nas 'gar ni sgrub byed gang //
translated: after abandoning the distinction of connection?

original: de ni shin tu 'brel med de //
analyzed: de ni shin tu 'brel med de //
translated: That is utterly unconnected,

original: mi rtag bya rog nag pos bzhin ;
analyzed: mi rtag bya rog nag pos bzhin ;
translated: like an impermanent black crow.

original: /'dir gzhan dag smra ba ni /
analyzed: /'dir gzhan dag smra ba ni /
translated: Here others say:

original: gal te slo sngon du byed pa rjes su 'gro bar ma mthong bas dbyibs la sogs pa de nyid sgrub byed du mi 'gyur mod /
analyzed: gal te slo sngon du byed pa rjes su 'gro bar ma mthong bas dbyibs la sogs pa de nyid sgrub byed du mi 'gyur mod /
translated: If the universal of shape, etc. is not the probandum because it is not seen to be concomitant with a prior cognition,

original: dbyibs dbyibs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: dbyibs dbyibs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
translated: The meaning of the words ‚Äúshape, shape‚Äù and so on is the universal.

original: des na des mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir gcig gi 'bras bur grub po zhe na /
analyzed: des na des mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir gcig gi 'bras bur grub po zhe na /
translated: Therefore, because they have the same characteristics, they are established as the effect of one.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.üîΩIn this way:

original: 'di ltar / rtog pa tsam gyis bkod pa'i chos //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rtog pa tsam gyis bkod pa'i chos //
translated: A phenomenon that is posited by mere thought

original: don nye ba dang bral ba las //
analyzed: don nye ba dang bral ba las //
translated: is devoid of a meaning that is near.

original: don de yod par gyur na ni //
analyzed: don de yod par gyur na ni //
translated: If that meaning existed,

original: gang du 'dod pa der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang du 'dod pa der 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be whatever is asserted.

original: rigs gzhan las ni rab grub pa //
analyzed: rigs gzhan las ni rab grub pa //
translated: It is established as a horn that is different from the class of a cow

original: sgra yi spyi ni mthong ba las //
analyzed: sgra yi spyi ni mthong ba las //
translated: because the universal of sound is seen.

original: sgrub byed mi rigs dag la sogs //
analyzed: sgrub byed mi rigs dag la sogs //
translated: It is not correct to establish the horn that is related to a different class

original: go yin phyir rva can bzhin //üîΩdag la sogs pa dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa rigs gzhan la rab tu grub pa'i rva dang 'brel pa de /
analyzed: go yin phyir rva can bzhin // dag la sogs pa dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa rigs gzhan la rab tu grub pa'i rva dang 'brel pa de /
translated: because it is understood to be like the one with a horn.üîΩThe horn that is related to a different class, such as a cow, is established.üîΩIs it to be inferred by the mere nondifference of words, such as ‚Äúwhat is understood‚Äù?

original: ci go zhes tshig tha mi dad pa tsam gyis rjes su dpag par bya ba'am /üîΩdon gcig na yang skya bo las //
analyzed: ci go zhes tshig tha mi dad pa tsam gyis rjes su dpag par bya ba'am / don gcig na yang skya bo las //
translated: Or is it to be inferred by the meaning?üîΩEven if it is the same meaning, it is said that

original: rjes su dpog pa min zhes brjod //
analyzed: rjes su dpog pa min zhes brjod //
translated: it is not to be inferred from a pale one.

original: gang la don kyang yod min na //
analyzed: gang la don kyang yod min na //
translated: If there is no object,

original: sgra tsam mtshungs par smos ci dgos //
analyzed: sgra tsam mtshungs par smos ci dgos //
translated: what need is there to mention the similarity of sound?

original: re zhig don ni mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa srid pa nyid do //üîΩde la yang rtogs pa zhib mo dang ldan pa dag gis sgrub par byed pa ma yin par brjod na gang la bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa 'di tsam yang ring du @40a * //
analyzed: re zhig don ni mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa srid pa nyid do // de la yang rtogs pa zhib mo dang ldan pa dag gis sgrub par byed pa ma yin par brjod na gang la bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa 'di tsam yang ring du @40a * //
translated: First, the object is the possibility of the connection with the probandum that is intended.

original: byas pas sgra mtshungs pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: byas pas sgra mtshungs pa lta ci smos /
translated: If one says that it is not established by those who are skilled in subtle understanding, then what need is there to mention the similarity of sound when the connection with the probandum is far removed?

original: 'di ltar / brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang phyir //
translated: Because of the dependence on what is intended,

original: sgra rnams gang la'ang phyir mi rtag pa thams cad 'grub //
analyzed: sgra rnams gang la'ang phyir mi rtag pa thams cad 'grub //
translated: all sounds are established for anyone.

original: sgra 'di dag ni 'ga' la yang te /
analyzed: sgra 'di dag ni 'ga' la yang te /
translated: These sounds are not for anyone,

original: brjod par ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod par ma yin te /
translated: because they are not expressed.

original: brjod par 'dod pa thams cad la bkag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa thams cad la bkag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no obstruction to all that is intended.

original: gal te de las don grub na ni 'ga' yang don grub pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de las don grub na ni 'ga' yang don grub pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object were established from that, then no one would be without the establishment of the object.

original: des na gzhan gyis khas blangs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyis khas blangs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not accepted by others.

original: 'dis ni ser skya la sogs kyis //
analyzed: 'dis ni ser skya la sogs kyis //
translated: The non-Buddhist philosophers, such as Ka·πáƒÅda,

original: mi rtag sogs phyir sems med la //
analyzed: mi rtag sogs phyir sems med la //
translated: say that the soul is not the mind, because it is impermanent, etc.

original: srog dang shun pa bshus na ni //
analyzed: srog dang shun pa bshus na ni //
translated: But when the bark is removed from a plantain tree,

original: ci phyir sems ldan dpyad pa yin //
analyzed: ci phyir sems ldan dpyad pa yin //
translated: why do you not investigate the soul that is in the plantain?üîΩThe non-Buddhist philosophers, such as Ka·πáƒÅda, say that the soul is not the mind, because it is impermanent, etc.

original: ser skya ba la sogs pa'i sems pa med pa can nam gzhan dag gang las thub pa'i khang bzangs kyi rtser 'dzeg par 'gyur bde ni don gyi de kho na nyid du med pa'i phyir sgra tsam mtshungs pa nye bar bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: ser skya ba la sogs pa'i sems pa med pa can nam gzhan dag gang las thub pa'i khang bzangs kyi rtser 'dzeg par 'gyur bde ni don gyi de kho na nyid du med pa'i phyir sgra tsam mtshungs pa nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: But when the bark is removed from a plantain tree, why do you not investigate the soul that is in the plantain?

original: 'di ltar / mi rtag pa nyid grangs can la //üîΩdngos por grub pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mi rtag pa nyid grangs can la // dngos por grub pa yod ma yin //
translated: The non-Buddhist philosophers, such as Ka·πáƒÅda, say that the soul is not the mind, because it is impermanent, etc.üîΩBut when the bark is removed from a plantain tree, why do you not investigate the soul that is in the plantain?üîΩThe non-Buddhist philosophers, such as Ka·πáƒÅda, say that the soul is not the mind, because it is impermanent, etc.üîΩBut when the bark is removed from a plantain tree, why do you not investigate the soul that is in the plantain?üîΩThe non-Buddhist philosophers, such as Ka·πáƒÅda, say that the soul is not the mind, because it is impermanent, etc.üîΩBut when the bark is removed from a plantain tree, why do you not investigate the soul that is in the plantain?üîΩThe non-Buddhist philosophers, such as Ka·πáƒÅda, say that the soul is not the mind, because it is impermanent, etc.üîΩBut when the bark is removed from a plantain tree, why do you not investigate the soul that is in the plantain?üîΩThe non-Buddhist philosophers, such as Ka·πáƒÅda, say that the soul is not the mind, because it is impermanent, etc.üîΩBut when the bark is removed from a plantain tree, why do you not investigate the soul that is in the plantain?

original: de ni don rnams mi gsal ba //
analyzed: de ni don rnams mi gsal ba //
translated: The non-Buddhist philosophers, such as Ka·πáƒÅda, say that the soul is not the mind, because it is impermanent, etc.

original: yin gyis rjes 'gro med 'jig min //
analyzed: yin gyis rjes 'gro med 'jig min //
translated: But when the bark is removed from a plantain tree, why do you not investigate the soul that is in the plantain?

original: mngon par mi gsal ba'i mi rtag pa de nyid ni sangs rgyas pa la ma grub bo //
analyzed: mngon par mi gsal ba'i mi rtag pa de nyid ni sangs rgyas pa la ma grub bo //
translated: The non-Buddhist philosophers, such as Ka·πáƒÅda, say that the soul is not the mind, because it is impermanent, etc.

original: 'o na gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang yin zhe na /
translated: But when the bark is removed from a plantain tree, why do you not investigate the soul that is in the plantain?

original: rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig pa nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig pa nyid do //
translated: The non-Buddhist philosophers

original: gal te zhig pa dang mngon par mi gsal ba dag bskal bar mtshungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te zhig pa dang mngon par mi gsal ba dag bskal bar mtshungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the destruction of something and its nonmanifestation the same?üîΩWhat is this thing called a ‚Äúkalpa‚Äù?

original: bskal pa zhes bya ba 'di ni ci zhig / mi mngon pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: bskal pa zhes bya ba 'di ni ci zhig / mi mngon pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: It is nonmanifestation.

original: 'o na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang gtso bo la sogs pa yang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang gtso bo la sogs pa yang mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Well then, even the horns of a rabbit and the primal nature, etc., would be impermanent.

original: yod pa mi mngon pa'i bdag nyid yin na yang gtso bo la sogs pa yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa mi mngon pa'i bdag nyid yin na yang gtso bo la sogs pa yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Even the primal nature, etc., would exist, even though their existence is not manifest.

original: snang ba mi mngon par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na //
analyzed: snang ba mi mngon par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na //
translated: But manifestation is not manifest.

original: snang ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig gal te don gyi ngo bo nyid yin na ci ltar snang ba mi snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig gal te don gyi ngo bo nyid yin na ci ltar snang ba mi snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: What is this thing called ‚Äúmanifestation‚Äù? If it is the nature of an object, how can manifestation not be manifest?

original: de spangs na dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de spangs na dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is abandoned, the nature of an entity would be nonexistent.

original: 'on te snang ba'i bdag nyid dngos po las gzhan yin na /
analyzed: 'on te snang ba'i bdag nyid dngos po las gzhan yin na /
translated: But if manifestation is something other than an entity,

original: 'o na de med pa nyid ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba med par zhig pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'o na de med pa nyid ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba med par zhig pa ma yin /
translated: then how can it be that its nonexistence is not a destruction that lacks a subsequent existence?

original: gzhan med na gzhan bskal bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan med na gzhan bskal bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not something other, it could not be something other even after a kalpa.

original: de yang thams cad kyi tshe gtso bo dang mtshungs pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang thams cad kyi tshe gtso bo dang mtshungs pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since it would be the same as the primary matter at all times, it would not be impermanent.

original: de'i phyir sgras brtags pa tsam nyid sgrub byed du khas blangs pa yin no//
analyzed: de'i phyir sgras brtags pa tsam nyid sgrub byed du khas blangs pa yin no//
translated: Therefore, you accept that the mere designation by words is the proof.

original: @40b shun pa bshus na 'chi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: @40b shun pa bshus na 'chi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yang de bzhin te /
translated: As for the statement, ‚Äúbecause it dies when the bark is removed,‚Äù that is the same.

original: shun pa thams cad bshus na 'chi ba'i sgra 'jug pa tshad ma nyid do //
analyzed: shun pa thams cad bshus na 'chi ba'i sgra 'jug pa tshad ma nyid do //
translated: The word ‚Äúdies‚Äù is valid only when all the bark is removed.

original: rnam shes la sogs 'gags pa ni //
analyzed: rnam shes la sogs 'gags pa ni //
translated: The cessation of consciousness, etc.

original: 'chi bar sangs rgyas pas rtogs phyir //
analyzed: 'chi bar sangs rgyas pas rtogs phyir //
translated: is understood as death by the Buddhists.

original: gang la shing la rnam shes ni //
analyzed: gang la shing la rnam shes ni //
translated: Where consciousness is not established in a tree,

original: ma grub de yang 'chi de bzhin //
analyzed: ma grub de yang 'chi de bzhin //
translated: there also it dies in the same way.

original: sangs rgyas pa gang shing dag la rnam par shes pa yod par the tshom za ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa gang shing dag la rnam par shes pa yod par the tshom za ba ste /
translated: The Buddhists doubt whether consciousness exists in trees.

original: de sngon du song ba 'gags pa'i rang bzhin 'chi ba la the tshom mi za'o zhes yid ches pa ci yod /
analyzed: de sngon du song ba 'gags pa'i rang bzhin 'chi ba la the tshom mi za'o zhes yid ches pa ci yod /
translated: What confidence do they have that death, whose nature is the cessation of that consciousness, is not doubted?

original: rnam par shes pa 'gags pa ni rnam par shes pa med pa las yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gags pa ni rnam par shes pa med pa las yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The cessation of consciousness does not exist from the nonexistence of consciousness.

original: tshe yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: tshe yang de bzhin te /
translated: Life is the same way.

original: tshe ni srog yin drod dang ni //
analyzed: tshe ni srog yin drod dang ni //
translated: Life is the life faculty, heat,

original: rnam shes rten gang yin pa'o //üîΩzhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam shes rten gang yin pa'o // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the consciousness that is their support.

original: 'chi ba khas len na ji ltar sems pa can du khas mi len /
analyzed: 'chi ba khas len na ji ltar sems pa can du khas mi len /
translated: If you accept death, how can you not accept that there is consciousness in mindless states?

original: des na 'di shing dag la bskams ba 'chi bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di shing dag la bskams ba 'chi bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when trees dry up, we say that they die.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa'i sgrub par byed pa ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa'i sgrub par byed pa ma nges pa yin te /
translated: Also, the proof of consciousness is inconclusive,

original: 'dam la sogs pa la yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dam la sogs pa la yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is also seen in mud and so on.

original: 'chi ba'i sgra 'jug pa'i phyir de la yang grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sgra 'jug pa'i phyir de la yang grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is established because the term death is used,

original: 'di la brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang phyir //
analyzed: 'di la brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang phyir //
translated: then we have already explained that this is not tenable, because it is dependent on what is desired.

original: zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained this.

original: 'on te don mthong bas der brjod par 'dod pa yin pa des na skyon 'di med do zhe na /üîΩ'chi ba grub na de yi sgra //
analyzed: 'on te don mthong bas der brjod par 'dod pa yin pa des na skyon 'di med do zhe na / 'chi ba grub na de yi sgra //
translated: If you say that the term death is used because the object of death is seen, then there is no error.üîΩIf death is established,

original: 'brel ba yin par grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'brel ba yin par grub par 'gyur //
translated: then the connection with the term death is established.

original: sgra ni 'brel ba yin pas na //
analyzed: sgra ni 'brel ba yin pas na //
translated: Because the term is connected with death,

original: de las 'chi ba grub pa nyid //
analyzed: de las 'chi ba grub pa nyid //
translated: death is established from that.

original: de lta bu'i 'chi ba mthong ba las byung ba yin na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'chi ba mthong ba las byung ba yin na /
translated: If it is the case that the cognition of death arises from seeing such a death,

original: sgra las rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid 'chi bar 'grub la de lta bu'i 'chi ba mthong ba las byung ba yang 'chi ba grub na yin pa'i phyir phan tshun rten pa'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: sgra las rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid 'chi bar 'grub la de lta bu'i 'chi ba mthong ba las byung ba yang 'chi ba grub na yin pa'i phyir phan tshun rten pa'i skyon yin no //
translated: then the death that is characterized by the cessation of consciousness, etc., is established from sound. And if such a death arises from seeing death, then there is the error of mutual dependence.

original: 'on te sgra don gyi 'brel pa rtag pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on te sgra don gyi 'brel pa rtag pa nyid yin na /
translated: But if the relation between the word and its meaning is permanent,

original: de lta na dag la sogs pa yang rva can nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na dag la sogs pa yang rva can nyid do //
translated: then a cow, etc., would be a horn.

original: 'on te ngag la sogs pa la yod pa'i go'i sgra'i gzhan nyid yin pas de ni rva can la 'brel par mi 'gyur ro zhe na ;
analyzed: 'on te ngag la sogs pa la yod pa'i go'i sgra'i gzhan nyid yin pas de ni rva can la 'brel par mi 'gyur ro zhe na ;
translated: But if the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù that exists in speech, etc., is different from the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù that exists in a horn, then it will not be related to a horn.

original: 'o na 'chi ba'i sgra yang gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la khyed la tshad ma ci yod /
analyzed: 'o na 'chi ba'i sgra yang gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la khyed la tshad ma ci yod /
translated: Well then, what is your valid cognition that the word ‚Äúdeath‚Äù is not different?

original: des na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni sgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa ni sgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the proof of impermanence, etc., is not a proof.

original: de bzhin du yod pa nyid dang dbyibs la sogs pa yang yin pas bsgrub bya mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa nyid dang dbyibs la sogs pa yang yin pas bsgrub bya mi 'grub bo //
translated: Likewise, since it is both existence and shape, etc., the probandum is not established.

original: gal te @41a * //
analyzed: gal te @41a * //
translated: If you do not have this,üîΩ

original: khyad par yongs su brtags pas dbyibs la sogs pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: khyad par yongs su brtags pas dbyibs la sogs pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin na /
translated: due to the thorough investigation of the qualifier, shape, etc. are not established as impermanent,

original: 'o na byas pa nyid la sogs pa gzhan yang sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'o na byas pa nyid la sogs pa gzhan yang sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: then also other things, such as being produced, are not established.

original: rgol ba gzhan la ltos pas sam //
analyzed: rgol ba gzhan la ltos pas sam //
translated: Either due to the other disputant or

original: rnam par brtags pas ni thams cad ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pas ni thams cad ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: due to thorough investigation, all are not established.üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / nam mkha'i yon tan sgra yi chos //
analyzed: 'di ltar / nam mkha'i yon tan sgra yi chos //
translated: The quality of space, the property of sound,

original: gzhan la rab tu sgrub ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan la rab tu sgrub ma yin //
translated: Is not established in the other.

original: bsgrub bya dpe yi chos dag ni //
analyzed: bsgrub bya dpe yi chos dag ni //
translated: The property of the example, the probandum,

original: phan tshun du ni ma grub nyid //
analyzed: phan tshun du ni ma grub nyid //
translated: Are mutually unestablished.

original: ce na de ni ma yin te //
analyzed: ce na de ni ma yin te //
translated: If one says that is not so,

original: lung gi nam mkha'i chos nyid ni //
analyzed: lung gi nam mkha'i chos nyid ni //
translated: The property of space in scripture

original: 'ga' la yang ni gnod pa med //
analyzed: 'ga' la yang ni gnod pa med //
translated: Is not invalidated for anyone.

original: khyad par rtogs par byed na ni /
analyzed: khyad par rtogs par byed na ni /
translated: If one causes the realization of a distinction,

original: gtan tshigs nyid ni nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyid ni nyams par 'gyur //
translated: The reason itself is invalidated.

original: de'i phyir / dngos po'i ngo bor ma grub la //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dngos po'i ngo bor ma grub la //
translated: Therefore, it is not established as the entity of the thing.

original: tshul 'di grub na ma grub kyang //
analyzed: tshul 'di grub na ma grub kyang //
translated: If this method is established, even though it is not established,

original: khyad par gnod byed ma yin te //
analyzed: khyad par gnod byed ma yin te //
translated: the distinction is not a fault.

original: sgra ni nam mkha' la brten bzhin //
analyzed: sgra ni nam mkha' la brten bzhin //
translated: Sound is like that which is based on space.

original: lung las grags pa'i nam mkha'i yon tan nyid /
analyzed: lung las grags pa'i nam mkha'i yon tan nyid /
translated: The quality of space that is known from scripture

original: sgra las ma grub kyang /
analyzed: sgra las ma grub kyang /
translated: is not established from sound.

original: sgra'i rang gi ngo bo ni chos can du 'grub pa nyid pas chos can ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i rang gi ngo bo ni chos can du 'grub pa nyid pas chos can ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: However, the intrinsic nature of sound is established as the subject, and therefore it is not the case that the subject is not established.

original: de bzhin du khyad par yongs su rtogs pa la yang gtan tshigs chos can dang 'brel pa ma grub pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyad par yongs su rtogs pa la yang gtan tshigs chos can dang 'brel pa ma grub pa'am /
translated: In the same way, in the understanding of the distinction, the reason is not established as related to the subject,

original: thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis ma nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyis ma nges pa ma yin no //
translated: and it is not uncertain due to being uncommon.

original: chos can nyid ni tshad mas grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can nyid ni tshad mas grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the subject itself is established by valid cognition.

original: khyad par ma grub na ma grub par 'gyur ba ma yin la khyad par yongs su rtogs pa yang 'gar yang nye bar mkho ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: khyad par ma grub na ma grub par 'gyur ba ma yin la khyad par yongs su rtogs pa yang 'gar yang nye bar mkho ba ma yin pas /
translated: If the distinction is not established, it is not the case that it is not established. And the understanding of the distinction is never necessary.

original: de la gdon mi za bar khyad par yongs su gzung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gdon mi za bar khyad par yongs su gzung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not necessarily the case that the distinction is apprehended.

original: 'di ltar / mi rtag pa dang 'bras nyid kyi //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mi rtag pa dang 'bras nyid kyi //
translated: The general characteristics of impermanence and effect

original: spyi ni nye bar mkho ba yin //üîΩkhyad par rab tu grub par ni //
analyzed: spyi ni nye bar mkho ba yin // khyad par rab tu grub par ni //
translated: are needed.üîΩNo one at all

original: 'gas kyang 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gas kyang 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: accepts the establishment of a particular.

original: rgyu yi de ma thag byung dang // de yi mod la 'jig nyid ni //üîΩbum pa dang ni sgra dag la //
analyzed: rgyu yi de ma thag byung dang // de yi mod la 'jig nyid ni // bum pa dang ni sgra dag la //
translated: The antecedent arising of a cause and its immediate destructionüîΩare not related to a particular

original: khyad par du ni rjes 'brel min //
analyzed: khyad par du ni rjes 'brel min //
translated: in a pot and a sound.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin gyis /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin gyis /
translated: The absence of the nature of the former and the latter

original: dben pa nyid ni 'gar yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no //üîΩphyogs de ni de khyad par du byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dben pa nyid ni 'gar yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no // phyogs de ni de khyad par du byed pa ma yin te /
translated: is not a particular anywhere.

original: de ni gcig tu 'dzin pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gcig tu 'dzin pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That part is not a particular because it is the object of the apprehension of one.

original: des na 'di la rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: des na 'di la rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no conceptual thought here.

original: dbyibs la sogs pa la ni de dang 'brel ba ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: dbyibs la sogs pa la ni de dang 'brel ba ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: But in shape, etc., the connection with that is not established.

original: lhag ma ni sngar bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni sngar bshad pa nyid do //
translated: The rest has been explained previously.

original: dbyibs kyi sgra tsam ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: dbyibs kyi sgra tsam ni sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: The mere word ‚Äúshape‚Äù is not a proof.

original: @41b 'di ltar /
analyzed: @41b 'di ltar /
translated: Thus:üîΩEven if the word is not established,

original: sgra ma grub kyang dngos po ni //
analyzed: sgra ma grub kyang dngos po ni //
translated: the thing

original: grub na 'grub par 'gyur te dper /
analyzed: grub na 'grub par 'gyur te dper /
translated: For example,

original: 'ug pa pa la sangs rgyas pas //üîΩlus sogs sgrub byed bshad pa bzhin //
analyzed: 'ug pa pa la sangs rgyas pas // lus sogs sgrub byed bshad pa bzhin //
translated: Buddha said to the Vaisheshikas:üîΩ‚ÄúThe atoms are impermanent because they possess a body.‚Äù

original: rdul phran dag ni mi rtag pa yin te lus can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bye brag pa la sangs rgyas pas sgrub par byed pa brjod do //
analyzed: rdul phran dag ni mi rtag pa yin te lus can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bye brag pa la sangs rgyas pas sgrub par byed pa brjod do //
translated: Buddha said to the Vaisheshikas that the atoms are established as impermanent because they possess a body.

original: de la sgra ni phan tshun mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sgra ni phan tshun mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la grub pa ma yin te /
translated: In that regard, the word is not established in the object of mutual desire,

original: rdzas thams cad du song ba ma yin pa'i tshad ni de'i lus can gyi sgras brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / bde bar gshegs pa pa rnams la ni rig pa dang ldan pa lus can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas thams cad du song ba ma yin pa'i tshad ni de'i lus can gyi sgras brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / bde bar gshegs pa pa rnams la ni rig pa dang ldan pa lus can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the measure that does not pervade all substances is to be expressed by the word possessing its body, and because the Sugata‚Äôs followers possess a body that is endowed with awareness.

original: gal te sgra de nyid phan tshun du mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la ma grub pa de lta na yang des mngon par 'dod pa'i don ni gnyi ga la grub pa'i phyir sgra ma grub kyang sangs rgyas pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po gnyi ga la grub
analyzed: gal te sgra de nyid phan tshun du mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la ma grub pa de lta na yang des mngon par 'dod pa'i don ni gnyi ga la grub pa'i phyir sgra ma grub kyang sangs rgyas pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po gnyi ga la grub
translated: Even if that sound is not established for the other party in the object that is desired, still, since the object that is desired is established for both parties, then even though the sound is not established, the object that is desired by the Buddhist is established for both parties.

original: pas mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i don 'grub po //üîΩgal te ci ltar dngos po mi 'khrul pa'am /
analyzed: pas mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i don 'grub po // gal te ci ltar dngos po mi 'khrul pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the object that is to be established that is desired is established.

original: grub ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: grub ba nyid yin na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow is it that the thing is nonerroneous or established?üîΩAnd how is it that the object to be established is established?‚Äù

original: bsgrub bya 'grub pa de bzhin du sgra la yang de lta bu nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: bsgrub bya 'grub pa de bzhin du sgra la yang de lta bu nyid ma yin nam /
translated: ‚ÄúAre these two not the same in the case of sound?‚Äù

original: 'di gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'di gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the difference between these two?‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: [The answer is:] it is not so.

original: de nyid 'khrul la sogs yin na //
analyzed: de nyid 'khrul la sogs yin na //
translated: Because that is erroneous and so on.

original: sgra ni 'khrul pa med na yang //
analyzed: sgra ni 'khrul pa med na yang //
translated: Even if the sound is nonerroneous,

original: sgrub byed skyon ldan shes bya ste //
analyzed: sgrub byed skyon ldan shes bya ste //
translated: the proof is known to be faulty,

original: dngos las dngos ni 'grub phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos las dngos ni 'grub phyir ro //
translated: because the thing is established from the thing.

original: ci ltar sgra ma grub kyang dngos po'i dbang gis bsgrub bya 'grub pa de bzhin du dngos po ma grub kyang sgra'i dbang gis bsgrub bya 'grub pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ci ltar sgra ma grub kyang dngos po'i dbang gis bsgrub bya 'grub pa de bzhin du dngos po ma grub kyang sgra'i dbang gis bsgrub bya 'grub pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Just as, although sound is not established, the probandum is established by the power of the thing, in the same way, although the thing is not established, the probandum is not established by the power of the sound.

original: 'on kyang sgra 'khrul pa med kyang dngos po'i de nyid 'khrul pa dang ma grub pa dang 'gal ba yin na sgrub par byed pa skyon dang ldan pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgra 'khrul pa med kyang dngos po'i de nyid 'khrul pa dang ma grub pa dang 'gal ba yin na sgrub par byed pa skyon dang ldan pa shes par bya'o //
translated: However, if the thing is mistaken, not established, or contradictory, even though the sound is non-mistaken, the proof should be understood to be faulty.

original: sgra 'khrul pa med na yang ngo //
analyzed: sgra 'khrul pa med na yang ngo //
translated: Even though the sound is non-mistaken.

original: re zhig dngos po 'khrul pa la sogs par gyur na sgra ma 'khrul ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: re zhig dngos po 'khrul pa la sogs par gyur na sgra ma 'khrul ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: If the thing is mistaken, etc., then the sound is not non-mistaken.

original: khas blangs nas kyang bshad pa ni sgra 'khrul pa med du chug mod /
analyzed: khas blangs nas kyang bshad pa ni sgra 'khrul pa med du chug mod /
translated: Having accepted that, he explains: Let the sound be non-mistaken.

original: de lta na yang sgrub byed skyon dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang sgrub byed skyon dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Even so, the proof is faulty.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po las dngos po 'grub kyi sgra las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po las dngos po 'grub kyi sgra las ni ma yin no //
translated: A thing is established from a thing, but not from a sound.

original: gal te sgra mi 'khrul ba bsgrub bya la ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sgra mi 'khrul ba bsgrub bya la ma yin nam /
translated: If the non-mistaken sound is not the probandum,

original: de lta yin na sgra las bsgrub bya 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na sgra las bsgrub bya 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the probandum would be established from the sound.

original: 'on te de las bsgrub bya mi 'grub na /
analyzed: 'on te de las bsgrub bya mi 'grub na /
translated: But if the probandum is not established from that,

original: ci lta sgra mi 'khrul pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta sgra mi 'khrul pa yin zhe na /
translated: then how is the sound non-erroneous?

original: 'dis ni 'di skad du ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad du ston pa yin te /
translated: This teaches the following:

original: sgra @42a * //
analyzed: sgra @42a * //
translated: The sound

original: ni dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i sgo nas bsgrub bya 'grub pa'am /üîΩnye bar sbyor ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ni dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i sgo nas bsgrub bya 'grub pa'am / nye bar sbyor ba yin gyi /
translated: establishes the probandum by way of establishing the thing,

original: dngos su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos su ni ma yin no //
translated: but not directly.

original: des na sgra mi 'khrul bar 'dod kyang don spangs nas ni bsgrub bya bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sgra mi 'khrul bar 'dod kyang don spangs nas ni bsgrub bya bsgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though the sound is accepted as non-erroneous, it is not able to establish the probandum without the object.

original: des na don la brten pa'i dpyad pa nyid nye bar mkho ba yin no //
analyzed: des na don la brten pa'i dpyad pa nyid nye bar mkho ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the analysis that depends on the object is itself necessary.

original: dngos po 'khrul ba dang cig shos nges par brtag pa ni phyis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'khrul ba dang cig shos nges par brtag pa ni phyis bshad par bya'o //
translated: The analysis of whether the thing is mistaken or not will be explained later.

original: de'i phyir gang las dbang phyug 'grub par 'gyur ba don gyi rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang las dbang phyug 'grub par 'gyur ba don gyi rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason of the nature of the object from which ƒ™≈õvara is established does not exist.

original: des na mi rtag na yang tshad med nyid //
analyzed: des na mi rtag na yang tshad med nyid //
translated: Therefore, even if impermanent, it is valid cognition.

original: ces bya bar 'grub bo //
analyzed: ces bya bar 'grub bo //
translated: Thus, it is established.

original: de bzhin du rtag pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtag pa yang ngo //
translated: So too, it is permanent.

original: rtag pa nyid kyis ni nam mkha' la sogs pa dang dbang phyug la rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis ni nam mkha' la sogs pa dang dbang phyug la rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyi rnam par dbye ba ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But because of permanence, the classification of space and so on and ƒ™≈õvara as causes and noncauses does not exist.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / ji ltar dngos de rgyu yin pa //üîΩde ltar nyid de gang gi tshe //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ji ltar dngos de rgyu yin pa // de ltar nyid de gang gi tshe //
translated: Just as that thing is a cause,üîΩso too, it is that which is not a cause.

original: rgyu min gang gis de ni rgyu //
analyzed: rgyu min gang gis de ni rgyu //
translated: By what is it a cause?

original: 'dod la rgyu ma yin mi 'dod//
analyzed: 'dod la rgyu ma yin mi 'dod//
translated: It is not asserted that it is not a cause.

original: ji ltar dbang phyug khyab pa dang rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos can yin pa de bzhin du nam mkha' la sogs pa'i yang yin pa des na mtshungs pa nyid yin yang dbang phyug ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang phyug khyab pa dang rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos can yin pa de bzhin du nam mkha' la sogs pa'i yang yin pa des na mtshungs pa nyid yin yang dbang phyug ni rgyu yin la /
translated: Just as ƒ™≈õvara is an entity that has the attributes of being pervasive, permanent, and so on, so too space and so on are also like that.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba ga las yin /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni rgyu ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba ga las yin /
translated: Therefore, since they are similar, how can you make the classification that ƒ™≈õvara is a cause and space and so on are not causes?üîΩBut if you say that the classification is made because ƒ™≈õvara is related to a consciousness that has the characteristic of desiring to create,

original: 'on te de na byed par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shes pa dang 'brel pas te de skad brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de na byed par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi shes pa dang 'brel pas te de skad brjod do zhe na /
translated: then we reply:

original: de yang ma yin te de yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te de yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because that is similar.

original: gzhan yang byed par 'dod pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang byed par 'dod pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: Moreover, it is not the case that something is a cause merely by the desire to act.

original: rgyu zhes bya bar rtogs ma yin //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya bar rtogs ma yin //
translated: It is not understood as a cause.

original: 'di ni bya rog ta la 'am //
analyzed: 'di ni bya rog ta la 'am //
translated: Is this a crow or a mynah bird?

original: de bzhin 'on te rgyu yin ci //üîΩgal te la sogs bsal nas ni //
analyzed: de bzhin 'on te rgyu yin ci // gal te la sogs bsal nas ni //
translated: Or is it a cause?üîΩIf it is an agent after the removal of such things as a cause,

original: byed pa yin na rgyu nyid yin //
analyzed: byed pa yin na rgyu nyid yin //
translated: then it is a cause.

original: de lta min na kun gyi rgyu //
analyzed: de lta min na kun gyi rgyu //
translated: Otherwise, why not assert that

original: thams cad yin par cis mi 'dod //
analyzed: thams cad yin par cis mi 'dod //
translated: everything is the cause of everything?

original: yang na ji ltar skyed pa las sngar de rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar skyed pa las sngar de rgyu ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Moreover, just as it is not a cause prior to the production of an effect,

original: bskyed pa'i gnas skabs na yang khyad par med pa'i phyir rgyu ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i gnas skabs na yang khyad par med pa'i phyir rgyu ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: in the same way, it is not a cause at the time of production, because there is no difference.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad las nges par grol ba ni bya ba med par 'dug pa nyid rigs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa thams cad las nges par grol ba ni bya ba med par 'dug pa nyid rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that one who is definitely liberated from desire and so on remains without activity.

original: 'jig rten gyi las bdag por gyur pas bya ba med par 'dug pa'i dbang med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi las bdag por gyur pas bya ba med par 'dug pa'i dbang med do zhe na /
translated: One who is not the master of worldly activity is powerless to remain without activity.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: pha rol las kyi gzhan dbang gyur pas 'di //
analyzed: pha rol las kyi gzhan dbang gyur pas 'di //
translated: This one is powerless, being controlled by another's activity.

original: ji ltar dbang phyug dbang phyug min pa nyid //
analyzed: ji ltar dbang phyug dbang phyug min pa nyid //
translated: How can you be a lord if you are not in control?

original: @42b 'on te de la brtse tshul khyad yin nam //
analyzed: @42b 'on te de la brtse tshul khyad yin nam //
translated: Or is it that you are compassionate in a special way?

original: dmyal sogs bsgrub phyir brtse ba med pa cis //üîΩ'jig rten las nyid de 'dra phyir de la //
analyzed: dmyal sogs bsgrub phyir brtse ba med pa cis // 'jig rten las nyid de 'dra phyir de la //
translated: Why are you not compassionate in order to put an end to hell and so on?

original: de byed nus med na 'di dam pa min //
analyzed: de byed nus med na 'di dam pa min //
translated: The world is just like that, so if you are not able to do anything about it, you are not a lord.

original: dam pa gal te legs byed nus med kyang //
analyzed: dam pa gal te legs byed nus med kyang //
translated: If you are a lord but are not able to do what is right,

original: legs min bya la de ni 'jug gam ci //üîΩdam pa min pa'i bya ba ni //
analyzed: legs min bya la de ni 'jug gam ci // dam pa min pa'i bya ba ni //
translated: then why do you engage in what is not right?üîΩIt is fitting that a lord should ignore

original: dam pas yal bar dor ba'i rigs //üîΩrma la rgya tsha 'debs pa ni //
analyzed: dam pas yal bar dor ba'i rigs // rma la rgya tsha 'debs pa ni //
translated: what is not the conduct of a lord.üîΩIt is not the conduct of a lord to put salt

original: dam pa dam pa'i spyod pa min //
analyzed: dam pa dam pa'i spyod pa min //
translated: on a wound.üîΩBut if this is the way things are,

original: 'o na te tshul 'di ni 'di lta bu nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'o na te tshul 'di ni 'di lta bu nyid yin la /
translated: then this is the way things are.

original: 'di ni de nyid gsal bar byed pa dang / de bya ba'i phyir spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de nyid gsal bar byed pa dang / de bya ba'i phyir spyod pa yin no //
translated: This is the way things are, and this is the way things are made clear, and this is the way things are done.

original: nga'i rang bzhin 'di lta bu yin te /
analyzed: nga'i rang bzhin 'di lta bu yin te /
translated: This is my nature.

original: ngas bzlog par ni mi nus so //
analyzed: ngas bzlog par ni mi nus so //
translated: I am not able to change it.

original: de la 'jig rten gyis ci rigs par spang bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyis ci rigs par spang bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: The world should reject it as it sees fit.

original: 'di bdag nyid la yang dbang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di bdag nyid la yang dbang med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not independent with respect to itself.

original: 'di gsal bar dbang phyug yin no //üîΩrang las 'tsham pa'i spyod pa la //
analyzed: 'di gsal bar dbang phyug yin no // rang las 'tsham pa'i spyod pa la //
translated: Therefore, it is clear that God is not independent.

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug cis ma yin //üîΩgal te de yang dbang phyug gis //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug cis ma yin // gal te de yang dbang phyug gis //
translated: Why is the Lord of the World not independent with respect to his own behavior?

original: bskul na phan tshun rten de nyid ;üîΩ/ de lta yin na gcig kyang ni //
analyzed: bskul na phan tshun rten de nyid ; / de lta yin na gcig kyang ni //
translated: If he is impelled by God, then there is mutual dependence.

original: srid par 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: srid par 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then even one of them is not tenable.

original: gal te dbang phyug la ni nus med na //
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug la ni nus med na //
translated: If God is not independent,

original: legs te 'gro ba las kyis bsgrub par 'gyur //
analyzed: legs te 'gro ba las kyis bsgrub par 'gyur //
translated: then it is good, for the world is established by karma.

original: gal te 'jig rten rang dbang skyes na 'dir //
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten rang dbang skyes na 'dir //
translated: If the world were born independently,

original: las smra ba nyid dge bar brjod pa yin //
analyzed: las smra ba nyid dge bar brjod pa yin //
translated: then the teaching of karma would be good.

original: ci ste yang gal te bdag cag lta bu de kho na nyid ma mthong bdag gis ma shes na yang de dbang phyug gis kyang brgya zhig la rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yang gal te bdag cag lta bu de kho na nyid ma mthong bdag gis ma shes na yang de dbang phyug gis kyang brgya zhig la rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if, although we do not see reality, we do not know it, then perhaps God is the cause.

original: de lta na ni 'o na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na /
translated: If that is so, then:

original: de 'grub bya phyir de nyid mthong ba nyid //
analyzed: de 'grub bya phyir de nyid mthong ba nyid //
translated: In order to establish him, one must see reality.

original: shes bya de yis shes par byed pa ni //
analyzed: shes bya de yis shes par byed pa ni //
translated: And that which is to be known is known by something else,

original: gzhan yin thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yin thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir //
translated: Because there would be an infinite regress.

original: dbang phyug du ma dag tu 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: dbang phyug du ma dag tu 'gyur ba yin //
translated: And ƒ™≈õvara would be multiple.

original: bdag cag la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: bdag cag la sogs pa ni /
translated: We and others

original: mtshon dang sman sogs dang 'brel bas //
analyzed: mtshon dang sman sogs dang 'brel bas //
translated: Are related to weapons, medicine, etc.

original: nag pa'i rma dang 'drubs yin na //
analyzed: nag pa'i rma dang 'drubs yin na //
translated: If they are like a black wound or a lump,

original: 'brel med sdong du ma ci yi phyir //
analyzed: 'brel med sdong du ma ci yi phyir //
translated: Why is a stump not related?

original: rgyu nyid du ni rtogs mi byed /
analyzed: rgyu nyid du ni rtogs mi byed /
translated: One should not understand it as a cause.

original: 'on te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir de ni sdod dum gyi byed pa med pas rgyu nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir de ni sdod dum gyi byed pa med pas rgyu nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is not a cause because it does not have the activity of a stump,

original: sdod dum gyi byed pa yang brgya zhig la yod pa yin te /
analyzed: sdod dum gyi byed pa yang brgya zhig la yod pa yin te /
translated: The activity of a stump exists in some cases.

original: de ni de kho na nyid ma mthong ba bdag cag lta bu ma dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de kho na nyid ma mthong ba bdag cag lta bu ma dmigs pa yin no //
translated: We who have not seen reality do not perceive it.

original: 'o na mi dmigs pa nyid kyis sdong dum gyi byed pa med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mi dmigs pa nyid kyis sdong dum gyi byed pa med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the absence of activity of a stump is due to its nonperception,

original: de lta na ni 'o na /üîΩrang bzhin khyad par med par ni //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na / rang bzhin khyad par med par ni //
translated: Then in that case,üîΩActivity is not tenable

original: byed pa yang ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: byed pa yang ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Without a difference in intrinsic nature.

original: rtag la ldog pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rtag la ldog pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is no cessation for the permanent.

original: nus pa @43a * //
analyzed: nus pa @43a * //
translated: and potency

original: yang ni rtogs par dka' //
analyzed: yang ni rtogs par dka' //
translated: is also difficult to understand.

original: rgyun gyis sam rnam pa gzhan du rtag pa'i dbang rgyug rtag pa la ni rang bzhin gyi khyad par med par 'bras bu'i byed pa yang nye bar mtshon par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rgyun gyis sam rnam pa gzhan du rtag pa'i dbang rgyug rtag pa la ni rang bzhin gyi khyad par med par 'bras bu'i byed pa yang nye bar mtshon par mi 'thad do //
translated: If the cause is permanent, it is not tenable that the activity of the effect is indicated by the continuum or by some other means, because there is no difference in the nature of the permanent.

original: dbang phyug la yang zhes yang gi sgra rim pa gzhan du bya'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug la yang zhes yang gi sgra rim pa gzhan du bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the verse should be applied to ‚Äúƒ™≈õvara.‚Äù

original: ci ltar rdza mkhan la sogs pas byas pa'i khyad par yod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ci ltar rdza mkhan la sogs pas byas pa'i khyad par yod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the difference is due to the potter, etc.,

original: gal te dbang phyug gis byas pa yang 'gyur na ni nus par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug gis byas pa yang 'gyur na ni nus par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: if the difference were due to ƒ™≈õvara, then potency would be understood.

original: rtag la ldog pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rtag la ldog pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the permanent has no cessation,

original: nus pa yang ni rtogs par dka' //
analyzed: nus pa yang ni rtogs par dka' //
translated: potency is also difficult to understand.

original: rtag tu gnas dang khyab pas na //
analyzed: rtag tu gnas dang khyab pas na //
translated: Because it is permanent and all-pervading,

original: ldog pa nyid ni med phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa nyid ni med phyir ro //
translated: cessation itself does not exist.

original: gang dag yod na gang 'gyur nyid //
analyzed: gang dag yod na gang 'gyur nyid //
translated: If that which exists is due to these,

original: de dag las gzhan de yi rgyur //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan de yi rgyur //
translated: then it is understood that they are its causes.

original: rtogs pa yin na thams cad la //
analyzed: rtogs pa yin na thams cad la //
translated: If that is so, then all causes

original: rgyu rnams thug pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu rnams thug pa med par 'gyur //
translated: would be without end.

original: mthong ba'i rdza mkhan la sogs pa rnams dang / las yod na mngon par 'dod pa 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rdza mkhan la sogs pa rnams dang / las yod na mngon par 'dod pa 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: and the potter, etc., are seen to exist, and when there is an effect, the cause is also seen to exist.

original: de lta na yang gzhan rtogs pa yin na ni /üîΩ'bras bu thams cad la rgyu rnams thug pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang gzhan rtogs pa yin na ni / 'bras bu thams cad la rgyu rnams thug pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: But if the effect is produced from something else,üîΩthen all effects would have no beginning,üîΩbecause there would be no end.üîΩIf the effect were to arise from something else, then the effect would not be dependent on the cause, and the cause would not be dependent on the effect.

original: mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the effect were to arise from something else, then the effect would not be dependent on the cause, and the cause would not be dependent on the effect.

original: rjes su 'jug pa med pa'i rtog pa 'jug pa'i rjes su 'gro na de las gzhan la gegs yod pa ma yin no //üîΩyang na gsar pa ma yin pa gna' ma de nyid gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa med pa'i rtog pa 'jug pa'i rjes su 'gro na de las gzhan la gegs yod pa ma yin no // yang na gsar pa ma yin pa gna' ma de nyid gnas pa yin no //

original: rgyu rnams kyi rgyu yang de nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / las gzhan ni don med pa nyid do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //üîΩ'o na ji ltar rtag tu gnas pa'i sa myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du dbang phyug kyang yin no //üîΩsa la sogs pa la ni thog ma dmigs pa med do zhe na //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyi rgyu yang de nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / las gzhan ni don med pa nyid do zhes bya bar 'gyur ro // 'o na ji ltar rtag tu gnas pa'i sa myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du dbang phyug kyang yin no // sa la sogs pa la ni thog ma dmigs pa med do zhe na //
translated: If the effect were to arise from something else, then the effect would not be dependent on the cause, and the cause would not be dependent on the effect.

original: 'di la lan du /üîΩmyu gu skyed la sa la sogs //
analyzed: 'di la lan du /üîΩmyu gu skyed la sa la sogs //
translated: If the effect were to arise from something else, then the effect would not be dependent on the cause, and the cause would not be dependent

original: rang bzhin yongs su 'gyur nas ni //üîΩrgyu yin de legs byas pa na //
analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su 'gyur nas ni // rgyu yin de legs byas pa na //
translated: But when the nature of the cause is completely transformed,

original: de yi khyad par mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: de yi khyad par mthong phyir ro //
translated: it is a cause, because its special effect is seen.

original: nas kyi myu gu la sogs pa ni gshol gyi byed pa la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang 'brel pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nas kyi myu gu la sogs pa ni gshol gyi byed pa la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba'i khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang 'brel pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The special effect of the plow, etc. is seen to be the special transformation of the sprout, etc.

original: sa la sogs pa rgyu nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rgyu nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, earth, etc. are understood to be causes.

original: yang rtsod pa dang lan btab pa ni /üîΩgal te ji ltar yul dbang po //
analyzed: yang rtsod pa dang lan btab pa ni / gal te ji ltar yul dbang po //
translated: Again, there is a dispute and reply:

original: tshogs pa khyad med blo rgyu yin //
analyzed: tshogs pa khyad med blo rgyu yin //
translated: If the collection of object and sense faculty is the cause of cognition,

original: de ltar 'di yin zhe na min //
analyzed: de ltar 'di yin zhe na min //
translated: without a difference, why is it not always a cause?

original: de la'ang khyad par yod phyir ro //
analyzed: de la'ang khyad par yod phyir ro //
translated: Because there is a difference in that.

original: rgyun gyi khyad par med par ni //
analyzed: rgyun gyi khyad par med par ni //
translated: Without a difference in the continuum,

original: so so so sor nus med rnams //
analyzed: so so so sor nus med rnams //
translated: the individual, powerless ones

original: tshogs kyang @43b nus pa med 'gyur ba //
analyzed: tshogs kyang @43b nus pa med 'gyur ba //
translated: would be powerless even in a collection.

original: de phyir khyad par grub ba yin //üîΩmig la sogs pa rnams la ni //
analyzed: de phyir khyad par grub ba yin // mig la sogs pa rnams la ni //
translated: Therefore, the difference is established.

original: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par nyid las rgyu nyid du nges par byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par nyid las rgyu nyid du nges par byed do //
translated: The eye, etc. are ascertained as causes from the difference in the nature of the effect.

original: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa ni gzugs so sor nges pa dang / gzugs kyi rnam pa can dang / rtogs pa'i rang bzhin can yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par shes pa ni gzugs so sor nges pa dang / gzugs kyi rnam pa can dang / rtogs pa'i rang bzhin can yin no //
translated: The effect, i.e., visual consciousness, is determined by form, has the aspect of form, and is of the nature of perception.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag phan tshun spangs pas nye bar sbyar ba las khyad par yod pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa 'bras bu rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag phan tshun spangs pas nye bar sbyar ba las khyad par yod pa'i phyir mig la sogs pa 'bras bu rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the eye, etc., are mutually exclusive, they are the cause of the effect, i.e., visual consciousness, because they are distinguished by their application.

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag ni so so so sor rnam par shes pa'i tshigs la nus pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag ni so so so sor rnam par shes pa'i tshigs la nus pa med pa yin no //
translated: For, each of them is not capable of producing visual consciousness.

original: mig las ni rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin /
analyzed: mig las ni rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin /
translated: The eye is not of the nature of perception.

original: gzungs las ni gzugs 'dzin par so sor nges pa ma yin /
analyzed: gzungs las ni gzugs 'dzin par so sor nges pa ma yin /
translated: The form is not determined to apprehend form.

original: yid la byed pa las ni gzhan ma yin te //
analyzed: yid la byed pa las ni gzhan ma yin te //
translated: The attention is not different.

original: re re las mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re re las mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, if one of them is absent, there is no seeing.

original: 'on te mig phye ba na gzugs gzhan dang gzhan nya bar gnas par 'gyur ba na gzugs gzhan dang gzhan mthong na de'i tshe mig la khyad par yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te mig phye ba na gzugs gzhan dang gzhan nya bar gnas par 'gyur ba na gzugs gzhan dang gzhan mthong na de'i tshe mig la khyad par yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If, when the eye is open, other and other forms are present, and other and other forms are seen, then the eye does not have a distinction.

original: de bzhin du gzugs gnas pa nyid la mig gi rnam par shes pa gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba yin no //üîΩde bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs gnas pa nyid la mig gi rnam par shes pa gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba yin no // de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way, the eye consciousnesses arise from the eye and from the form that is present.

original: dbang phyug kyang rtag tu mtshungs pa nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa ni srid pa gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i phyir rgyu'i dngos po ma yin ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang phyug kyang rtag tu mtshungs pa nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa ni srid pa gzhan dang gzhan skye ba'i phyir rgyu'i dngos po ma yin ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: In the same way, ƒ™≈õvara, who is always the same, is not the cause of the various things that are created, because he does not change.

original: 'di la nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams kyang rgyu'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod zin to //üîΩmig dang gzugs kyi khyad par las //
analyzed: 'di la nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams kyang rgyu'i dngos por thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod zin to // mig dang gzugs kyi khyad par las //
translated: We have already refuted this argument by saying that space and so on would also be causes.üîΩThe eye and the form

original: rnam par shes pa khyad par can //üîΩyod par 'gyur ba de yi phyir //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa khyad par can // yod par 'gyur ba de yi phyir //
translated: are the special causes of the eye consciousness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rgyu nyid yin //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rgyu nyid yin //
translated: Therefore, form and so on are the causes of the eye consciousness.

original: yongs su gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzugs kyi khyad par las /
analyzed: yongs su gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gzugs kyi khyad par las /
translated: The eye consciousness arises from the special form that is present, that is, from the special form that has the characteristics of being manifest or unmanifest, etc.

original: rnam par shes pa yid bde ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa skye la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yid bde ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa skye la /
translated: The eye consciousness is associated with pleasure, etc.

original: de bzhin du phyed btsums pa la sogs pa'i mig gi khyad par las mi gsal ba nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyed btsums pa la sogs pa'i mig gi khyad par las mi gsal ba nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, the difference in the eye, such as half-closed and so on, causes the difference in the unclear and so on.

original: de ni de dang 'brel pas rgyu de'i 'bras bur rtogs par byed kyi /
analyzed: de ni de dang 'brel pas rgyu de'i 'bras bur rtogs par byed kyi /
translated: That is understood to be the effect of that cause because of its connection with it.

original: de bzhin du dbang phyug rgyur rtogs pa'i rgyu ni med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang phyug rgyur rtogs pa'i rgyu ni med do //
translated: But there is no cause for understanding ƒ™≈õvara as the cause.

original: des na / rgyun gyi khyad par med na ni //
analyzed: des na / rgyun gyi khyad par med na ni //
translated: Therefore, if there is no difference in the continuum,

original: zhes bya ba rgyun gyi khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgyun gyi khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: there is no difference in the continuum.

original: so so so sor nus med rnams //
analyzed: so so so sor nus med rnams //
translated: The individual things that are not individually capable,

original: tshogs kyang @44a * //
analyzed: tshogs kyang @44a * //
translated: even when assembled,

original: nus pa med 'gyur ba //
analyzed: nus pa med 'gyur ba //
translated: are not capable.

original: yin te / rgyu las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin de nyid ci ltar rgyur 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di la lan ci yod /
analyzed: yin te / rgyu las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin de nyid ci ltar rgyur 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di la lan ci yod /
translated: What is the answer to this: ‚ÄúHow can that very nature which is the opposite of the cause be the cause‚Äù?

original: gzugs la sogs pa rgyu nyid du rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rgyu nyid du rtogs pa yin na /
translated: If form and so on are understood to be the cause,

original: rgyu brjod pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: rgyu brjod pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: the fault is not incurred because the cause is stated.

original: de'i phyir so sor gang nus med //
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor gang nus med //
translated: Therefore, individually, whatever is not capable,

original: tshogs na yon tan srid 'gyur ba //
analyzed: tshogs na yon tan srid 'gyur ba //
translated: when assembled, the quality is possible.

original: de dag rgyu yin dbang phyug sogs //
analyzed: de dag rgyu yin dbang phyug sogs //
translated: Those are the cause, not ƒ™≈õvara and so on.

original: ma yin khyad par med phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin khyad par med phyir ro //
translated: No, because there is no difference.

original: dbang phyug dgag pa'i rnam 'grel lo //
analyzed: dbang phyug dgag pa'i rnam 'grel lo //
translated: The commentary on the refutation of God.

original: gal te dbang phyug yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu shes par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu shes par byed pa'am /
translated: If God is the cause of the knowledge of omniscience, or the producer of it, then it is not the case that he is not the cause of other things.üîΩThus,üîΩSome say that valid cognition is the knowledge of hidden objects,üîΩBut there is no cause for its establishment.

original: skyed par byed pa med na 'o na ni de gzhan la yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa med na 'o na ni de gzhan la yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, there is no need for it.

original: 'di ltar / tshad ma lkog gyur don shes yin //üîΩde grub byed kyang med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / tshad ma lkog gyur don shes yin // de grub byed kyang med pa'i phyir //
translated: Some say that valid cognition is the knowledge of hidden objects,üîΩBut there is no cause for its establishment.

original: nan tan byed pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: nan tan byed pa yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore, there is no need for it.

original: zhes ni kha cig rab tu brjod //
analyzed: zhes ni kha cig rab tu brjod //
translated: Some say that valid cognition is the knowledge of hidden objects,üîΩBut there is no cause for its establishment.üîΩTherefore, there is no need for it.

original: re zhig thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ba gang yin de'i lkog tu gyur pa'i don shes pa la rgyu ci yod /
analyzed: re zhig thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ba gang yin de'i lkog tu gyur pa'i don shes pa la rgyu ci yod /
translated: First, what is the cause of the knowledge of hidden objects for one who is not omniscient but becomes omniscient?

original: gang rjes su bsgrubs pas thams cad rig par 'gyur ba de 'dra ba'i rgyu ni 'ga' yang rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: gang rjes su bsgrubs pas thams cad rig par 'gyur ba de 'dra ba'i rgyu ni 'ga' yang rtogs pa med do //
translated: There is no known cause that, when accomplished, would make one all-knowing.

original: sngags dang rgyud la sogs pa ni phal cher gzhung thams cad la yod pa yin no //
analyzed: sngags dang rgyud la sogs pa ni phal cher gzhung thams cad la yod pa yin no //
translated: Mantras, tantras, and so on are mostly found in all texts.

original: de nges pa'i rgyu yang yod pa ma yin no //üîΩphyogs gcig mi slu ba ni tshig thams cad kyang yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nges pa'i rgyu yang yod pa ma yin no // phyogs gcig mi slu ba ni tshig thams cad kyang yin pa nyid do //
translated: And there is no cause for ascertaining that.üîΩAnd it is not the case that all words are deceptive with respect to one part of their meaning.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don thams cad mngon du byed pa srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don thams cad mngon du byed pa srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not possible for all hidden objects to be perceived.

original: dbang po'i shes pa ni nye bar gnas pa'i yul can nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa ni nye bar gnas pa'i yul can nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen that the sense consciousnesses have only present objects.

original: don dang dbang po khyad med kyang //
analyzed: don dang dbang po khyad med kyang //
translated: Even though there is no difference between the object and the sense faculty,

original: gal te kun rig 'byung 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te kun rig 'byung 'gyur na //
translated: if the all-knowing consciousness were to arise,

original: dbang don khyad par med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dbang don khyad par med pa'i phyir //
translated: then, because there would be no difference between the object and the sense faculty,

original: thams cad thams cad shes par 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad thams cad shes par 'gyur //
translated: all would know all things.

original: mi gtsang la sogs ro myang dang // 'brel pa bzlog par dka' ba yin //
analyzed: mi gtsang la sogs ro myang dang // 'brel pa bzlog par dka' ba yin //
translated: It is difficult to stop the connection with the experience of the impure, etc.

original: dbang po phrad nas 'dzin pa na //
analyzed: dbang po phrad nas 'dzin pa na //
translated: If it is apprehended through contact with the sense faculty,

original: thams cad rig pa ci ltar brjod //
analyzed: thams cad rig pa ci ltar brjod //
translated: how can it be said that all is known?

original: de yi yid kyi rnam shes kyang //
analyzed: de yi yid kyi rnam shes kyang //
translated: And the mental consciousness

original: dbang po'i rjes su mi 'jug min //üîΩyid kyi shes pa rang dbang ni//
analyzed: dbang po'i rjes su mi 'jug min // yid kyi shes pa rang dbang ni//
translated: is not independent of the sense faculties.

original: 'gas kyang mthong ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'gas kyang mthong ba yod ma yin //
translated: No one has ever seen an independent mental consciousness.

original: goms pas gsal yin de yis ni //
analyzed: goms pas gsal yin de yis ni //
translated: It is clear that it is through habituation.

original: yul du thams cad 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: yul du thams cad 'gyur ma yin //
translated: And not all objects are inferred.

original: lung la brten pa yin na 'di //
analyzed: lung la brten pa yin na 'di //
translated: If it is based on scripture,

original: 'khrul pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur //üîΩdngos po thams cad rjes dpag gis //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur // dngos po thams cad rjes dpag gis //
translated: then it would follow that it is mistaken.üîΩThere is no realization that all things

original: grub par rtogs pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: grub par rtogs pa yod ma yin //
translated: are established by inference.

original: des na yul kun sgom @44b med pas //
analyzed: des na yul kun sgom @44b med pas //
translated: Therefore, since all objects are not contemplated,

original: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur //
translated: how could there be omniscience?

original: bstan bcos la sogs goms pa las //
analyzed: bstan bcos la sogs goms pa las //
translated: Through familiarity with treatises and so on,üîΩone realizes treatises and so on.

original: bstan bcos sogs nyid rtogs la rag / de yi thams cad rig pa go //
analyzed: bstan bcos sogs nyid rtogs la rag / de yi thams cad rig pa go //
translated: The omniscience of that

original: ga las 'byung bar 'gyur ba yi //
analyzed: ga las 'byung bar 'gyur ba yi //
translated: arises from somewhere.

original: de yi shes bya shes med par //
analyzed: de yi shes bya shes med par //
translated: Without knowing the objects of that,

original: kun shes zhes bya'i rnam shes ni //
analyzed: kun shes zhes bya'i rnam shes ni //
translated: the consciousness called ‚Äúomniscience‚ÄùüîΩwould not exist.

original: gang las de yi shes bya ba //
analyzed: gang las de yi shes bya ba //
translated: If one knows the objects of that,

original: shes na'ang de nyid kun rig 'gyur //
analyzed: shes na'ang de nyid kun rig 'gyur //
translated: then that would be omniscience.

original: gang zhig chags sogs dang bral zhing //
