analyzed: gang zhig chags sogs dang bral zhing //
translated: That which is free from attachment and so on

original: de bzhin rnam rtog dang bral des //
analyzed: de bzhin rnam rtog dang bral des //
translated: and likewise free from conceptuality

original: bstan par byas zhes bya ba de //
analyzed: bstan par byas zhes bya ba de //
translated: is said to be ‚Äútaught.‚Äù

original: de ni g-yar po'i rgyan dang 'dra //
analyzed: de ni g-yar po'i rgyan dang 'dra //
translated: That is like the ornament of a scarecrow.

original: byung gyur byung dang 'byung 'gyur dngos //
analyzed: byung gyur byung dang 'byung 'gyur dngos //
translated: The things that have arisen, are arising, and will arise

original: thog mtha' med par rim gyis ni //
analyzed: thog mtha' med par rim gyis ni //
translated: It is not possible to understand

original: so so re rer rtogs par ni //
analyzed: so so re rer rtogs par ni //
translated: each one of them in sequence

original: bskal pa'i bar du'ang nus ma yin //üîΩphyogs gcig yongs su shes pa ni //
analyzed: bskal pa'i bar du'ang nus ma yin // phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa ni //
translated: even in the course of a whole eon.üîΩ‚ÄúNo one knows the whole‚Äù

original: su la med ces bya ba yin //
analyzed: su la med ces bya ba yin //
translated: means that no one knows one part.

original: skyes bu mang du rtog pa la //
analyzed: skyes bu mang du rtog pa la //
translated: Among many people who think about something,

original: bden don can cig med ma yin //
analyzed: bden don can cig med ma yin //
translated: there is no one who knows the truth.

original: khyad par dang ldan mthong ba gang //
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan mthong ba gang //
translated: Whatever is seen with a particular perspective

original: de ni de tsam nyid gnas pas //
analyzed: de ni de tsam nyid gnas pas //
translated: remains just that,

original: khyad par cung zad shes 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: khyad par cung zad shes 'gyur gyi //
translated: so one knows only a small part

original: shin tu dbang 'das don rig min //üîΩphyogs gcig de nyid shes pa ni //
analyzed: shin tu dbang 'das don rig min // phyogs gcig de nyid shes pa ni //
translated: but not the meaning that is beyond the scope of the intellect.üîΩIt is not tenable that one who knows the reality of one part

original: thams cad mkhyen par 'thad min te //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen par 'thad min te //
translated: is omniscient.

original: 'di ni pha rol 'khrul pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol 'khrul pa'i rgyu //
translated: This is the cause of error for others,

original: bya rog ta la'i tshul du 'gyur //
analyzed: bya rog ta la'i tshul du 'gyur //
translated: like the case of the crow and the palm fruit.

original: cig car thams cad rnam shes na //
analyzed: cig car thams cad rnam shes na //
translated: If everything is known simultaneously,

original: ji ltar 'khor ba thog med nyid//
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor ba thog med nyid//
translated: how can cyclic existence be beginningless?

original: shes pa gang du yongs rdzogs pa //
analyzed: shes pa gang du yongs rdzogs pa //
translated: The place where consciousness is complete

original: de nyid 'dir ni thog mar brjod //
analyzed: de nyid 'dir ni thog mar brjod //
translated: is said to be the beginning here.

original: 'di la brjod pa thams cad rig pa zhes bya ba tshad ma gzhan ni 'dod pa ma yin gyi //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa thams cad rig pa zhes bya ba tshad ma gzhan ni 'dod pa ma yin gyi //
translated: In this regard, all statements are called ‚Äúknowledge,‚Äù and other means of valid cognition are not accepted.

original: 'on kyang slu bar byed pa ma yin pa mngon par 'dod pa bsgrub pa nus par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang slu bar byed pa ma yin pa mngon par 'dod pa bsgrub pa nus par gyur pa'o //
translated: However, it is able to establish what is desired without deceiving.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩmi shes ston par byed pa la ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / mi shes ston par byed pa la ;
translated: Why is that?üîΩThose who are doubtful about the possibility of error

original: /'khrul par dogs pa can rnams kyi //
analyzed: /'khrul par dogs pa can rnams kyi //
translated: in teaching what is not known

original: de bshad nan tan bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de bshad nan tan bya ba'i phyir //
translated: explain it with great effort.

original: shes ldan 'ga' zhig tshol bar byed //
analyzed: shes ldan 'ga' zhig tshol bar byed //
translated: Some knowledgeable people seek it.

original: gzhan rjes su sgrub par 'dod pas gzhan shes pa'i nye bar ston pa po tshol bar mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan rjes su sgrub par 'dod pas gzhan shes pa'i nye bar ston pa po tshol bar mi byed do //
translated: One who desires to establish others does not seek to teach others what is known.

original: de nges kyang mngon par 'dod pa la slu ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nges kyang mngon par 'dod pa la slu ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if one does, it is possible that what is desired may be deceived.

original: 'on te der yang de'i shes pa yod pa nyid do zhes nges pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te der yang de'i shes pa yod pa nyid do zhes nges pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If it is certain that knowledge exists there,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then it is not so,

original: thams cad du shes pa la shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du shes pa la shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because knowledge does not exist in all cases.

original: de'i phyir de nyid des shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid des shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is to be known by that.

original: gal te des shes so zhes shes na ni de'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te des shes so zhes shes na ni de'i phyir /
translated: If it is known that it knows, then

original: mi shes pa nye bar ston par byed pa la slu bar dogs pa @45a * //üîΩcan gyi mi shes bdag gis /
analyzed: mi shes pa nye bar ston par byed pa la slu bar dogs pa @45a * // can gyi mi shes bdag gis /
translated: it is not deceptive in teaching what is not known,üîΩbecause it is known by the cognition that has it as its object.

original: de'i yul can gyi shes pa shes pas na 'di tshad ma nyid do //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi shes pa shes pas na 'di tshad ma nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is valid cognition.

original: gzhan la yang de'i ye shes srid par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la yang de'i ye shes srid par bya ba yin no //
translated: And it is possible that others also have that knowledge.

original: skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo shes pa dang tshad mas yongs su dag pa'i thams cad kyi de kho na shes pa gang yin pa de nyid tshad ma yin pas 'di de tsam gyis nye bar bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo shes pa dang tshad mas yongs su dag pa'i thams cad kyi de kho na shes pa gang yin pa de nyid tshad ma yin pas 'di de tsam gyis nye bar bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: That which is the knowledge of the principal object of a person, and the knowledge of reality of all those whose knowledge is purified by valid cognition, that itself is valid cognition. Therefore, it is to be taught just to that extent.

original: lhag ma thams cad ni nye bar bstan par bya ba thams cad la mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhag ma thams cad ni nye bar bstan par bya ba thams cad la mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: And all the rest is the same for all that is to be taught.

original: de yang gang la sred ce na //
analyzed: de yang gang la sred ce na //
translated: And what is it that is desired?

original: gang gis nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: That by which it is taught.

original: gang zhig tshad mas mthong ba'i skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo mi skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo mi smra ba'i gzhan nyid smra ba smra ba'i gzhan nyid smra ba gang yin pa de dag ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig tshad mas mthong ba'i skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo mi skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo mi smra ba'i gzhan nyid smra ba smra ba'i gzhan nyid smra ba gang yin pa de dag ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: The person who does not speak about the principal object of a person who sees by means of a valid cognition, but speaks about something else, is not a valid person.

original: de la yang mi shes pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang mi shes pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even in that case, it is possible that he does not know.

original: ji ltar nye bar ston ce rna /
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar ston ce rna /
translated: How does he teach?

original: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thog ma med pa las te //
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thog ma med pa las te //
translated: From beginningless time, through a succession of teachers.

original: med pa pa'i nye bar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: med pa pa'i nye bar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the teaching of the nihilists.

original: 'o na thams cad yongs su mi shes na//
analyzed: 'o na thams cad yongs su mi shes na//
translated: If he does not know everything,

original: thams cad la dogs pa skye ba'i phyir //
analyzed: thams cad la dogs pa skye ba'i phyir //
translated: then doubt arises about everything.

original: gzhan yang yongs su mi shes so zhes dogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang yongs su mi shes so zhes dogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: And he should be suspected of not knowing anything at all.

original: des na thams cad shes pa med na ji ltar 'di la yang yongs su shes pa yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na thams cad shes pa med na ji ltar 'di la yang yongs su shes pa yod par 'gyur /
translated: So if he does not know everything, how can he have knowledge of this?

original: nye bar bstan pa ni nye bar bstan pa brgyud pa las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa ni nye bar bstan pa brgyud pa las yin no zhe na /
translated: The teaching is from a succession of teachers.

original: de ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: de ni ma yin te ;
translated: That is not so.

original: tshad ma med pa'i dngos po la //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i dngos po la //
translated: Because there is no valid cognition of a thing

original: nye bar bstan pa brgyud par gsal //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa brgyud par gsal //
translated: The eightfold refutation is clear in the transmission.

original: nye bar bstan pa brgyad pa de //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa brgyad pa de //
translated: The eightfold refutation

original: tshad ma can la yod ma yin //
analyzed: tshad ma can la yod ma yin //
translated: Does not exist for the valid.

original: tshad ma med pa rtag pa nyid la sogs pa la nye bar bstan pa bstan pa brgyad pa las rten gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa rtag pa nyid la sogs pa la nye bar bstan pa bstan pa brgyad pa las rten gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The eightfold refutation of the teaching of the non-Buddhist schools does not exist for the valid, such as permanence and so on.

original: tshad mas dngos po yongs su bcad pa yin na /
analyzed: tshad mas dngos po yongs su bcad pa yin na /
translated: If an entity is ascertained by valid knowledge,

original: ci ltar de la ma shes pa yin par dogs //
analyzed: ci ltar de la ma shes pa yin par dogs //
translated: how could there be doubt about it?

original: dogs su chud pa de lta na yang de la gdon me za bar 'jug par 'gyur ba yin te //
analyzed: dogs su chud pa de lta na yang de la gdon me za bar 'jug par 'gyur ba yin te //
translated: Even though one understands that there is doubt, one would still engage in it,

original: tshad mas nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is ascertained by valid knowledge.

original: 'on te tshad mas mthong ba yin yang /
analyzed: 'on te tshad mas mthong ba yin yang /
translated: But even if it is seen by valid knowledge,

original: mngon du byed par ma nges so zhe na /
analyzed: mngon du byed par ma nges so zhe na /
translated: it is not ascertained as manifest.

original: de ni 'dir 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de ni 'dir 'gyur te ;
translated: That is the case here.

original: gang gis tshad mthong ston pa yang //
analyzed: gang gis tshad mthong ston pa yang //
translated: Even though the valid is seen,

original: dogs 'gyur zhi blta 'di 'dra ba //
analyzed: dogs 'gyur zhi blta 'di 'dra ba //
translated: the teaching is doubted.

original: skyes na mu stegs dag la ni //
analyzed: skyes na mu stegs dag la ni //
translated: If it arises,

original: brjod pa nyid kyang ci zhig yod //
analyzed: brjod pa nyid kyang ci zhig yod //
translated: what is there to say to the tƒ´rthikas?

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa ni tshad mas mthong ba gsung ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa ni tshad mas mthong ba gsung ba yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat is one who teaches what is seen by means of valid cognition.

original: de la yang dogs pa gang yin pa de gang dag la yongs @45b su shes pa rjes su 'jug pa med pa'i mu stegs pa dag la rtsir yang ci yod /
analyzed: de la yang dogs pa gang yin pa de gang dag la yongs @45b su shes pa rjes su 'jug pa med pa'i mu stegs pa dag la rtsir yang ci yod /
translated: What doubt is there about that? What use is it for those tƒ´rthikas who do not have the understanding of the path of valid cognition?

original: de'i phyir tshad mas mthong pa'i don gsung ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad mas mthong pa'i don gsung ba'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore, because he teaches the meaning that is seen by means of valid cognition,

original: bcom ldan 'das ni tshad ma nyid do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni tshad ma nyid do //
translated: the Bhagavat is valid cognition itself.

original: mtho ris dang ni byang grol lam //
analyzed: mtho ris dang ni byang grol lam //
translated: The path to heaven and liberation

original: rig byed mi yi tshad ma yin //
analyzed: rig byed mi yi tshad ma yin //
translated: is the valid cognition of humans.

original: yongs su shes med gzhan la yang//
analyzed: yongs su shes med gzhan la yang//
translated: But for those who do not have that understanding,

original: de yi de ni srid pa yin //
analyzed: de yi de ni srid pa yin //
translated: it is possible that they will not have that.

original: de phyir de yi ye shes ni //
analyzed: de phyir de yi ye shes ni //
translated: Therefore, his wisdom

original: nan tan bya rtogs rnam dpyad bya'i //
analyzed: nan tan bya rtogs rnam dpyad bya'i //
translated: should be understood through practice and analysis.

original: de yi srin bu'i grangs mkhyen pa //
analyzed: de yi srin bu'i grangs mkhyen pa //
translated: But knowing the number of worms

original: ded la 'gar yang nyer mkho med //
analyzed: ded la 'gar yang nyer mkho med //
translated: is never useful for anyone.

original: 'di ltar / 'di ni chos mkhyen 'gog pa nyid //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'di ni chos mkhyen 'gog pa nyid //
translated: In this way,

original: 'ba' zhig dgag par bya ba yin //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig dgag par bya ba yin //
translated: only this is to be refuted.üîΩBut all others are refuted

original: pha rol bos bkag gzhan kun ni //üîΩgang gis zlog par byed pa yin //
analyzed: pha rol bos bkag gzhan kun ni //üîΩgang gis zlog par byed pa yin //
translated: by the opponent.

original: gal te phyogs gcig mkhyen pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gal te phyogs gcig mkhyen pa'i phyir //
translated: If you say that the TathƒÅgata is omniscient because he knows one part,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rig pa yin no zhes brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rig pa yin no zhes brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: then he would be a knower of all because he knows one part.

original: me ni kha ba'i gnyen po yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi slu ba las gzhan yang 'gyur ba'i phyir thug pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me ni kha ba'i gnyen po yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi slu ba las gzhan yang 'gyur ba'i phyir thug pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would be endless, because there would be other things to be known, like fire being the remedy for cold.

original: de ltar gyur pa yang ma yin te //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa yang ma yin te //
translated: But that is not so,

original: phan tshun 'gal bas rjes su sgrub par mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal bas rjes su sgrub par mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is impossible to establish mutually contradictory things.

original: de yang mi bden te //üîΩblang dang dor bya'i de nyid ni //üîΩthabs dang bcas par rig mdzad pa //
analyzed: de yang mi bden te // blang dang dor bya'i de nyid ni // thabs dang bcas par rig mdzad pa //
translated: That is not so,üîΩbecause he knows the reality of what is to be accepted and rejected

original: gang tshe tshad ma nyid 'dod kyi //
analyzed: gang tshe tshad ma nyid 'dod kyi //
translated: together with the means.

original: thams cad rig mdzad ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad rig mdzad ma yin no //
translated: He is not omniscient because he knows all,üîΩbut because he is accepted as an authority.

original: gang gi phyir skyes bu'i don ni mtshan nyid phyogs gcig rig par byed pa yin zhes te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu'i don ni mtshan nyid phyogs gcig rig par byed pa yin zhes te /
translated: Because the purpose of a person is to make known one part of reality,

original: de tsam gyis ni de thams cad thams cad rig par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni de thams cad thams cad rig par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: but he does not become omniscient by that alone.

original: skyes bu'i don gyi cha rig pa ni 'ga' la mang mi srid pa ma yin no //üîΩde la blang bya dang dor bya'i de nyid sdug bsngal dang / 'gog ba'i bden pa'o /
analyzed: skyes bu'i don gyi cha rig pa ni 'ga' la mang mi srid pa ma yin no // de la blang bya dang dor bya'i de nyid sdug bsngal dang / 'gog ba'i bden pa'o /
translated: The knowledge of the truth of man's purpose is not impossible for anyone.üîΩThe truth of suffering and the truth of cessation are the reality of what is to be accepted and rejected.

original: thams kyi de nyid ni sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa'i bden pa de dag nyid kyi rgyu gun 'byung dang lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: thams kyi de nyid ni sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa'i bden pa de dag nyid kyi rgyu gun 'byung dang lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of origination and the truth of the path are the cause of those two truths of suffering and cessation.

original: des na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid de kho na nyid rig par mdzad pa dang // tshad mas grub pa rig par mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid de kho na nyid rig par mdzad pa dang // tshad mas grub pa rig par mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, the knowledge of the reality of the four noble truths and the knowledge of what is established by valid cognition is itself valid cognition. This is the meaning.

original: mtho ris kyi la /
analyzed: mtho ris kyi la /
translated: In the case of the higher realms,

original: yang tshad mas gcod par srid pa yin no //
analyzed: yang tshad mas gcod par srid pa yin no //
translated: it is also possible to determine by valid cognition.

original: bud med dang dmangs rigs ngo mtshar skyed pa gzhan yang bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung la med pa ma yin no /
analyzed: bud med dang dmangs rigs ngo mtshar skyed pa gzhan yang bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung la med pa ma yin no /
translated: Other things that are amazing to women and the lower castes are not absent in the speech of the Sugata.

original: de'i phyir skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo rig par mdzad pa nyid tshad ma yin te //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bu'i don gyi gtso bo rig par mdzad pa nyid tshad ma yin te //
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of the principal purpose of man is itself valid cognition.

original: gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir @46a * //
analyzed: gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir @46a * //
translated: because the other is not tenable.

original: ro ; / de'i phyir /
analyzed: ro ; / de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: ring po mthong ngam min yang rung //
analyzed: ring po mthong ngam min yang rung //
translated: whether or not one sees far,

original: 'dod pa'i de nyid mthong ba yin //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i de nyid mthong ba yin //
translated: one sees the reality of desire.

original: gal te ring mthong tshad yin na //
analyzed: gal te ring mthong tshad yin na //
translated: If seeing far is the limit of knowledge,

original: tshur shog bya rgod bstan par gyis //
analyzed: tshur shog bya rgod bstan par gyis //
translated: then come and I will show you the vulture.

original: ring por mthong ba yod do zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni thams cad rig par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ring por mthong ba yod do zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni thams cad rig par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that everything is known by the mere fact that one sees far.üîΩIf that were so, then since vultures, etc. also see far, then come and I will show you the vulture and the pig that sees far.

original: gal te de lta yin na ni bya rgod la sogs pa yang de yin pas na tshur shog bya rgod dang ring por thos pa'i phag bsten pa bdag gir gyis shig / de lta na rigs pa'i lam thams cad dor ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na ni bya rgod la sogs pa yang de yin pas na tshur shog bya rgod dang ring por thos pa'i phag bsten pa bdag gir gyis shig / de lta na rigs pa'i lam thams cad dor ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, one would have to abandon the path of reasoning altogether.

original: 'on te 'di'i skyes bu'i don gyi mkhyen pa btsal bar bya ba ci don mtha' dag mkhyen pa mi srid pa'am /
analyzed: 'on te 'di'i skyes bu'i don gyi mkhyen pa btsal bar bya ba ci don mtha' dag mkhyen pa mi srid pa'am /
translated: But if one were to investigate the knowledge of the object of a person, is it impossible to know all objects?

original: gcig tu don med pa nyid yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gcig tu don med pa nyid yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or is it completely meaningless?

original: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: thams cad rig par mdzad pa yi //
analyzed: thams cad rig par mdzad pa yi //
translated: The one who knows all

original: thams cad mkhyen pa 'gog pa min //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa 'gog pa min //
translated: But we do not deny omniscience.

original: nged kyis shes par mi nus pas //üîΩchog shes par ni 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: nged kyis shes par mi nus pas // chog shes par ni 'dod pa yin //
translated: We do not know everything,üîΩand we admit that we do not know.

original: thams cad shes pa ma yin bas ni thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa ma yin bas ni thams cad mkhyen pa shes pa ma yin te /
translated: One who does not know everything does not know all things,

original: thabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he does not have the means to know them.

original: 'di ltar / thams cad shes so zhes bya 'di //
analyzed: 'di ltar / thams cad shes so zhes bya 'di //
translated: Thus, the statement ‚Äúhe knows everything‚Äù

original: de yi shes bya'i shes las 'dod //
analyzed: de yi shes bya'i shes las 'dod //
translated: is accepted as based on his knowledge of what is to be known.

original: de yi phyogs gcig rnam shes pa //
analyzed: de yi phyogs gcig rnam shes pa //
translated: One who knows a part of what is to be known

original: de shes nyid las 'grub pa yin //
analyzed: de shes nyid las 'grub pa yin //
translated: is accepted as knowing that part.

original: bud med dang dmangs rigs dang thun mong ba shing la sogs pa shes pa yang gzhan gyis shes pa'am ma yin zhes de shes pa nyid las 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: bud med dang dmangs rigs dang thun mong ba shing la sogs pa shes pa yang gzhan gyis shes pa'am ma yin zhes de shes pa nyid las 'dod pa yin te /
translated: One who knows a woman, a ≈õ≈´dra, a tree, etc., is known by others as knowing that woman, that ≈õ≈´dra, that tree, etc.

original: rang nyid kyis ma shes na ni de 'dis shes so zhes bya ba'i thabs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis ma shes na ni de 'dis shes so zhes bya ba'i thabs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If he does not know himself, there is no means to say ‚Äúhe knows that.‚Äù

original: gzigs pa ring du song ba'i chen po gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gzigs pa ring du song ba'i chen po gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who have the great vision of omniscience

original: mtha' dag mkhyen pa srid pa ni phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid do //
analyzed: mtha' dag mkhyen pa srid pa ni phyogs gcig yongs su shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid do //
translated: The possibility of knowing everything is preceded by the complete knowledge of one part.

original: de dag gi de nyid srid pa de yang de las gzhan gyis yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi de nyid srid pa de yang de las gzhan gyis yin no //
translated: And that possibility of knowing everything is due to that.

original: 'on te gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma la yang sgrub pa gang las yin zhing rgyu yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid kyi tshad ma la yang sgrub pa gang las yin zhing rgyu yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: But what is the proof of valid knowledge having the characteristics of both? And what is the cause?

original: bshad pa / sgrub byed thugs rje goms las te //
analyzed: bshad pa / sgrub byed thugs rje goms las te //
translated: The proof is from the practice of compassion.

original: blo lus la ni brten pa'i phyir //
analyzed: blo lus la ni brten pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the mind is based on the body.

original: tshad ma de'i sgrub byed gang las yin zhe na //
analyzed: tshad ma de'i sgrub byed gang las yin zhe na //
translated: What is the proof of valid knowledge?

original: thugs rje goms pa las yin na //
analyzed: thugs rje goms pa las yin na //
translated: The proof is from the practice of compassion.

original: thugs rje de yang blo'i lus la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rje de yang blo'i lus la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that compassion is based on the body of the mind.

original: thugs rje de ni goms pa'i yan lag dang bcas par blo'i lus gang yin pa de la bsten pa'i phyir rtogs par rab kyi mthar sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: thugs rje de ni goms pa'i yan lag dang bcas par blo'i lus gang yin pa de la bsten pa'i phyir rtogs par rab kyi mthar sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: Because that compassion, together with the factors of practice, is based on the body of the mind, it is the proof of the highest realization.

original: gal @46b te thugs rje yod du chug pa de lta na yang de las tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las srid pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal @46b te thugs rje yod du chug pa de lta na yang de las tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las srid pa yin zhe na /
translated: If you grant that there is compassion, then how could it be possible to say that it is a valid cognition?

original: srid pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: srid pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: It is possible, because it exists.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩpha rol sdug bsngal de bzhin du //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / pha rol sdug bsngal de bzhin du //
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause of the desire to remove

original: sdug bsngal rgyu dang bral 'dod gang //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu dang bral 'dod gang //
translated: the suffering of others, just as it is in oneself.

original: de brtse des na des ldan pa //
analyzed: de brtse des na des ldan pa //
translated: That compassion is the cause

original: de yi thabs ni sgrub par 'dod //
analyzed: de yi thabs ni sgrub par 'dod //
translated: of the method for achieving that.

original: gzhan yang sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa ni gdon mi za bar de'i thabs tshol ba yin no zhes phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa ni gdon mi za bar de'i thabs tshol ba yin no zhes phyis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it will be shown later that one who desires to remove the suffering of others must seek the method for that.

original: yang na sgrub byed thugs rje /
analyzed: yang na sgrub byed thugs rje /
translated: Or, the proof of compassion is as follows:

original: thugs rje dang ldan pa ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thugs rje dang ldan pa ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has compassion cannot be devoid of helping others.

original: des na gzhan gyi don ston pas tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi don ston pas tshad ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, because he teaches the benefit of others, he is a valid person.

original: thugs brtse ba dang ldan pa ni thabs la 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: thugs brtse ba dang ldan pa ni thabs la 'jug pa yin la /
translated: One who has compassion is engaged in the method.

original: thabs de yang rang nyid tshad mar sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs de yang rang nyid tshad mar sgrub pa yin no //
translated: And that method is the proof of his own validity.

original: thams ca skyob par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis thugs rje de nyid gang las 'byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: thams ca skyob par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis thugs rje de nyid gang las 'byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúFrom what does that compassion arise, which has the characteristic of the desire to protect all beings?‚Äù

original: bshad pa / goms las de /üîΩsnying rje ni bdag gi ba rnams la sdug bsngal mthong bas bag chags sang pa las skye la /
analyzed: bshad pa / goms las de / snying rje ni bdag gi ba rnams la sdug bsngal mthong bas bag chags sang pa las skye la /
translated: It arises from cultivation.

original: goms pa las ni tha mal pa dang dgra bo'i phyogs dag la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: goms pa las ni tha mal pa dang dgra bo'i phyogs dag la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Compassion arises from the cultivation of the perception of the suffering of those who are close to the bodhisattva, and from the cultivation of the perception of the suffering of those who are neutral, it arises in relation to friends and enemies.

original: des na thams cad shes pa ma yin na thams cad skyob pa mi srid pa'i phyir de'i thabs goms pa sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: des na thams cad shes pa ma yin na thams cad skyob pa mi srid pa'i phyir de'i thabs goms pa sgrub par byed do //
translated: Therefore, since it is impossible to protect all beings without knowing all things, the cultivation of the method for knowing all things is established.

original: gal te blo dang ldan pa'i blo ni lus la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te blo dang ldan pa'i blo ni lus la brten pa yin no //
translated: If the mind of the wise is based on the body,

original: thugs rje yang blo nyid yin te /üîΩdes na de yang lus la brten pa nyid de //
analyzed: thugs rje yang blo nyid yin te / des na de yang lus la brten pa nyid de //
translated: compassion is also a type of mind.üîΩTherefore, it too is based on the body.

original: de'i phyir lus thal bar gyur pa la sogs pa na goms pa mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus thal bar gyur pa la sogs pa na goms pa mi 'grub bo //
translated: Thus, when the body is reduced to ashes, cultivation is not established.

original: gal te skye ba gzhan yod na ni de'i tshe skye ba du mar goms pa bsags pa las mngon par 'dod pa 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te skye ba gzhan yod na ni de'i tshe skye ba du mar goms pa bsags pa las mngon par 'dod pa 'grub pa yin no //
translated: If there were another birth, then the desired result would be accomplished through the accumulation of the repeated practice of that.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / blo ni lus kyi bdag nyid dang // lus 'bras lus kyi yon tan yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar / blo ni lus kyi bdag nyid dang // lus 'bras lus kyi yon tan yin //
translated: The mind is the nature of the body, the body is the result of the body, and the body is the quality of the body.

original: 'dir ni lugs gsum la brten te //
analyzed: 'dir ni lugs gsum la brten te //
translated: Here, based on three systems,

original: goms pa srid pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: goms pa srid pa yod ma yin //
translated: there is no possibility of the repeated practice.

original: de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of that is:

original: blo ni lus la brten pa'i phyir //
analyzed: blo ni lus la brten pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the mind is based on the body,

original: goms pa grub pa med ce na //
analyzed: goms pa grub pa med ce na //
translated: it is said that the repeated practice is not established.

original: ma yin rten ni bkag phyir ro//
analyzed: ma yin rten ni bkag phyir ro//
translated: That is not so, because the basis is refuted.

original: snga ma'i rjes su 'gro ba'i bral ba'i blo dang bral ba'i lus 'ba' zhig blo'i rten yin pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma'i rjes su 'gro ba'i bral ba'i blo dang bral ba'i lus 'ba' zhig blo'i rten yin pa bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Only the body, which is free from the mind that follows the previous and is free from the mind, is refuted as the basis of the mind.

original: 'bras bu nyid dam yon tan nyid dam gzhan du yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid dam yon tan nyid dam gzhan du yin yang rung ste /
translated: Whether it is the result itself, the quality itself, or something else,

original: lus 'ba' zhig ni rten du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lus 'ba' zhig ni rten du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: only the body does not become the basis.

original: gal te pha ma'i lus la brten pa mthong ba'i phyir blo lus la brten pa @47a * //
analyzed: gal te pha ma'i lus la brten pa mthong ba'i phyir blo lus la brten pa @47a * //
translated: If it is said that the mind is based on the body because it is seen to be based on the parents' bodies,

original: dang lus kyi 'bras bur dmigs pa yin nam /
analyzed: dang lus kyi 'bras bur dmigs pa yin nam /
translated: is the mind observed as the result of the body?

original: 'di ltar bskyed par bya ba'i lus kyi 'byung ba chen po la brten pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar bskyed par bya ba'i lus kyi 'byung ba chen po la brten pa /
translated: In this way, the body that is generated is based on the great elements,

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi kun tu spyod pa dang / sems gsal ba la sogs pa pha ma'i rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi kun tu spyod pa dang / sems gsal ba la sogs pa pha ma'i rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
translated: and its nature is the activity of the mind, such as clarity, and so on, which is in accordance with the parents.

original: ri mo la sogs pa bzhin no /
analyzed: ri mo la sogs pa bzhin no /
translated: It is like a painting, and so on.

original: ri mo byed pa'i gzugs shes pa la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can rtsig pa la brten pa dang ri mo ni ri mo byed pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: ri mo byed pa'i gzugs shes pa la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can rtsig pa la brten pa dang ri mo ni ri mo byed pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The painting, which is based on the wall, is in accordance with the consciousness of the painter, and so on, and the painting is the nature of the result of the painter.

original: des na ri mo ni rtsig pa med par mi gnas la /üîΩrtsig pa gzhan du yang mi 'pho /
analyzed: des na ri mo ni rtsig pa med par mi gnas la / rtsig pa gzhan du yang mi 'pho /
translated: Therefore, the painting does not exist without the wall.üîΩIt does not move to another wall.

original: rtsig pa gzhan las 'ongs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsig pa gzhan las 'ongs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It does not come from another wall.

original: yang na aa mra'i 'bras bu la sogs pa smin pa las byung ba'i gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na aa mra'i 'bras bu la sogs pa smin pa las byung ba'i gzugs bzhin no //
translated: Or, it is like the form that arises from the ripening of the mango fruit, and so on.

original: 'bras bu yang du ba me gzhan las ma 'ongs me gzhan du 'gro ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang du ba me gzhan las ma 'ongs me gzhan du 'gro ba yang ma yin no //
translated: The result is not that smoke comes from another fire or that it goes to another fire.

original: chang la brten pa'i myos pa'i nus pa ni bska ba la sogs pa'i ro dang 'brel pa las snga na med pa 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: chang la brten pa'i myos pa'i nus pa ni bska ba la sogs pa'i ro dang 'brel pa las snga na med pa 'byung ba yin la /
translated: The potency of intoxication based on beer arises from a connection with a taste such as astringent, etc., and did not exist previously.

original: 'jig pa na yang chang gzhan la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa na yang chang gzhan la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: And when it ceases, it is not based on another beer.

original: de bzhin du dbang po dang sems pa'i khyad par yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po dang sems pa'i khyad par yang yin no //
translated: So too, it is a special sense faculty and mind.

original: de skad du bshad pa yang /
analyzed: de skad du bshad pa yang /
translated: This is what is explained.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung //
translated: Earth, water, fire, and wind

original: zhes bya ba ni de nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de nyid yin no //
translated: are just that.

original: sa la sogs pa nyid de nyid yin pa dang sa la sogs pa ni de nyid yin pa dang sa la sogs pa ni de nyid yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa nyid de nyid yin pa dang sa la sogs pa ni de nyid yin pa dang sa la sogs pa ni de nyid yin pa nyid do //
translated: Earth, etc., are just that, and earth, etc., are just those.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa ni ma yin la /
translated: But not space, etc.,

original: skad cig nyid la sogs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig nyid la sogs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and not momentariness, etc.

original: de bzhin du de nyid yin gyi //
analyzed: de bzhin du de nyid yin gyi //
translated: So too, it is just that,

original: rnam par shes pa tsam ma yin la /üîΩthams cad stong pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam ma yin la / thams cad stong pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: but not just consciousness,

original: thams cad la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes so //
analyzed: thams cad la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro zhes so //
translated: and not the emptiness of everything, because there is no valid cognition for everything.

original: de'i tshogs la lus dang dbang po dang yul gyi ming du 'dogs so //
analyzed: de'i tshogs la lus dang dbang po dang yul gyi ming du 'dogs so //
translated: The collection of these is designated by the name ‚Äúbody,‚Äù ‚Äúsense faculty,‚Äù and ‚Äúobject.‚Äù

original: tshad med pa yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par 'byung ba chen po nyid kyi tshogs ni lus la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no //
analyzed: tshad med pa yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par 'byung ba chen po nyid kyi tshogs ni lus la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no //
translated: The collection of the great elements, which are the transformation of the immeasurable, is the domain of the conventions of ‚Äúbody,‚Äù etc.

original: lus dang dbang po dang blo de dag las ni sems pa yin te /
analyzed: lus dang dbang po dang blo de dag las ni sems pa yin te /
translated: From among the body, sense faculty, and mind, it is the mind that is the creator.

original: dper na phabs la sogs pa las myos pa'i nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na phabs la sogs pa las myos pa'i nus pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the power of fermentation in yeast, etc.

original: des na rnam par shes pa ni myos pa'i nus pa bzhin te /
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa ni myos pa'i nus pa bzhin te /
translated: Therefore, consciousness is like the power of fermentation.

original: 'jig rten pha rol nas 'ongs nas mtshams sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol nas 'ongs nas mtshams sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it comes from another world and connects with the body.

original: myos pa'i nus pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yang nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: myos pa'i nus pa bzhin no zhes bya ba yang nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is like the power of fermentation‚Äù is an illustration.

original: ri mo bzhin dang du ba bzhin no zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ri mo bzhin dang du ba bzhin no zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: It is like a painting and like smoke.

original: de dag ni 'pho bar mthong ba med do zhe na de ni ma yin te /üîΩ@47b gzugs sogs las ni tha dad par //
analyzed: de dag ni 'pho bar mthong ba med do zhe na de ni ma yin te / @47b gzugs sogs las ni tha dad par //
translated: It is not seen to transfer.

original: 'byung ba dmigs par ga la yod //
analyzed: 'byung ba dmigs par ga la yod //
translated: How can the elements be observed as separate from form, etc.?

original: de dag kyang lnga de yi phyir //
analyzed: de dag kyang lnga de yi phyir //
translated: They are five.üîΩ

original: grangs nges gzung ba rigs ma yin //
analyzed: grangs nges gzung ba rigs ma yin //
translated: Therefore, the number of the elements is not definite.üîΩThe elements are five in number: earth, water, fire, air, and space.

original: gzugs dang ro dang dri dang sgra dang reg pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang ro dang dri dang sgra dang reg pa ste /
translated: Form, taste, smell, and touch are the qualities of the elements.

original: 'byung ba chen po ni lnga yin no //üîΩsa la sogs pa'i ming ni de'i tshogs la yin te /üîΩsa la sogs pa gzhan du dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po ni lnga yin no // sa la sogs pa'i ming ni de'i tshogs la yin te / sa la sogs pa gzhan du dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The elements are five in number: earth, water, fire, air, and space.

original: 'on te ro ni reg pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te ro ni reg pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The names ‚Äúearth,‚Äù etc., are given to the collections of the four qualities, form, etc., because earth, etc., are not perceived separately from them.

original: yongs su gyur pa bzhin yin na /
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa bzhin yin na /
translated: If you say that taste is touch in the state of becoming,

original: de lta na yang sa la sogs pa zhes mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de lta na yang sa la sogs pa zhes mi 'thad de /
translated: then it is not tenable to call it ‚Äúearth,‚Äù etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It should be called ‚Äúform,‚Äù etc.

original: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub pa ni phyis 'byung bar 'gyur bas de mi dgod do //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid la sogs pa'i sgrub pa ni phyis 'byung bar 'gyur bas de mi dgod do //
translated: The proofs of momentariness, etc., will be presented later.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / thams cad blta bya ba blta bya zhes //
analyzed: gzhan yang / thams cad blta bya ba blta bya zhes //
translated: If all are objects of observation,

original: gcig nyid du ni thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig nyid du ni thal bar 'gyur //
translated: then it follows that they are one.

original: rnam pa dag gis dbye bas ni //
analyzed: rnam pa dag gis dbye bas ni //
translated: If they are differentiated by way of aspect,

original: mtha' yas par ni thal ba yin //
analyzed: mtha' yas par ni thal ba yin //
translated: then it follows that they are infinite.

original: de phyir rten lnga'i gzung ba ni //
analyzed: de phyir rten lnga'i gzung ba ni //
translated: Therefore, the objects of the five sense organs

original: rnam pa lngar ni bsnyad par bya //
analyzed: rnam pa lngar ni bsnyad par bya //
translated: It should be explained in five ways.

original: de yi nang gi bye brag ni //
analyzed: de yi nang gi bye brag ni //
translated: The internal divisions

original: lnga la gnod pa med pa nyid //
analyzed: lnga la gnod pa med pa nyid //
translated: Are fivefold, and they are unimpaired.

original: thams cad stong la gang brjod pa //
analyzed: thams cad stong la gang brjod pa //
translated: Whatever is said about emptiness

original: tshad ma yod na stong nyid min //
analyzed: tshad ma yod na stong nyid min //
translated: Is not emptiness if there is valid cognition.

original: gal te stong nyid chad pa med //
analyzed: gal te stong nyid chad pa med //
translated: If emptiness is not nihilism,

original: de phyir 'di gnyis 'gal ba yin //
analyzed: de phyir 'di gnyis 'gal ba yin //
translated: Then these two are contradictory.üîΩThe nature of emptiness of everything

original: thams cad stong nyid ci 'dra dang // de la tshad ma'i ci 'dra ba'ang //
analyzed: thams cad stong nyid ci 'dra dang // de la tshad ma'i ci 'dra ba'ang //
translated: And the nature of valid cognition

original: phyi nas bstan par bya ba ste //
analyzed: phyi nas bstan par bya ba ste //
translated: Will be taught later,

original: myur ba nyid ni gang du dgos //
analyzed: myur ba nyid ni gang du dgos //
translated: But why is it needed so quickly?

original: gal te dbang po la sogs pa ni pha ma'i lus kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yin la lus ni 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de la brten pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dbang po la sogs pa ni pha ma'i lus kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa yin la lus ni 'byung ba chen po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir de la brten pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If the sense faculties and so on follow and reverse the body, and the body is by nature the great elements, aren‚Äôt they based on that?

original: gzhan du 'jig rten pha rol nas 'ongs pa nyid du dmigs pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan du 'jig rten pha rol nas 'ongs pa nyid du dmigs pa ni ma yin na /
translated: If it is not observed that they come from another world,

original: de ji ltar 'jig rten pha rol yod par smra ba la sogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'jig rten pha rol yod par smra ba la sogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: how can they be proponents of the existence of another world?

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: For,

original: skye ba yongs su len pa na //
analyzed: skye ba yongs su len pa na //
translated: In the process of taking rebirth,

original: 'byung rngub dbang po blo dag ni //
analyzed: 'byung rngub dbang po blo dag ni //
translated: the in-breath and out-breath, the sense faculties, and the mind

original: rang gi rigs la ltos med can //
analyzed: rang gi rigs la ltos med can //
translated: do not depend on their own species.

original: lus med 'ba' zhig las skyes min //
analyzed: lus med 'ba' zhig las skyes min //
translated: They do not arise from a body alone,

original: ha cang thal phyir /
analyzed: ha cang thal phyir /
translated: because that would be absurd.

original: 'byung rngub la sogs pa ni g-yo ba la sogs pas byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par las rang gi rigs la ltos pa med par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'byung rngub la sogs pa ni g-yo ba la sogs pas byas pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par las rang gi rigs la ltos pa med par mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that the in-breath and out-breath, etc., do not depend on their own species, because they are particularities of the nature that are produced by movement, etc.

original: g-yo ba la sogs pa yang bdag nyid kyi goms pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can yin gyi /
analyzed: g-yo ba la sogs pa yang bdag nyid kyi goms pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can yin gyi /
translated: Movement, etc., are also subsequent to the cultivation of one‚Äôs own self.

original: pha ma'i goms pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ni ma yin te /üîΩde lta ma yin na dam pa ma yin dang 'brel pa la @48a * //
analyzed: pha ma'i goms pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ni ma yin te / de lta ma yin na dam pa ma yin dang 'brel pa la @48a * //
translated: They are not subsequent to the cultivation of one‚Äôs parents,

original: sogs pas pha ma'i rang bzhin med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sogs pas pha ma'i rang bzhin med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because if that were not so, then, due to the connection with the non-holy, etc., the nature of the parents would not exist.

original: de'i phyir rang gi rigs la ltos pa med par pha ma'i lus tsam las 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi rigs la ltos pa med par pha ma'i lus tsam las 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they do not arise from the mere body of the parents without depending on their own species.

original: gal te 'dod pa la sogs pa pha ma'i rang bzhin sngar yod pa de'i tshe pha ma'i lus la sogs pa yang rgyu yin no zhes mi 'thad do//
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa la sogs pa pha ma'i rang bzhin sngar yod pa de'i tshe pha ma'i lus la sogs pa yang rgyu yin no zhes mi 'thad do//
translated: If desire and so on existed previously in the nature of the parents, then the parents‚Äô bodies and so on would be the cause. But that is untenable.

original: 'on te 'jig rten gzhan la ltos pa med pa kho nar skye ba 'dzin par khas len na de'i tshe skye ba yongs su 'dzin par khas len pa la ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig rten gzhan la ltos pa med pa kho nar skye ba 'dzin par khas len na de'i tshe skye ba yongs su 'dzin par khas len pa la ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if you accept that one takes birth in dependence on another world, then it follows, absurdly, that one accepts that one takes birth without any dependence on another world.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po thams cad 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po thams cad 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: For all things that are causes and effects would be destroyed.

original: de yang tshad mas yongs su bcad pas nges par gzung ba yin no //üîΩgal te 'byung rngub la sogs pa //
analyzed: de yang tshad mas yongs su bcad pas nges par gzung ba yin no // gal te 'byung rngub la sogs pa //
translated: This is ascertained by means of valid cognition.üîΩIf all of the inhalations and exhalations

original: thams cad goms pa sngon 'gro na //üîΩrang gi goms pa dang bral bar //
analyzed: thams cad goms pa sngon 'gro na // rang gi goms pa dang bral bar //
translated: are preceded by habituation,üîΩthen how could they occur

original: rten med par ni ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: rten med par ni ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: without the basis of habituation?

original: 'bras bu'i chos ni 'di yin te //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos ni 'di yin te //
translated: This is the result of the dharma:

original: rgyu spangs nas gzhan du 'byung ba ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu spangs nas gzhan du 'byung ba ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: it is not the case that it arises as something other than the cause.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: de de'i bskyed bya ma yin te /
analyzed: de de'i bskyed bya ma yin te /
translated: then it would not be the product of that.

original: bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed bya skyed byed kyi dngos po rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the concomitance and nonconcomitance of the produced and the producer.

original: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa ni rigs mthun pa goms pa las byung ba'i mig la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig la sogs pa ni rigs mthun pa goms pa las byung ba'i mig la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no //
translated: Therefore, the eye and so on arise from the eye and so on of a similar type that has arisen previously.

original: gal te du ba las skye ba //
analyzed: gal te du ba las skye ba //
translated: If smoke arises from fire,

original: rnam kun du ba nyid las min //
analyzed: rnam kun du ba nyid las min //
translated: in every way it does not arise from non-fire.

original: autpala las byung autpala yang //
analyzed: autpala las byung autpala yang //
translated: An utpala arises from an utpala,

original: ji ltar ba lang lci ba las //
analyzed: ji ltar ba lang lci ba las //
translated: just as dung arises from a cow.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: ri mkhan las skyes ri mo ni //
analyzed: ri mkhan las skyes ri mo ni //
translated: a painting arises from a painter,

original: bya la'ang de bzhin ci ltar yin //
analyzed: bya la'ang de bzhin ci ltar yin //
translated: but how is it like a bird?

original: de bzhin goms las khyad 'gyur gang //
analyzed: de bzhin goms las khyad 'gyur gang //
translated: How is it that a transformation arises from practice?

original: de ni gzhan du'ang 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: de ni gzhan du'ang 'gyur ba yin //
translated: It is transformed into something else.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: du ba las byung du ci 'dra //
analyzed: du ba las byung du ci 'dra //
translated: How does smoke arise from fire?

original: de gzhan las kyang skye ba min //
analyzed: de gzhan las kyang skye ba min //
translated: It does not arise from anything else.

original: goms las khyad 'gyur gang yin te //
analyzed: goms las khyad 'gyur gang yin te //
translated: How is it that a transformation arises from practice?

original: skye ba dang por gang yin gnas //
analyzed: skye ba dang por gang yin gnas //
translated: It remains as it was in the first moment of birth.

original: khyad par gang zhig thos pa goms pa la sogs pa dag las skye ba can de lta bur 'gyur ba de nyid skye ba 'di'i goms pa med kyang mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par gang zhig thos pa goms pa la sogs pa dag las skye ba can de lta bur 'gyur ba de nyid skye ba 'di'i goms pa med kyang mthong ba yin no //
translated: In particular, that which arises from hearing, reflection, and so on, is seen to arise in this life even without habituation in this life.

original: de goms pa dang 'brel ba la gnod pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de goms pa dang 'brel ba la gnod pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And there is no contradiction in the connection with habituation,

original: gzhan du yang 'das par goms pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan du yang 'das par goms pa de'i tshe /
translated: because the past habituation is not able to be perceived at another time,

original: dmigs par mi nus pa'i phyir grong gzhan nas 'ongs pa'i goms pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dmigs par mi nus pa'i phyir grong gzhan nas 'ongs pa'i goms pa bzhin no //
translated: like the habituation of someone who has come from another country.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten gzhan pa ma yin pa'i goms pa sngon du song ba can du yang 'grub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten gzhan pa ma yin pa'i goms pa sngon du song ba can du yang 'grub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is not established that there is prior habituation in another world.

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu dang lhan cig 'brel pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu dang lhan cig 'brel pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because the effect is connected with the cause.

original: @48b rgyu ma mthong yang de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: @48b rgyu ma mthong yang de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Even though the cause is not seen, it is its effect,

original: yul gzhan du goms pa sngon du song ba can gyi bshes gnyen bzhin no //
analyzed: yul gzhan du goms pa sngon du song ba can gyi bshes gnyen bzhin no //
translated: like the friend who has prior habituation in another country.

original: de'i phyir 'dir glen pa'i gtam 'ongs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir glen pa'i gtam 'ongs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the talk of fools in this matter.

original: glen pa 'ga' la gzhan dag gis //
analyzed: glen pa 'ga' la gzhan dag gis //
translated: Some fools say:

original: khyu mchog rva ring ma lto na //
analyzed: khyu mchog rva ring ma lto na //
translated: The horns of the bull are in the belly of the cow.

original: gnas pa ci ltar srid pa gang //
analyzed: gnas pa ci ltar srid pa gang //
translated: What is the possibility of this?

original: smros shig ce ni dris pa na //
analyzed: smros shig ce ni dris pa na //
translated: Tell me!

original: de smras ma he 'di dag ni //
analyzed: de smras ma he 'di dag ni //
translated: He replied, ‚ÄúThese buffaloes

original: ma yi lto las skyes min gyi //üîΩ'di dag tshong dus nas 'ongs pa'i //
analyzed: ma yi lto las skyes min gyi // 'di dag tshong dus nas 'ongs pa'i //
translated: are not born from the womb of a cow.üîΩThey are simply bought in the marketplace

original: rin gyis nyos pa tsam du zad //
analyzed: rin gyis nyos pa tsam du zad //
translated: with money.

original: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i gnod pa yang de lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i gnod pa yang de lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚Äù The objection of the LokƒÅyatas is like this.

original: yang na ha cang thal phyir na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na ha cang thal phyir na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or, because of the extreme consequence.

original: gal te skye ba gzhan nas 'ongs pa med bar 'byung ba chen po de dag nyid las 'bras bu sems pa 'byung ba yin na mtha' dag srog chags kyi rang bzhin du ci ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te skye ba gzhan nas 'ongs pa med bar 'byung ba chen po de dag nyid las 'bras bu sems pa 'byung ba yin na mtha' dag srog chags kyi rang bzhin du ci ste mi 'gyur /
translated: If the effect, thought, arises from the great elements themselves, without coming from another birth, why do not all living beings arise from all great elements?

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'i rnam pa'i bye brag srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i rnam pa'i bye brag srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because of the possibility of a specific transformation.

original: yongs su gyur ba'i bye brag de nyid ci ste med ces brgal brtag mtshungs so //
analyzed: yongs su gyur ba'i bye brag de nyid ci ste med ces brgal brtag mtshungs so //
translated: Why is that specific transformation not nonexistent? The objection is the same.

original: 'on te gang las 'ga' zhig srog chags su gyur la gzhan ma yin ba /
analyzed: 'on te gang las 'ga' zhig srog chags su gyur la gzhan ma yin ba /
translated: But if you say that there is some transformation of the body that is not a transformation of the living being,

original: yongs su 'gyur ba thog ma med pa can phan tshun khyad par du gyur pa mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa 'ga' zhig yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba thog ma med pa can phan tshun khyad par du gyur pa mtshon par bya ba ma yin pa 'ga' zhig yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and that this transformation is not perceived because it is beginningless and because it is a subtle difference between the two,

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: that is not correct.

original: gal te yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par bltar rung ba ma yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par bltar rung ba ma yin na ni /
translated: If the difference in the transformation is not perceptible,

original: rtog pa 'di ji ltar yin /
analyzed: rtog pa 'di ji ltar yin /
translated: how can you imagine it?

original: bltar rung ba ma mthong ba ni yod pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ma yin no //
analyzed: bltar rung ba ma mthong ba ni yod pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ma yin no //
translated: What is not perceptible cannot be the object of the convention ‚Äúexists.‚Äù

original: gal te yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par de yod na dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par de yod na dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the difference in the transformation exists, it must be perceived.

original: 'on te 'bras bu mthong ba nyid la rtog na /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu mthong ba nyid la rtog na /
translated: But if you imagine that the effect is seen,

original: de lta yin na mthong ba'i goms pa nyid brtag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin na mthong ba'i goms pa nyid brtag par bya ba yin te /
translated: then the effect is seen as the result of habituation to seeing it.

original: ma mthong ba rtog na ni dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba rtog na ni dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you imagine that the effect is not seen, that is difficult to understand.

original: des na 'byung rngub la sogs pa ni rigs mtshungs pa goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhes bya ba legs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'byung rngub la sogs pa ni rigs mtshungs pa goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhes bya ba legs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is well said that the in-breath and out-breath, etc. are preceded by the practice of the same type.

original: gal te 'bras bu las skye ba //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu las skye ba //
translated: If it is produced from the effect,

original: sngar ma byung ba'i rgyu grub mod //
analyzed: sngar ma byung ba'i rgyu grub mod //
translated: the non-existent cause is established.

original: skye ba phyi mar 'byung ba rnams go ci ltar rjes su dpog ce na /üîΩde bshad pa ni /
analyzed: skye ba phyi mar 'byung ba rnams go ci ltar rjes su dpog ce na / de bshad pa ni /
translated: How are those that will arise later inferred?

original: mtshams sbyor bar /
analyzed: mtshams sbyor bar /
translated: The explanation of that is:üîΩIn the connection,

original: nus ldan mthong ba gang de la //
analyzed: nus ldan mthong ba gang de la //
translated: what is seen as having the ability,

original: ci zhig yod 'gyur gang med pa //
analyzed: ci zhig yod 'gyur gang med pa //
translated: what exists and what does not exist,

original: gang zhig phyi nas mtshams sbyor med //
analyzed: gang zhig phyi nas mtshams sbyor med //
translated: what is later without connection,

original: snga ma ni rjes su dpag pas rjes su dpag pa'i rjes dpag pa la sogs pas mtshams sbyor bar nges pa yin no //üîΩgal te g-yer @49a * //
analyzed: snga ma ni rjes su dpag pas rjes su dpag pa'i rjes dpag pa la sogs pas mtshams sbyor bar nges pa yin no // gal te g-yer @49a * //
translated: the former is ascertained to be connected by inference, by the inference of inference, etc.

original: bag la sogs pa ni de goms pas mi 'gul ba dang gzhan pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid g-yer bag med pa las byung ba yin pa de ni 'byung ba chen po tsam nyid las yin te /
analyzed: bag la sogs pa ni de goms pas mi 'gul ba dang gzhan pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid g-yer bag med pa las byung ba yin pa de ni 'byung ba chen po tsam nyid las yin te /
translated: If the shaking, etc. is from the non-shaking, etc. that arises from the practice of that, it is from the mere great elements.

original: des na de las kyang skye ba snga ma mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: des na de las kyang skye ba snga ma mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, even less can the prior birth be established.

original: de'i phyir thog ma med pa'i skye ba brgyud ba mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir thog ma med pa'i skye ba brgyud ba mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the transmission of birth without beginning cannot be established.

original: thog ma med pa nyid ma yin na ni du ba las du ba gzhan 'byung yang gtan du rjes su rgyun 'brel ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: thog ma med pa nyid ma yin na ni du ba las du ba gzhan 'byung yang gtan du rjes su rgyun 'brel ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: If it were not without beginning, then even though smoke would arise from another smoke, it would not be a continuous series forever.üîΩTherefore, because it would be interrupted like smoke, it would not be the case that there is no final living being, and the error would ensue that a living being would arise without a prior cause.

original: des na du ba bzhin rgyun 'chad par yang 'gyur ba'i phyir srog chags tha ma med pa yang ma yin la snga na med pa'i sems can skye ba zhes bya ba'i nyes par 'gyur ro zhe na de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: des na du ba bzhin rgyun 'chad par yang 'gyur ba'i phyir srog chags tha ma med pa yang ma yin la snga na med pa'i sems can skye ba zhes bya ba'i nyes par 'gyur ro zhe na de yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so, because:

original: skye po rnams kyi zhen pa yang //
analyzed: skye po rnams kyi zhen pa yang //
translated: The attachment of living beings

original: zhan 'jug goms pas yin de'i phyir //
analyzed: zhan 'jug goms pas yin de'i phyir //
translated: is due to the force of habit.

original: de yang de sngon 'gro can phyir //
analyzed: de yang de sngon 'gro can phyir //
translated: And that is due to the prior existence of that,

original: srid pa'i 'khor lo thog ma med //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'khor lo thog ma med //
translated: so the wheel of existence has no beginning.

original: zhan pa sogs pa'i rnam pa ni srog chags rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis ma yin gyi /
analyzed: zhan pa sogs pa'i rnam pa ni srog chags rnams kyi rang bzhin gyis ma yin gyi /
translated: The forms of weakness, etc. of living beings are not due to their nature.

original: 'on kyang rigs mthun pa goms pa las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rigs mthun pa goms pa las yin no //
translated: But rather, they are due to the force of habit of a similar type.

original: ji ltar g-yer bag la sogs pa de goms pa las yin pa de bzhin du zhan pa la sogs pa yang snyom las la sogs pa goms pa las yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba thog ma med pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar g-yer bag la sogs pa de goms pa las yin pa de bzhin du zhan pa la sogs pa yang snyom las la sogs pa goms pa las yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba thog ma med pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Just as the state of being a drunkard, etc. is due to the repeated practice of drinking wine, etc. , so also the state of being a coward, etc. is due to the repeated practice of laziness, etc. Therefore, samsara is established as being without beginning.

original: mig gzhan pa la sogs pa ni gnyid la sogs pa goms pa las yin no //
analyzed: mig gzhan pa la sogs pa ni gnyid la sogs pa goms pa las yin no //
translated: The eyes, etc. of another are due to the repeated practice of sleep, etc.

original: de bas na gnyid sad pa'i mig g-yer bag can la sogs pa mig g-yer bag can /üîΩgzhan dang gzhan gyis yin par 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gnyid sad pa'i mig g-yer bag can la sogs pa mig g-yer bag can / gzhan dang gzhan gyis yin par 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the eyes, etc. of one who is awake are different from those of one who is asleep.

original: des na skye ba dang por yang gnyid log pa sad pa bzhin du mngon du phyogs pa'i bag chags sad pa'i mig la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na skye ba dang por yang gnyid log pa sad pa bzhin du mngon du phyogs pa'i bag chags sad pa'i mig la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, even in the first birth, the eyes, etc. are endowed with the latent impressions of the repeated practice of sleep, etc.

original: ci ltar lus gzhan la brten pa'i mig lus gzhan la mtshams sbyor te zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar lus gzhan la brten pa'i mig lus gzhan la mtshams sbyor te zhe na /
translated: How is it that the eyes, which are based on another body, are connected to another body?

original: rdzas gzhan la brten pa'i nus pa gzhan la 'pho bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas gzhan la brten pa'i nus pa gzhan la 'pho bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that the potency, which is based on another substance, is transferred to another?

original: sngags dang rgyud la sogs pa'i mthus //
analyzed: sngags dang rgyud la sogs pa'i mthus //
translated: By the power of spells, mantras, etc.

original: dug nus bur ma sogs la 'gyur //
analyzed: dug nus bur ma sogs la 'gyur //
translated: And the potency of the poison is transferred to the sugar.

original: de bzhin las kyi nus pa yis //
analyzed: de bzhin las kyi nus pa yis //
translated: In the same way, through the potency of karma,

original: dbang po'i nus pa lus gzhan la //
analyzed: dbang po'i nus pa lus gzhan la //
translated: The potency of the sense faculties is transferred to another body.

original: dper na rmi lam lus la ni //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam lus la ni //
translated: For example, in a dream, the body

original: skrag dang mchongs pas gnod pas na //
analyzed: skrag dang mchongs pas gnod pas na //
translated: Is harmed by jumping and falling.

original: sad pa'i lus ni rnam 'gyur ba //
analyzed: sad pa'i lus ni rnam 'gyur ba //
translated: The body that is awakened is transformed.

original: de bzhin skye ba gzhan du yang //
analyzed: de bzhin skye ba gzhan du yang //
translated: In the same way, in another birth,

original: 'on te de bden min zhe na //
analyzed: 'on te de bden min zhe na //
translated: If you say that is not true,

original: shin tu te por legs pa nyid //
analyzed: shin tu te por legs pa nyid //
translated: It is very good.

original: gang zhig bden min gyis 'gyur na //
analyzed: gang zhig bden min gyis 'gyur na //
translated: If it is not true,

original: bden pa las ni smos ci dgos //
analyzed: bden pa las ni smos ci dgos //
translated: What need is there to mention truth?

original: bden pa bden min zhes @49b bya ba //
analyzed: bden pa bden min zhes @49b bya ba //
translated: What is called ‚Äútrue‚Äù and ‚Äúnot true‚Äù

original: 'di yang tha snyad tsam du zad //
analyzed: 'di yang tha snyad tsam du zad //
translated: Is just a convention.

original: rang bzhin mngon du byed pa la //
analyzed: rang bzhin mngon du byed pa la //
translated: In the manifestation of the nature,

original: bden sogs zhes bya 'thad par dka' //üîΩde'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma mtshams sbyor nus pa dang ldan pa mthong ba gang yin pa de la bla lhag pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur na gang phyis med cing de med pas phyis mtshams /
analyzed: bden sogs zhes bya 'thad par dka' // de'i phyir snga ma dang phyi ma mtshams sbyor nus pa dang ldan pa mthong ba gang yin pa de la bla lhag pa ci zhig yod par 'gyur na gang phyis med cing de med pas phyis mtshams /
translated: It is difficult to accept what is called ‚Äútrue‚Äù and so forth.

original: sbyor ba dang mi ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang mi ldan par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, what could be more absurd than the assertion that what is seen as having the ability to connect the prior and subsequent moments is not present later and that, because it is not present, it does not connect with what follows?

original: rgyu ma tshang na 'bras bu med par 'gyur gyi rgyu nus pa dang ldan pa tshang ba la 'bras bu mi skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang na 'bras bu med par 'gyur gyi rgyu nus pa dang ldan pa tshang ba la 'bras bu mi skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ni 'gal lo //
translated: If the cause is incomplete, the effect does not exist. But if the cause is complete and has the capacity, the effect does not arise.

original: 'on te 'di la 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di la 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
translated: But what is the contradiction here?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa gang yin pa 'di nyid 'gal ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med pa gang yin pa 'di nyid 'gal ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it contradictory for the effect not to exist when the cause exists?

original: rgyu yi rang bzhin thams cad ni //
analyzed: rgyu yi rang bzhin thams cad ni //
translated: The nature of all causes

original: mtshungs kyang gal te 'bras med na //
analyzed: mtshungs kyang gal te 'bras med na //
translated: is the same, but if there is no effect,

original: 'o na 'bras bu rang dbang nyid //
analyzed: 'o na 'bras bu rang dbang nyid //
translated: then the effect would be independent.

original: de lta yin na 'bras nyid min //
analyzed: de lta yin na 'bras nyid min //
translated: But if that were so, it would not be an effect.

original: 'bras bu ni rgyu'i gzhan gyi dbang yin pas rgyu de nus pa yin na nan gyis skyed par byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rgyu'i gzhan gyi dbang yin pas rgyu de nus pa yin na nan gyis skyed par byed do //
translated: Since the effect is dependent on the cause, if the cause has the capacity, it generates the effect.

original: de lta na yang mi 'byung na ni 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang mi 'byung na ni 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it does not arise in that way, it would not be an effect.

original: 'on te de med na med pa'i phyir 'bras bu yin no zhe na /üîΩde med na med do zhes ga las yin /
analyzed: 'on te de med na med pa'i phyir 'bras bu yin no zhe na / de med na med do zhes ga las yin /
translated: But if it is an effect because it does not exist if that does not exist,üîΩhow do you know it does not exist if that does not exist?

original: gal te de yod na gdon mi za bar yod do zhes bya ba de yang ga las she na /
analyzed: gal te de yod na gdon mi za bar yod do zhes bya ba de yang ga las she na /
translated: If it exists if that exists, how do you know that?

original: de ltar yongs su bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the determination of that.

original: de med na med do zhes bya ba 'di yang yongs su bcad pa nyid las so //
analyzed: de med na med do zhes bya ba 'di yang yongs su bcad pa nyid las so //
translated: And this, ‚ÄúIf that does not exist, this does not exist,‚Äù is also from the determination itself.

original: thams cad kyi tshe'o zhes ga las she na /
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe'o zhes ga las she na /
translated: And at all times, how is it?

original: gnyi ga yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang mtshungs so //
translated: Both are the same.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar mthong ba de ltar khas blangs pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar mthong ba de ltar khas blangs pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is accepted just as it is seen.

original: gnyi ga yang mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang mthong ba yin no //
translated: And both are seen.

original: de yod na gdon mi za bar yod la //
analyzed: de yod na gdon mi za bar yod la //
translated: If that exists, then without doubt this exists.üîΩIf it is incomplete, it does not occur.

original: ma tshang na mi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes de gnyi ga yang khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma tshang na mi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes de gnyi ga yang khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, both must be accepted.

original: de ltar mthong ba med pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba med pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ma yin no //
translated: But because such a seeing does not exist, there is no causal relation.üîΩThere is no seeing of pervasion,

original: rjes su 'gro dang ldog pa dang // khyab par mthong ba yod ma yin //üîΩde ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu yi //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro dang ldog pa dang // khyab par mthong ba yod ma yin // de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu yi //
translated: of going together and of reversal.üîΩThus, how can the nature of cause and effect

original: dngos po nyid ni ji ltar nges //
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni ji ltar nges //
translated: be ascertained?üîΩIf the causal relation is not established because of the non-seeing of pervasion,

original: she na / gal te khyab par ma mthong ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'grub na /
analyzed: she na / gal te khyab par ma mthong ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'grub na /
translated: then,

original: 'o na gnyis su med pa las ma gtogs pa 'ga' yang mthong ba med do zhes bya ba 'di /
analyzed: 'o na gnyis su med pa las ma gtogs pa 'ga' yang mthong ba med do zhes bya ba 'di /
translated: But if you say that nothing is seen except for the non-dual,

original: rang las rang gi ngo bor rtogs zhes bya bar bstan zin to //
analyzed: rang las rang gi ngo bor rtogs zhes bya bar bstan zin to //
translated: then it has been shown that ‚Äúone realizes one‚Äôs own nature from oneself.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten gzhan ma yin 'jig rten ma yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan ma yin 'jig rten ma yin /
translated: The world is not other, nor is it the world.

original: 'jig rten gzhan gyi sgrub par byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan gyi sgrub par byed pa ma yin /
translated: The world is not the means of establishing another world.

original: the tshom ma yin /
analyzed: the tshom ma yin /
translated: It is not doubt.

original: 'byung ba chen po'i @50a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i @50a * //
translated: It is not the transformation of the great elements.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par rig pa tsam nyid do//'on te 'di tha snyad du yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par rig pa tsam nyid do//'on te 'di tha snyad du yin no zhe na /
translated: And so on‚Äîit is just consciousness. But if you say this is conventional,

original: 'jig rten pha rol yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yang de bzhin no //
translated: then the other world is also like that.

original: gal te gnyis med kyis chog na //
analyzed: gal te gnyis med kyis chog na //
translated: If you are satisfied with non-duality,

original: khyed cag rnam kun grol ba nyid //
analyzed: khyed cag rnam kun grol ba nyid //
translated: you are completely liberated in every way.

original: tha snyad 'jug pa na /
analyzed: tha snyad 'jug pa na /
translated: When engaging in conventional usage,

original: 'jig rten pha rol yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yang de bzhin no //
translated: the other world is also like that.

original: gal te gnyis med kyis chog na //
analyzed: gal te gnyis med kyis chog na //
translated: If you are satisfied with non-duality,

original: khyed cag rnam kun grol ba nyid //
analyzed: khyed cag rnam kun grol ba nyid //
translated: you are completely liberated in every way.

original: tha snyad 'jug pa byed na ni //
analyzed: tha snyad 'jug pa byed na ni //
translated: When engaging in conventional usage,

original: 'jig rten gzhan yang bsam par gyis //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan yang bsam par gyis //
translated: consider the other world as well.

original: 'khrul pa yin gyi 'og tu 'khrul pa 'di nyid bla ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin gyi 'og tu 'khrul pa 'di nyid bla ste /
translated: It is an error, but it is better than the error that follows,

original: rab tu zhi ba dang mtho ris la sogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba dang mtho ris la sogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is in accord with peace, heaven, etc.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nor pa ni phan pa dang / skye bo dam pa la sogs pa nyams par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nor pa ni phan pa dang / skye bo dam pa la sogs pa nyams par byed pa yin no //
translated: Error in regard to passion, etc. is a cause of the loss of benefit, of the holy, etc.

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbye ba mtha' dag ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi stobs la brten pa rnam par rig pa tsam las tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dbye ba mtha' dag ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi stobs la brten pa rnam par rig pa tsam las tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the entire differentiation of the eye, etc. and passion, etc. is not different from mere representation, which is based on the power of beginningless predispositions.

original: des na mig la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa yang skye ba gzhan du yang mig la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na mig la sogs pa dang mi ldan pa yang skye ba gzhan du yang mig la sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even one who is not endowed with the eye, etc. will be endowed with the eye, etc. in another life.

original: de bas ni skye ba brgyud pa rnams su rnam pa 'di nyid yin pa dang thog ma med pa yang yin no //
