analyzed: de bas ni skye ba brgyud pa rnams su rnam pa 'di nyid yin pa dang thog ma med pa yang yin no //
translated: Thus, this is the mode in the succession of lives and it is beginningless.

original: ci srid nor pa rab tu zhi bar ma gyur pa de srid du ni de tha ma med pa yang yin no //
analyzed: ci srid nor pa rab tu zhi bar ma gyur pa de srid du ni de tha ma med pa yang yin no //
translated: And it is endless as long as error is not completely pacified.

original: mig la sogs pa bden pa nyid dam /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bden pa nyid dam /
translated: Even if the eye and so on were real,

original: phyi rol gyi don yin pa de lta na yang rang bzhin 'di thog ma med pa yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba thog mtha' med pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don yin pa de lta na yang rang bzhin 'di thog ma med pa yin pa'i phyir 'khor ba thog mtha' med pa nyid do //
translated: and external objects were real, still, since this nature is beginningless, cyclic existence would be beginningless.

original: gal te 'byung ba chen po'i khyad par sra ba nyid la sogs pa ni dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba chen po'i khyad par sra ba nyid la sogs pa ni dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: If the distinctive features of the great elements, such as solidity, are perceived,

original: des na de la khyad par yod pas 'byung ba chen po las byung ba yin yang ha cang thal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de la khyad par yod pas 'byung ba chen po las byung ba yin yang ha cang thal ba ma yin no //
translated: then since they are distinctive features, even though they arise from the great elements, the absurd consequence does not follow.

original: de'i phyir sra ba la sogs pa'i khyad par nyid sa bon gyi bdag nyid yin pas de nyid las srog chags 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir sra ba la sogs pa'i khyad par nyid sa bon gyi bdag nyid yin pas de nyid las srog chags 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since the distinctive features of solidity and so on are the nature of the seed, living beings arise from them.

original: 'di la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid med par 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid med par 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: We have already explained that the state of being cause and effect does not exist.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / gong du drod gsher la sogs pa'i //üîΩskye bo skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gong du drod gsher la sogs pa'i // skye bo skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i //
translated: Previously, we explained thatüîΩthe arising of beings from heat and moisture and so on

original: sa sogs cha de 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: sa sogs cha de 'ga' yang med //
translated: is not tenable.

original: de phyir thams cad sa bon bdag / sra ba nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi rnam par dbye bas ni /
analyzed: de phyir thams cad sa bon bdag / sra ba nyid la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi rnam par dbye bas ni /
translated: Therefore, all seeds are the self, because of the distinction of hardness, etc.

original: srog chags kyi rnam par dbye ba skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: srog chags kyi rnam par dbye ba skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The distinction of living beings is not produced by the distinction of hardness, etc.

original: thams cad du srog chags mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du srog chags mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because living beings are seen everywhere.

original: drod gsher la @50b sogs pa las skyes pa'i srog chags ni /
analyzed: drod gsher la @50b sogs pa las skyes pa'i srog chags ni /
translated: Living beings born from heat and moisture, etc.

original: rnam par dbye ba med par ma mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba med par ma mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: are not seen without distinction.

original: des na rnam par dbye ba ni sra ba la sogs pas byas pa ma yin pas sems pa'i mtshan nyid kyi las tsam 'ba' zhig lus pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam par dbye ba ni sra ba la sogs pas byas pa ma yin pas sems pa'i mtshan nyid kyi las tsam 'ba' zhig lus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the distinction is not produced by hardness, etc., only the karma that has the characteristic of volition remains.

original: 'on te srog chags kyi rigs sra ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can dmigs so zhes brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te srog chags kyi rigs sra ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can dmigs so zhes brjod na /
translated: But if you say that the living being is perceived as following after hardness, etc.,

original: de'i rigs mtshungs pa thams cad de'i rang bzhin gyi srog chags kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rigs mtshungs pa thams cad de'i rang bzhin gyi srog chags kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then all that is of the same kind would be of the nature of a living being.

original: bcags nas bzhag pa'i chu 'gyur ba gang yin pa de mtha' dag / de'i rang bzhin srog chags kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur bas srog chags rnams kyi mdog dbyibs mi 'dra ba ga las yin /
analyzed: bcags nas bzhag pa'i chu 'gyur ba gang yin pa de mtha' dag / de'i rang bzhin srog chags kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur bas srog chags rnams kyi mdog dbyibs mi 'dra ba ga las yin /
translated: And all the water that has been broken up and left behind would become the nature of that, the nature of living beings. So how could there be different colors and shapes among living beings?

original: 'di lta mgo dmar ba dang lus po ser ba la sogs pa'i chu'i srog chags gzhan mthong ba'i rnam pa de dag gang las yin /
analyzed: 'di lta mgo dmar ba dang lus po ser ba la sogs pa'i chu'i srog chags gzhan mthong ba'i rnam pa de dag gang las yin /
translated: How could there be the different appearances of other water creatures, such as those with red heads and yellow bodies?

original: nam yang pad sogs dbye ba des med par //
analyzed: nam yang pad sogs dbye ba des med par //
translated: The different parts of the lotus and so on are never absent.

original: de dngos sa bon las mthong 'dod dam ci //
analyzed: de dngos sa bon las mthong 'dod dam ci //
translated: Do you assert that they are seen from the seed?

original: srog chags dbye ba kun du sa bon las //
analyzed: srog chags dbye ba kun du sa bon las //
translated: All the different parts of the living being are from the seed.

original: des med las 'di nges par byed pa yin //
analyzed: des med las 'di nges par byed pa yin //
translated: This is definitely what makes them.

original: de'i phyir dbang sogs rang rigs la //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang sogs rang rigs la //
translated: Therefore, the sense faculties and so on

original: ltos med par ni 'byung yin na //
analyzed: ltos med par ni 'byung yin na //
translated: arise without depending on their own kind.

original: ci ltar gcig ni yongs gyur bzhin //
analyzed: ci ltar gcig ni yongs gyur bzhin //
translated: Just as one thing is transformed,

original: kun 'gyur khyad par med phyir ro //
analyzed: kun 'gyur khyad par med phyir ro //
translated: all are transformed, because there is no difference.

original: bsdu ba'o // gzhan yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i dbang po rnams /
analyzed: bsdu ba'o // gzhan yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i dbang po rnams /
translated: Moreover, the sense faculties that are based on the mental consciousness

original: rang gi 'bras bu byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi 'bras bu byed pa yin gyi /
translated: are the effects of their own kind.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid ni de la brten pa ma yin no //üîΩdes na yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid las /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid ni de la brten pa ma yin no // des na yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid las /
translated: But the mental consciousness itself is not based on them.

original: dbang po rnams 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang po rnams 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the sense faculties arise from the mental consciousness itself,üîΩnot from earth, water, and so on.

original: sa dang chu la sogs pa dag las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ston pa ni dbang rnams re re la gnod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sa dang chu la sogs pa dag las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ston pa ni dbang rnams re re la gnod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen one of the sense faculties is impaired‚Äù and so on teaches this.

original: yang na re zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni de chogs pa'i rang bzhin lus la skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na re zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni de chogs pa'i rang bzhin lus la skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Or, first, the mental consciousness is not born in the body, which is the nature of the elements.

original: dbugs 'byung rngub la sogs pa ni 'byung ba chen po yongs su gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung rngub la sogs pa ni 'byung ba chen po yongs su gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin te /
translated: In-breath and out-breath and so on are the nature of the transformation of the great elements,

original: pha ma'i sa bon rtsam las yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha ma'i sa bon rtsam las yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the result of the parents‚Äô semen and ovum.

original: 'khor ba pa yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin gyi dbang po la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba pa yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa yin gyi dbang po la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Also, the one who is in cyclic existence is the mental consciousness, not the sense faculties and so on.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / chang dang mtshams sbyor 'dod chags bral //
analyzed: 'di ltar / chang dang mtshams sbyor 'dod chags bral //
translated: The desire for alcohol, the desire for intercourse, the desire for freedom from attachment,

original: nyams dang 'chi 'pho skye ba rnams //
analyzed: nyams dang 'chi 'pho skye ba rnams //
translated: the desire for degeneration, the desire for death, the desire for transmigration, and the desire for birthüîΩare the mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam shes kho nar 'dod //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam shes kho nar 'dod //
translated: The mental faculty alone is so.

original: skye dang 'chi 'pho btang snyoms te //
analyzed: skye dang 'chi 'pho btang snyoms te //
translated: Birth, death, and the intermediate

original: zhes bshad do //üîΩdes @51a * //
analyzed: zhes bshad do // des @51a * //
translated: state are the equanimity of the mental faculty.

original: na yid 'khor ba pa yin gyi //
analyzed: na yid 'khor ba pa yin gyi //
translated: Therefore, the mental faculty is in cyclic existence,

original: 'byung ba la brten pa ni ma yin te //
analyzed: 'byung ba la brten pa ni ma yin te //
translated: but it is not based on the elements.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: For,

original: dbang rnams re re la gnod na //
analyzed: dbang rnams re re la gnod na //
translated: when one sense faculty is harmed,

original: yid blo la gnod yod ma yin //üîΩ'di 'gyur na ni de dag kyang //
analyzed: yid blo la gnod yod ma yin // 'di 'gyur na ni de dag kyang //
translated: the mental faculty is not harmed.üîΩIf it were to change,

original: 'gyur ba rtag tu mthong ba yin //
analyzed: 'gyur ba rtag tu mthong ba yin //
translated: then those would always be seen to change.

original: 'jigs pa dang mya ngan dang dga' ba dang / khro ba la sogs pa yid kyi blor 'gyur na /üîΩmig la sogs pa 'gyur bar mthong ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang mya ngan dang dga' ba dang / khro ba la sogs pa yid kyi blor 'gyur na / mig la sogs pa 'gyur bar mthong ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa yin no //
translated: If fear, sorrow, joy, anger, and so on were to change the mental faculty,üîΩthen the eye and so on would change because they are seen to change.

original: des na dang po'i skye bar yang de la brten pa nyid yin pa'i phyir srid pa gzhan 'grub bo //
analyzed: des na dang po'i skye bar yang de la brten pa nyid yin pa'i phyir srid pa gzhan 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, because it is based on the mental faculty, the mental faculty is established as the first birth and also as the establishment of another existence.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni lus la brten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni lus la brten pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the mental consciousness is not based on the body.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par 'gyur ba dbang po lnga'i tshogs kyi 'bras bu la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par 'gyur ba dbang po lnga'i tshogs kyi 'bras bu la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mental consciousness is based on the result of the collection of the five sense faculties.

original: gal te mig la sogs pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par 'gyur ba yin mod kyi de nyid las skyes so zhes bya ba ga las /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par 'gyur ba yin mod kyi de nyid las skyes so zhes bya ba ga las /
translated: If the eye, etc. are the transformation of the mental consciousness, how can it be said that they are born from that very mental consciousness?

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po me las rnam par 'gyur bar gyur pa dag / me nyid las skye ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po me las rnam par 'gyur bar gyur pa dag / me nyid las skye ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The things such as pots, which are the transformation of fire, are not born from fire itself.

original: bum sogs gzhan du mthong yin pa //
analyzed: bum sogs gzhan du mthong yin pa //
translated: The pot, etc. are seen as different,

original: des na de nyid las de min //
analyzed: des na de nyid las de min //
translated: therefore they are not born from that very thing.

original: dbang po de yi 'gyur ba las //
analyzed: dbang po de yi 'gyur ba las //
translated: From the transformation of the sense faculty,

original: rnam pa gzhan du mthong ba med //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du mthong ba med //
translated: one sees a different form.

original: dbang po la sogs pa thams cad ni //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa thams cad ni //
translated: All the sense faculties, etc.

original: gsal ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshon par dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gsal ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshon par dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: are perceived as characterized by clarity, etc.

original: bum pa la sogs pa ni mes byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba can nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ni mes byas pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba can nyid ma yin no //
translated: But the pot, etc. are not characterized by the transformation produced by fire.

original: des na bum pa la sogs pa ni dpe ma yin no //
analyzed: des na bum pa la sogs pa ni dpe ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the pot, etc. are not examples.

original: 'on te gal te yang da ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten par mthong du chug pa de lta na yang gzhan gyi tshe yang de lta bu nyid do zhes ga las she na /
analyzed: 'on te gal te yang da ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten par mthong du chug pa de lta na yang gzhan gyi tshe yang de lta bu nyid do zhes ga las she na /
translated: But even if it is seen that it is based on the present mental consciousness, how could it be that it is just like that at other times?

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩgal te me las de du ba //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / gal te me las de du ba //
translated: That is not so.üîΩIf smoke is seen from fire,

original: mthong yang de de nyid las ni //
analyzed: mthong yang de de nyid las ni //
translated: then it is said that it is from that fire itself,

original: gzhan tshe'ang yin zhes bya 'di la //üîΩmngon sum tshad ma 'ga' las med //
analyzed: gzhan tshe'ang yin zhes bya 'di la // mngon sum tshad ma 'ga' las med //
translated: but at other times,üîΩthere is no valid cognition of direct perception.

original: de'i phyir / dper na de ni ngo shes pas //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dper na de ni ngo shes pas //
translated: Therefore,

original: du ba me sngon can rtogs pa //
analyzed: du ba me sngon can rtogs pa //
translated: just as smoke is recognized as preceded by fire,

original: de bzhin dang po skye ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin dang po skye ba ni /
translated: so too the first arising

original: 'byung ba yid kyi 'gyur ba rtogs //
analyzed: 'byung ba yid kyi 'gyur ba rtogs //
translated: is recognized as a transformation of the mind.

original: skye ba dang po'i mig la sogs pa g-yer bag la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin gyi rang bzhin gyis rnam par 'gyur ba nyid du ngo shes pa de dag ni de lta bu nyid yin no zhes rtogs par rigs te /
analyzed: skye ba dang po'i mig la sogs pa g-yer bag la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin gyi rang bzhin gyis rnam par 'gyur ba nyid du ngo shes pa de dag ni de lta bu nyid yin no zhes rtogs par rigs te /
translated: The first arising of the eye and so on is endowed with liveliness and so on, and those who recognize it as such recognize it as just that.

original: dper na de'i 'bras bu lan cig 'ga' @51b zhig tu me sngon du 'gro ba can du mthong bas /
analyzed: dper na de'i 'bras bu lan cig 'ga' @51b zhig tu me sngon du 'gro ba can du mthong bas /
translated: For example, because the effect of fire is seen to be preceded by fuel in some place,

original: phyogs gzhan du de sngon du 'gro ba can nyid ngo shes pa dag / gzhan du ma yin no zhes rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phyogs gzhan du de sngon du 'gro ba can nyid ngo shes pa dag / gzhan du ma yin no zhes rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: it is understood that it is preceded by fuel in other places as well.üîΩTherefore:

original: de'i phyir / dbang po yid kyi shes pa las //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dbang po yid kyi shes pa las //
translated: The mental consciousness arises from the sense consciousnesses.

original: yid kyi shes pa'ang de las yin //
analyzed: yid kyi shes pa'ang de las yin //
translated: The mental consciousness also arises from that.

original: de las kyang yang der 'gyur phyir ;
analyzed: de las kyang yang der 'gyur phyir ;
translated: And because it arises from that,

original: / srid pa thog mtha' med par gnas //
analyzed: / srid pa thog mtha' med par gnas //
translated: cyclic existence is beginningless.

original: / gal te yid kyi blo yang dbang po rnam par 'gyur bas rnam par bsgyur bar bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: / gal te yid kyi blo yang dbang po rnam par 'gyur bas rnam par bsgyur bar bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the mental consciousness is not transformed by the transformation of the sense consciousnesses,

original: 'di ltar / mig sogs nyams par 'gyur na yid //
analyzed: 'di ltar / mig sogs nyams par 'gyur na yid //
translated: then why is it that when the eye and so on are impaired,

original: dman pa la sogs dag tu mthong //
analyzed: dman pa la sogs dag tu mthong //
translated: the mental consciousness is seen to be impaired?

original: des na ci phyir der brten pa //üîΩtshu rol mdzes min cis mi rtogs //
analyzed: des na ci phyir der brten pa // tshu rol mdzes min cis mi rtogs //
translated: Therefore, why is it not understood thatüîΩthe mental consciousness is supported by the sense consciousnesses?

original: 'di ni med de /
analyzed: 'di ni med de /
translated: This is not so.

original: bu sogs dbang po bral bas kyang //üîΩyid 'gyur ba ni yod pas na //
analyzed: bu sogs dbang po bral bas kyang // yid 'gyur ba ni yod pas na //
translated: Even when the sense faculties such as the eyes are absent,üîΩthe mental consciousness exists.

original: yid de la brten thob 'gyur te //
analyzed: yid de la brten thob 'gyur te //
translated: Therefore, the mental consciousness is supported by the sense consciousnesses.

original: nges pa gnyi ga la yang med //
analyzed: nges pa gnyi ga la yang med //
translated: Neither is certain.

original: gal te thams cad du bu la sogs pa'i mig la sogs pa 'gyur bas 'gyur ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: gal te thams cad du bu la sogs pa'i mig la sogs pa 'gyur bas 'gyur ba ma yin pas /
translated: If the eye, etc. of the son, etc. were to change, then the eye, etc. would not be unchanging.

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir bu la sogs pa'i mig la sogs pa ni rten ma yin /
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir bu la sogs pa'i mig la sogs pa ni rten ma yin /
translated: Since there is no certainty, the eye, etc. of the son, etc. are not the basis.

original: nges pa med pa'i de ni gnyi gar yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i de ni gnyi gar yang mthong ngo //
translated: Since there is no certainty, it is seen in both cases.

original: kha cig bdag nyid mig la sogs pa gyur kyang yid mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig bdag nyid mig la sogs pa gyur kyang yid mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Some say: Even though the eye, etc. change, the mind does not change.

original: de yang rten ma yin pa'i phyir dbang po dag ni rten ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang rten ma yin pa'i phyir dbang po dag ni rten ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Since that also is not the basis, the faculties are not the basis.

original: de lta na 'o na yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbang po rnams kyi rten yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbang po rnams kyi rten yin gyi /
translated: If that is so, then the mental consciousness is the basis of the faculties,

original: dbang po rnams ni yid kyi ma yin pa'i phyir yid rten med par thal lo //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni yid kyi ma yin pa'i phyir yid rten med par thal lo //
translated: but the faculties are not the basis of the mental consciousness. Therefore it follows that the mental faculty has no basis.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug car yang /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug car yang /
translated: The six consciousnesses of the eye, etc.

original: rten 'ga' zhig dang ni ldan par 'gyur bar dgongs so zhe na /
analyzed: rten 'ga' zhig dang ni ldan par 'gyur bar dgongs so zhe na /
translated: are considered to be possessed of some basis.

original: de ni med do thams cad la gdon mi za bar rten 'ga' zhig yod do zhes bya ba'i nges pa ni med do //
analyzed: de ni med do thams cad la gdon mi za bar rten 'ga' zhig yod do zhes bya ba'i nges pa ni med do //
translated: But that is not so. There is no certainty that there must be some support for everything.

original: 'on te mngon par zhen na de yang brjod pa ni //
analyzed: 'on te mngon par zhen na de yang brjod pa ni //
translated: But if you insist, then this is said:

original: de phyir blo gnas pa yi rten //
analyzed: de phyir blo gnas pa yi rten //
translated: The support of the mind is the cause of the faculties.

original: blo nyid la ni brten pa 'ga' //
analyzed: blo nyid la ni brten pa 'ga' //
translated: There is no support for the mind at all.

original: dbang po rnams kyi rgyu mtshan yin //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi rgyu mtshan yin //
translated: The faculties are the cause of the signs of the faculties.

original: de phyir blo las dbang po yin //
analyzed: de phyir blo las dbang po yin //
translated: Therefore, the faculties are from the mind.

original: de'i phyir blo gnas pa'i rten sems pa'i mtshan nyid las kyi ming can gang yin pa de nyid dbang po rnams kyi rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo gnas pa'i rten sems pa'i mtshan nyid las kyi ming can gang yin pa de nyid dbang po rnams kyi rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: Therefore, the support of the mind, which is characterized by volition and is called action, is the cause of the faculties.

original: 'o na de nyid mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la brten pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de nyid mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la brten pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But that is the support of the eye faculty and so on.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is explained:

original: de yang blo nyid la ni brten pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang blo nyid la ni brten pa yin gyi /
translated: That is the support of the mind itself,

original: dbang po la ni ma yin no //üîΩdbang po dag ni de'i @52a * //
analyzed: dbang po la ni ma yin no // dbang po dag ni de'i @52a * //
translated: but not of the faculties.

original: rten ma yin te /
analyzed: rten ma yin te /
translated: The faculties are not the support of that,

original: sems pa'i las dang bsam pa'i las zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa'i las dang bsam pa'i las zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that action is of two kinds: volition and action after having been willed.

original: sems pa ni 'di dang 'di'o zhes bya ba'i bdag nyid can yin la /
analyzed: sems pa ni 'di dang 'di'o zhes bya ba'i bdag nyid can yin la /
translated: The mind has the nature of being this and that.

original: de yang mtshams sbyor ba'i rang bzhin /
analyzed: de yang mtshams sbyor ba'i rang bzhin /
translated: And it is of the nature of a continuum,

original: blo snga ma nyid la brten nas 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: blo snga ma nyid la brten nas 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: arising in dependence on a prior mind.

original: lus la brten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus la brten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not dependent on the body.

original: de yang 'ga' zhig nyid dbang po rnams kyi rten yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang 'ga' zhig nyid dbang po rnams kyi rten yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, it is only some minds that are the support of the faculties,

original: thams cad ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad ni ma yin te /
translated: not all minds.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na dbang po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there are no faculties in the formless realm.

original: lus la srid pa dang bcas pa'i las kyis dbang po rnams skyed pa yin te /
analyzed: lus la srid pa dang bcas pa'i las kyis dbang po rnams skyed pa yin te /
translated: The faculties are produced by karma that is accompanied by craving for existence,

original: de la mngon par dga' ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mngon par dga' ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are associated with manifest craving.

original: mngon par dga' ba ni srid pa'i yul thob na skye ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba ni srid pa'i yul thob na skye ba yin no //
translated: Manifest craving arises when the object of craving is obtained.

original: des na blo las dbang po yin gyi dbang po rnams las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: des na blo las dbang po yin gyi dbang po rnams las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the faculties are derived from the mind, not from the faculties. This is the conclusion.

original: de'i phyir / yid nyid rgyu yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir / yid nyid rgyu yin pas /
translated: Therefore, the mind is the cause.

original: snga ma snga ma'i skye ba ni yid kyis 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma snga ma'i skye ba ni yid kyis 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: The prior birth is projected by the mind.

original: gal te nga'o zhes de ltar bdag tu rtog pa'i rang bzhin yid kyi blo las da ltar ba'i skye ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te nga'o zhes de ltar bdag tu rtog pa'i rang bzhin yid kyi blo las da ltar ba'i skye ba yin na /
translated: If the nature of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is the present arising of the mental cognition,

original: de lta na 'o na skye ba phyi ma yid ches pa'i rgyu ci yod /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na skye ba phyi ma yid ches pa'i rgyu ci yod /
translated: then what is the cause for having confidence in a future birth?

original: yid ni lus la brten pa'o zhes kyang ci ltar bshad ce na /
analyzed: yid ni lus la brten pa'o zhes kyang ci ltar bshad ce na /
translated: And how can it be said that the mind depends on the body?üîΩIn response, Aryadeva says:

original: smras pa / de 'dra ba zhig 'phan byed 'gyur //
analyzed: smras pa / de 'dra ba zhig 'phan byed 'gyur //
translated: It will be the support for that kind of birth.

original: de 'dra phyis kyang 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: de 'dra phyis kyang 'gyur ba yin //
translated: That kind of birth will occur again.

original: de yi shes pa phan 'dogs phyir //
analyzed: de yi shes pa phan 'dogs phyir //
translated: Because its consciousness benefits it,

original: yid ni lus la brten par bshad //
analyzed: yid ni lus la brten par bshad //
translated: the mind is said to depend on the body.

original: yid kyi blo de bdag tu 'dzin pas zin pa /
analyzed: yid kyi blo de bdag tu 'dzin pas zin pa /
translated: The mental cognition is associated with the conception of ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: ci 'dra ba zhig 'khor ba'i chu bor ltung ba rnams kyi thog ma med pa can gyi skye ba'i rgyun gyi 'phan byed du gyur pa /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig 'khor ba'i chu bor ltung ba rnams kyi thog ma med pa can gyi skye ba'i rgyun gyi 'phan byed du gyur pa /
translated: It is the support for those who have fallen into the river of cyclic existence and have been born in an unbroken succession of lives since beginningless time.

original: de 'dra ba ni phyis kyang 'phan byed du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni phyis kyang 'phan byed du 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: That kind of birth will occur again.

original: de bzhin du 'gyur ba ni mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gyur ba ni mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: It is not possible for it to be otherwise.

original: de nyid phyis kyang skye ba dang 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid phyis kyang skye ba dang 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it will be connected with birth again in the future.

original: gang zhig gang byed pa nyid rang bzhin dang / khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin de ni //üîΩde byed pa nyid de dper na bud shing rlon pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa /
analyzed: gang zhig gang byed pa nyid rang bzhin dang / khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin de ni // de byed pa nyid de dper na bud shing rlon pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa /
translated: That which is the nature of doing something and the nature of not being different

original: du ba skyed pa'i rang bzhin du khyad par med pa'i me gzhan bzhin no //üîΩde lta ma yin na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: du ba skyed pa'i rang bzhin du khyad par med pa'i me gzhan bzhin no // de lta ma yin na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: is that which does it, just as fire, which is the nature of producing smoke, is not different when connected with wet fuel, etc.üîΩIf it were otherwise, there would be no causal relation,

original: tha snyad med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tha snyad med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: and there would be no conventional usage.

original: 'gro ba spyod pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba spyod pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the world would not function.

original: 'on te lus dang sems ni /
analyzed: 'on te lus dang sems ni /
translated: But it was said that the mind and body

original: phan tshun rjes su byed pa yin no zhes gsungs pas na /
analyzed: phan tshun rjes su byed pa yin no zhes gsungs pas na /
translated: are mutually dependent.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yid kyang lus la brten par bstan pa ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩ@52b 'di la lan ni lus kyi rnam par shes pas phan gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yid kyang lus la brten par bstan pa ma yin nam zhe na / @52b 'di la lan ni lus kyi rnam par shes pas phan gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: So, didn‚Äôt the Lord teach that the mind depends on the body?

original: yid lus la brten par bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad kyi /
analyzed: yid lus la brten par bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad kyi /
translated: The answer is that the Lord taught that the mind depends on the body because the mind is dependent on the consciousness of the body.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la /
translated: But he did not teach that the mental consciousness depends on the eye consciousness, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa ltar dngos su na lus de'i rten ma yin no //üîΩde'i phyir rang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ltar dngos su na lus de'i rten ma yin no // de'i phyir rang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi /
translated: It is not the basis of that body, as are the eyes, etc.

original: yid ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la brten pa ma yin /
analyzed: yid ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la brten pa ma yin /
translated: Therefore, the mind that apprehends it does not depend on the sense faculties, such as the eyes,

original: lus la brten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lus la brten pa ma yin te /
translated: nor does it depend on the body.

original: 'di ni rigs mtshungs pa'i yid la brten pa nyid yin par rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ni rigs mtshungs pa'i yid la brten pa nyid yin par rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable that it depends on a mind of the same type,

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na'ang de yod pa'i phyir dang / de srid par yang ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na'ang de yod pa'i phyir dang / de srid par yang ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists in the formless realm and because it is taught that it exists there.

original: yang na dbang po med par blo mi 'byung mod //
analyzed: yang na dbang po med par blo mi 'byung mod //
translated: Or, it is true that the mind does not occur without sense faculties.

original: de lta na yang 'jig rten pha rol med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'jig rten pha rol med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But still, it is not the case that there is no other world,

original: phan tshun rten pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun rten pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is mutual dependence.

original: de bshad pa ni /üîΩgal te'ang dbang po med pa'i blo //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni / gal te'ang dbang po med pa'i blo //
translated: This is explained:

original: ma yin de yang de med phyir //üîΩde lta'ang phan tshun rgyu mtshan nyid //
analyzed: ma yin de yang de med phyir // de lta'ang phan tshun rgyu mtshan nyid //
translated: Even if the mind does not exist without sense faculties,üîΩthat mind does not exist without the other world.üîΩThus, there is mutual dependence.

original: des kyang phan tshun rgyu can yin //
analyzed: des kyang phan tshun rgyu can yin //
translated: Therefore, there is mutual dependence.

original: ci ltar khyod kyis de ltar mthong pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ci ltar khyod kyis de ltar mthong pa'i phyir //
translated: Why is it not so?

original: dbang po'i bdag nyid can gyi lus med par blo mi 'gyur ro zhes khas blangs pa de bzhin du dbang de dag kyang /
analyzed: dbang po'i bdag nyid can gyi lus med par blo mi 'gyur ro zhes khas blangs pa de bzhin du dbang de dag kyang /
translated: But you accept that the mind does not occur without the body, which is the support of the sense faculties.

original: yid kyi blo med par ma yin no zhes khas blangs bar bya ste /
analyzed: yid kyi blo med par ma yin no zhes khas blangs bar bya ste /
translated: Likewise, you should accept that the sense faculties do not occur without the mental faculty.

original: khas len pa'i rgyu de ltar mthong ba nyid ni mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas len pa'i rgyu de ltar mthong ba nyid ni mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason for accepting this is that the seeing of both is the same.

original: de lta yin dang phan tshun rgyu nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang phan tshun rgyu nyid yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, it would follow that they are mutually causal.

original: gnyig rgyu mtshan phan tshun phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyig rgyu mtshan phan tshun phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because both are mutually supportive reasons.

original: phan tshun gyi rgyu can dag gi tshogs pa yang /
analyzed: phan tshun gyi rgyu can dag gi tshogs pa yang /
translated: The collection of mutually causal things

original: tshogs pa gzhan las skye ba can yin no //üîΩtshogs pa des kyang snga ma dang phyi ma'i lus dang sems dag dbus kyi gnas skabs bzhin du /
analyzed: tshogs pa gzhan las skye ba can yin no // tshogs pa des kyang snga ma dang phyi ma'i lus dang sems dag dbus kyi gnas skabs bzhin du /
translated: arises from another collection.

original: phan tshun gyi rgyu can yin par shes par bya'o /
analyzed: phan tshun gyi rgyu can yin par shes par bya'o /
translated: That collection should be understood to be mutually causal, like the body and mind in the middle period.

original: gal te lus nyid yid kyi blo'i rten yin gyi de ni lus kyi ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te lus nyid yid kyi blo'i rten yin gyi de ni lus kyi ma yin na /
translated: If the body is the support of the mental faculty but not vice versa,üîΩthen the mental faculty would not exist in the formless realm.

original: de'i phyir rim pa dang ldan pa'i lus las blo 'byung ngam /
analyzed: de'i phyir rim pa dang ldan pa'i lus las blo 'byung ngam /
translated: Therefore, does the mind arise from a body that is endowed with stages?üîΩ

original: 'on te rim pa can ma yin pa las 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te rim pa can ma yin pa las 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, does the mind arise from a body that is sequential or from a body that is not sequential?

original: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: de la re zhig rim can ma yin pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig rim can ma yin pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it does not arise from a body that is not sequential,üîΩbecause:

original: 'di ltar / rim can min las rim can min //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rim can min las rim can min //
translated: The nonsequential is not sequential.

original: khyad par can min ltos pa'ang med //
analyzed: khyad par can min ltos pa'ang med //
translated: The nondistinctive is not dependent.

original: lus las rim gyis blo 'byung na //üîΩde yi rim pa gsal bar byed //
analyzed: lus las rim gyis blo 'byung na // de yi rim pa gsal bar byed //
translated: If the mind arises sequentially from the body,üîΩthen the sequence of the body would be the cause of the sequence of the mind.

original: yid kyi blo 'di ni rim pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi blo 'di ni rim pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: This mental cognition is sequential.

original: @53a * // de lta ma yin na nga'o zhes rang gi rnam pa 'dzin pa na /
analyzed: @53a * // de lta ma yin na nga'o zhes rang gi rnam pa 'dzin pa na /
translated: If it were not so, then when it apprehends the aspect of ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rang nyid kyi rang bzhin mtha' dag 'dzin pa'i phyir skye ba ril 'dzin par thal lo //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba rang nyid kyi rang bzhin mtha' dag 'dzin pa'i phyir skye ba ril 'dzin par thal lo //
translated: it would follow, absurdly, that it would apprehend the entire continuum of births, because it would be apprehending the entire nature of the past, present and future.

original: 'on te gnas skabs mi 'dzin par snga phyi khyab pa rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gnas skabs mi 'dzin par snga phyi khyab pa rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: If you say that it does not apprehend the continuum, but rather realizes the past and future as being pervaded by the present,üîΩthen,

original: gnas skabs gzung ba ma yin na //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzung ba ma yin na //
translated: if it does not apprehend the continuum,

original: ji ltar gnas skabs can rtogs 'gyur //üîΩkhyab bya gzhan bzung med par ni //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas skabs can rtogs 'gyur // khyab bya gzhan bzung med par ni //
translated: How could one understand it as having a temporal stage?üîΩBecause without the apprehension of the other, the pervaded,

original: khyab byed rtogs pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab byed rtogs pa med phyir ro //
translated: there is no apprehension of the pervader.

original: gal te byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gnas skabs ma rtogs na /
analyzed: gal te byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gnas skabs ma rtogs na /
translated: If one does not understand the temporal stage because of the past and future,

original: khyab bya ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab bya ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then because of the non-apprehension of the pervaded,

original: ji ltar khyab par byed pa de bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar khyab par byed pa de bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: how could one understand it as the pervader?

original: de'i rang bzhin du ma rtogs kyang de ltar 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du ma rtogs kyang de ltar 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though one does not understand it as having that nature, it is not so.

original: de nyid dam gzhan nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni rtogs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de nyid dam gzhan nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni rtogs pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is the understanding itself that posits it as identical or different.

original: gal te 'di khyab byed nyid du ma rtogs na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te 'di khyab byed nyid du ma rtogs na de'i tshe /
translated: If one does not understand it as the pervader, then at that time

original: de rang bzhin gzhan du rtogs so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rang bzhin gzhan du rtogs so zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one understands it as having a different nature.

original: des na da la dus gzhan du gnas pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na da la dus gzhan du gnas pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it does not exist at another time,

original: dus gzhan dang ldan par skye bar rtogs pa gzhan med pa yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan dang ldan par skye bar rtogs pa gzhan med pa yin no //
translated: there is no other understanding of its arising as having another time.

original: des na rim pa dang ldan par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: des na rim pa dang ldan par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, there is the understanding of it as having a sequence.

original: de'i phyir rim can ma yin pa las rim can 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rim can ma yin pa las rim can 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, a sequence does not arise from a non-sequence.

original: gal te rgyu rim pa can ma yin mod /
analyzed: gal te rgyu rim pa can ma yin mod /
translated: Even if the cause is not sequential,

original: 'bras bu de lta bu nyid du 'gyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba ga las /
analyzed: 'bras bu de lta bu nyid du 'gyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba ga las /
translated: how can the effect be made to be just like that?

original: rgyu las tha mi dad pa kho na ni 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu las tha mi dad pa kho na ni 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: The effect is not exactly the same as the cause,

original: mi 'dra ba yang mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba yang mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because a difference is seen.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te rim min las 'bras na //
analyzed: gal te rim min las 'bras na //
translated: If the effect arises from a non-sequence,

original: de yi tshe nyid mtha' dag 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi tshe nyid mtha' dag 'gyur //
translated: then all time would be just that.

original: de'i tshe yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i tshe yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is completely fulfilled at that time,

original: gzhan gyi tshe ni de med nyid //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe ni de med nyid //
translated: at another time it would not exist.

original: gal te 'bras bu'i dus su bzung na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu'i dus su bzung na /
translated: If it is grasped at the time of the effect,

original: de lta na de 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na de 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: in that case it would be without effect.

original: de'i tshe ma rtogs pa ni de'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ma rtogs pa ni de'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: At that time, what is not realized is not its cause.

original: gal te de rtogs na ni /
analyzed: gal te de rtogs na ni /
translated: If it is realized,

original: gcig yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i mthar thug pa rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i mthar thug pa rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is one, it would be destroyed at the end of realization.

original: de nyid kyi tshe zhig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe zhig par 'gyur te /
translated: At that very time it would be destroyed.

original: de lta na de rim pa can ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na de rim pa can ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would not have a sequence.

original: des na zhig pa'i 'og tu 'bras bu mi 'byung ba nyid dam byung ba na yang 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: des na zhig pa'i 'og tu 'bras bu mi 'byung ba nyid dam byung ba na yang 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, an effect does not arise after the destruction of its cause, or if it does arise, it is not the effect of that cause.

original: 'on te rim gyis rtogs pas rgyu rim pa can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rim gyis rtogs pas rgyu rim pa can yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the cause has a sequence because the effect is realized sequentially,

original: da lta na rim pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: da lta na rim pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: then it is not without a sequence.

original: sngon po nyid du rtogs pa ni sngon po ma yin pa ma @53b yin no //
analyzed: sngon po nyid du rtogs pa ni sngon po ma yin pa ma @53b yin no //
translated: The realization of blue is not the realization of non-blue.üîΩOr,

original: yang na / rgyu las 'bras bu de yi ni //üîΩrang bzhin skye bar mi brjod kyi //
analyzed: yang na / rgyu las 'bras bu de yi ni // rang bzhin skye bar mi brjod kyi //
translated: The effect does not arise from the causeüîΩwith the nature of that effect.

original: 'on te rgyu dang 'bras nyid ni //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu dang 'bras nyid ni //
translated: But if you say that the cause and effect

original: rjes 'gro ldog pa las zhe'o //
analyzed: rjes 'gro ldog pa las zhe'o //
translated: are due to the presence and absence of the effect,

original: 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra ba yang 'bras bu kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu dang mi 'dra ba yang 'bras bu kho na yin te /
translated: An effect that is not similar to the cause is still an effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i mtshan nyid yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the nature of cause and effect is characterized by the presence and absence of the effect following the presence and absence of the cause.

original: gang la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa de ni rgyu ma yin zhing 'bras bu ma yin na /
analyzed: gang la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa de ni rgyu ma yin zhing 'bras bu ma yin na /
translated: If something does not have presence and absence of the effect following the presence and absence of the cause, it is not a cause and it is not an effect.

original: gang yang de lta bu nyid kyi rgyu yod pa na mi 'byung ba /
analyzed: gang yang de lta bu nyid kyi rgyu yod pa na mi 'byung ba /
translated: And if the cause of that exists, it does not occur.

original: de ni rgyu'i dus su byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni rgyu'i dus su byed pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: It does not function at the time of the cause.

original: gal te de med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba tsam gyis 'bras bur 'gyur ba ma yin no //üîΩde yang gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di gar dgos she na /
analyzed: gal te de med na mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba tsam gyis 'bras bur 'gyur ba ma yin no // de yang gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di gar dgos she na /
translated: If it is not the case that it does not occur when that does not exist, it is not an effect merely by the fact that it does not occur when that does not exist.üîΩBut if it is necessary that it occur when that exists, how is that necessary?

original: gal te de yod kyang med na //üîΩmed na med pa nyid gang las //
analyzed: gal te de yod kyang med na // med na med pa nyid gang las //
translated: If it does not exist even when that exists,üîΩhow can it be that it does not exist when that does not exist?

original: de med pa 'di de med pas byas so zhes pa de gang las /
analyzed: de med pa 'di de med pas byas so zhes pa de gang las /
translated: How can it be that this nonexistence of that is due to the nonexistence of that?

original: gal te 'di rgyu nus pa nyid yod pas na yang mi 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'di rgyu nus pa nyid yod pas na yang mi 'gyur na ni /
translated: If it does not occur even when the cause of that has the ability to produce it,

original: de'i rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be the cause of that.

original: de med pa 'di de med pas byas so zhes bya ba 'di yang ga las rtogs /
analyzed: de med pa 'di de med pas byas so zhes bya ba 'di yang ga las rtogs /
translated: How can it be ascertained that this nonexistence of that is due to the nonexistence of that?

original: ji ltar de'i gnas skabs nyid kyi rgyu yod pa na rang nyid mi 'byung ba de bzhin du de med na yang rang nyid mi 'byung ba yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i gnas skabs nyid kyi rgyu yod pa na rang nyid mi 'byung ba de bzhin du de med na yang rang nyid mi 'byung ba yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as it does not occur by itself when the cause of its existence exists, so it does not occur by itself when that does not exist,

original: rang dbang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dbang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is independent.

original: rgyu'i gzhan dbang yin na ni /
analyzed: rgyu'i gzhan dbang yin na ni /
translated: If it were dependent on a cause,

original: nus pa yod na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;üîΩ/ don rnams dngos po med pa ni //
analyzed: nus pa yod na gdon mi za bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro ; / don rnams dngos po med pa ni //
translated: then if the cause exists, it would certainly arise.

original: rang nyid 'gyur ba yin na yang //
analyzed: rang nyid 'gyur ba yin na yang //
translated: Even if non-things are transformed,

original: dngos po gzhan gyi dbang yin phyir //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan gyi dbang yin phyir //
translated: since they are dependent on other things,

original: ci ltar rgyu las 'byung ma yin //
analyzed: ci ltar rgyu las 'byung ma yin //
translated: how could they not arise from causes?

original: dngos po med pa ni rgyu med pa can yin pa'i phyir rang nyid 'gyur ro zhes rigs kyi /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni rgyu med pa can yin pa'i phyir rang nyid 'gyur ro zhes rigs kyi /
translated: Since non-things are causeless, it is reasonable to say they transform by themselves.

original: dngos po ni rgyu'i gzhan gyi dbang yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po ni rgyu'i gzhan gyi dbang yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But since things are dependent on other causes,

original: rgyu nus pa yod na mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di mi rigs so //
analyzed: rgyu nus pa yod na mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di mi rigs so //
translated: it is unreasonable to say that if the cause has the ability, they do not transform.

original: gal te 'bras bu med pa rang dbang yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu med pa rang dbang yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say that since the nonexistence of effects is independent,

original: rgyu yod pa nyid na med par rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu yod pa nyid na med par rigs so zhe na /
translated: it is reasonable that if the cause exists, the effect does not exist,

original: de lta na 'o na de med na med do zhes de med pa rgyu med pas byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na de med na med do zhes de med pa rgyu med pas byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: then in that case, if it does not exist when that exists, it is not produced by the nonexistence of that, which is causeless.

original: de ci ltar 'di'i 'bras bur 'gyur /
analyzed: de ci ltar 'di'i 'bras bur 'gyur /
translated: So how could it be the effect of that?

original: des na rang nyid mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rang nyid mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore it does not arise by itself.

original: gang zhig gang gis zlog par byed pa ma yin pa de ni /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gis zlog par byed pa ma yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is not stopped by something else

original: des nges par bya ba ma yin pa des na ji ltar rang nyid mi 'byung ba de bzhin du 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: des nges par bya ba ma yin pa des na ji ltar rang nyid mi 'byung ba de bzhin du 'byung ba yin te /
translated: is not necessarily done by that, so how could it arise in the same way that it does not arise by itself?

original: des na 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not an effect.

original: gang gi tshe rgyu yod na 'byung ba nyid yin pa de'i tshe ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu yod na 'byung ba nyid yin pa de'i tshe ni /
translated: When it is the case that something arises when its cause exists,

original: rang gi ngang gis 'gags pa yin @54a * //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'gags pa yin @54a * //
translated: it is naturally ceased.

original: yang ; skad cig gzhan dang gzhan skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang ; skad cig gzhan dang gzhan skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because it produces another moment,

original: de med pa yin na rgyun chad pa yin pas /
analyzed: de med pa yin na rgyun chad pa yin pas /
translated: it does not exist, and so the continuum is severed.

original: rgyu dang 'brel pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'brel pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is related to the cause.

original: de'i phyir rim can ma yin pa las rim can 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rim can ma yin pa las rim can 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, a sequential effect does not arise from a nonsequential cause.

original: 'on te rim pa dang ldan pa'i lhan cig byed pa ltos pa'i rim can ma yin pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'on te rim pa dang ldan pa'i lhan cig byed pa ltos pa'i rim can ma yin pa las kyang /
translated: But if a sequential effect arises from a sequential assemblage of causes that are not sequential,

original: 'bras bu rim pa can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu rim pa can du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then a sequential effect would arise from a nonsequential cause.

original: de yang med de /üîΩkhyad par can min ltos pa'ang med //
analyzed: de yang med de / khyad par can min ltos pa'ang med //
translated: That is also not the case.üîΩThere is no dependence on that which is not distinct.

original: khyad par bsgrub tu med pa ni //
analyzed: khyad par bsgrub tu med pa ni //
translated: That which is not established as distinct

original: khyad par thob par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: khyad par thob par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to attain the special qualities,üîΩ

original: 'ga' la'ang ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' la'ang ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: and it is not dependent on anything else in order to obtain its distinction.

original: de la ni khyad par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni khyad par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it has no distinction.

original: khyad par yod na yang mi rtag pa nyid do //üîΩkhyad par tha dad par khas len na yang khyad par de la ltos pa'i /
analyzed: khyad par yod na yang mi rtag pa nyid do // khyad par tha dad par khas len na yang khyad par de la ltos pa'i /
translated: If it had a distinction, it would be impermanent.

original: 'bras bu de nyid las 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu de nyid las 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Even if you accept that there is a distinction, the effect that depends on that distinction would arise from that distinction,

original: rtag pa de las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa de las ni ma yin no //
translated: but not from the permanent thing.

original: khyad par de de'i yin no zhe na ma yin te /üîΩkhyad par zhes bya ba khyad par du byed pa'am /
analyzed: khyad par de de'i yin no zhe na ma yin te / khyad par zhes bya ba khyad par du byed pa'am /
translated: If you say that the distinction belongs to it, no.

original: khyad par gyi rtogs par byed pa yin //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rtogs par byed pa yin //
translated: A distinction is that which distinguishes or that which causes the understanding of a distinction.

original: khyad par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not cause the distinction,

original: de la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has no distinction.

original: khyad par las khyad par du 'gyur ba'i phyir de nyid mi rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par las khyad par du 'gyur ba'i phyir de nyid mi rtag pa yin no //
translated: If it were to become a distinction through a distinction, it would be impermanent.

original: tha dad pa ni thal ba snga ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni thal ba snga ma yin no //
translated: The previous consequence applies if it is different.

original: 'on te khyad par du rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par du rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is the cause of the understanding of the distinction,

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: that is also not tenable.

original: khyad par med la khyad par gyi //
analyzed: khyad par med la khyad par gyi //
translated: But if there is no difference,

original: rtogs pa skye bar 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: rtogs pa skye bar 'gyur ma yin //
translated: then the cognition will not arise.

original: gal te de ltar yin na ni //
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na ni //
translated: If it were like that,

original: 'khrul phyir 'bad pa don med do //
analyzed: 'khrul phyir 'bad pa don med do //
translated: then effort would be pointless, because of error.

original: khyad par med par rtogs na ni //
analyzed: khyad par med par rtogs na ni //
translated: If there is cognition without difference,

original: rtag ces de ni khong du chud //
analyzed: rtag ces de ni khong du chud //
translated: then it is understood to be permanent.

original: khyad par la 'khrul min na yang //
analyzed: khyad par la 'khrul min na yang //
translated: But if there is no error with respect to difference,üîΩhow could there be a valid cognition of the permanent?

original: rtag la tshad ma ga la zhig / gal te khyad med rtogs na ni //
analyzed: rtag la tshad ma ga la zhig / gal te khyad med rtogs na ni //
translated: If there is cognition without difference,

original: de lta na ltos ci ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de lta na ltos ci ltar 'gyur //
translated: then how could there be dependence?

original: gang phyir bya med de la ni //
analyzed: gang phyir bya med de la ni //
translated: Because it is without activity,

original: khyad par yang ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: khyad par yang ni yod ma yin //
translated: it also does not have difference.

original: de la khyad par yod na ni //
analyzed: de la khyad par yod na ni //
translated: If it had difference,

original: de la ltos zhes 'thad pa yin //üîΩ'di yi don du ltos so zhes //
analyzed: de la ltos zhes 'thad pa yin // 'di yi don du ltos so zhes //
translated: then it would be tenable to say that it depends on that.üîΩThe worldly convention ‚ÄúIt depends on this‚Äù

original: 'jig rten pa yi tha snyad yod //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi tha snyad yod //
translated: exists for that purpose.

original: de'i phyir khyad par med pa la ltos pa yod pa ma yin no zhes rigs so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par med pa la ltos pa yod pa ma yin no zhes rigs so ;
translated: Therefore it is reasonable to say that there is no dependence on that which is without difference.

original: / lus las rim gyis blo 'byung na //
analyzed: / lus las rim gyis blo 'byung na //
translated: If the mind arises gradually from the body,

original: lus kyi rim pa rtogs par byed //
analyzed: lus kyi rim pa rtogs par byed //
translated: then the body‚Äôs stages are understood.

original: de lta min na gang gis de'i //
analyzed: de lta min na gang gis de'i //
translated: If it were not like that,

original: rim pa byas pa de rgyur gsal //
analyzed: rim pa byas pa de rgyur gsal //
translated: then by what is the body‚Äôs stage produced? That would be clear.

original: nyams myong snga ma snga ma las //
analyzed: nyams myong snga ma snga ma las //
translated: The mind is engaged in the later experience

original: yid kyi blo de 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: yid kyi blo de 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: on the basis of the earlier experience.

original: de las gzhan las de yang zhes //
analyzed: de las gzhan las de yang zhes //
translated: And that is also based on something else,

original: thog ma med par gnas pa @54b yin ;
analyzed: thog ma med par gnas pa @54b yin ;
translated: and so on, without beginning.

original: /'on te blo snga ma la ltos pa'i lus rim gyis blo skyed par byed na de lta yin na /
analyzed: /'on te blo snga ma la ltos pa'i lus rim gyis blo skyed par byed na de lta yin na /
translated: But if the body gradually produces the mind in dependence on the earlier mind, then in that case,

original: lus khyad par du 'gyur dgos so //
analyzed: lus khyad par du 'gyur dgos so //
translated: the body must change.

original: des na blo dang lhan cig pa'i lus kyi rgyu ni /üîΩde lta bur gyur pa nyid kyi lus snga ma snga ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na blo dang lhan cig pa'i lus kyi rgyu ni / de lta bur gyur pa nyid kyi lus snga ma snga ma yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the cause of the body together with the mind isüîΩthe earlier body that is just like that.üîΩIf that is so,

original: de lta yin dang / skad cig snga ma snga ma ni //
analyzed: de lta yin dang / skad cig snga ma snga ma ni //
translated: then the earlier moment is the cause of the later moment,

original: skad cig re rer sngon med de'i //
analyzed: skad cig re rer sngon med de'i //
translated: which did not exist in the earlier moment.

original: rgyu yin de yi phyir na rgyu //
analyzed: rgyu yin de yi phyir na rgyu //
translated: Therefore, the cause is

original: thams cad tshe na mthong ba nyid //
analyzed: thams cad tshe na mthong ba nyid //
translated: seen in every case.

original: blo'i lhan cig byed pa can gyi lus snga ma snga ma phyi ma phyi ma'i rgyu yin par dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid dbus kyi gnas skabs bzhin du skye ba dang 'chi ba dag tu yang thams cad kyi tshe rgyu yin no zhes bya bar 'grub
analyzed: blo'i lhan cig byed pa can gyi lus snga ma snga ma phyi ma phyi ma'i rgyu yin par dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid dbus kyi gnas skabs bzhin du skye ba dang 'chi ba dag tu yang thams cad kyi tshe rgyu yin no zhes bya bar 'grub
translated: The body that is the cooperative condition of the mind is observed to be the cause of the later body, and it is established that it is the cause of birth and death at all times, just as it is the cause of the middle period.

original: po ; / gzhan du na khyab pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir 'ga' yang gang gi yang rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: po ; / gzhan du na khyab pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir 'ga' yang gang gi yang rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, since the pervasion would not be understood, nothing would be the cause of anything,

original: thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no other method.
